column3: Behavior Health Technician - Applied Behavior Analysis
column4:
$1,000 Sign on Bonus Part-Time

Are you looking to help children, youth, and young adults in your own community?

Children's Behavioral Health is one of the largest providers of behavioral and mental health services in the state of Pennsylvania.  We are part of Pathways, one of the largest national providers of mental and behavioral health services!  With their support and training, we offer meaningful supervision and growth, work/life balance, and great benefits!   

Children’s Behavioral Health (CBH) specializes in providing direct services and case management to children, adolescents and adults with behavioral and medical health needs, as well as those supervised by government subsidized programs.  Our teams work to create healthier communities in 18 counties throughout Pennsylvania, within schools, homes, and throughout the community.   Within each area, clients have access to a broad range of social and behavioral services to meet their needs.  We have full time and part time openings, including daytime and evening work!

Behavior Health Technician - Applied Behavior Analysis

Perks we offer for full time employees:
 ·       Competitive Hourly pay
·       401k Plan (offered to Part time as well)
·       Health, Dependent and Transportation Flexible Spending Accounts
·       Perks @ Pathways national discounts on shopping, travel, entertainment, Verizon, etc
·       DailyPay- get paid before pay day!
·       Training, Development and Continuing Education Credits for licensure requirements
·       Opportunities for advancement! As we grow, you grow with us!

What you'll be doing: 

You will provide one-to-one direct mental health interventions to children and adolescents between the ages of 2-24, who are confronted with serious, identified, emotional and/or behavioral disturbances. With the support and guidance of the Behavioral Consultant, and the focus of the client's treatment plan, you will aid in  improving independent age-appropriate functioning to levels which require less or no service intervention.  This position can work in the schools, daycare, home, or community, based on the client's prescribed need.  We offer trainings online and in-person, in addition to weekly/bi-weekly supervision

What your day will look like:

  • Follow the prescribed treatment plan and provide behavioral and treatment interventions and consequences to the client
  • Set boundaries with clients and their families to prevent dependency upon your services
  • Provide support to parents and adult professionals involved with the client
  • Educate and train parents/young adults to utilize these skills , providing positive reinforcement 
  • Travel to the clients' home/school/service location daily
  • Provide culturally aware and competent service provision
What we're looking for:  New hires must meet 1of the following and able to complete/provide PA Criminal, Child Abuse, and FBI Clearances 
  • Certified as BCaBA, RBT, or BCAT.
  • Behavior Health Certification or Behavior Analysis Certification from an organization that is accredited by the National Commission for Certifying Agencies or the American National Standards Institute
  • High School diploma or equivalent and completed the 40 hr RBT Training (RBT Task List) Certification (or ability to complete this within the first 10 days of hire- you will be paid for this training time)
  • Minimum of 2 years experience providing Behavioral Health services
Children's Behavioral Health is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, ancestry, union membership, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, AIDS or HIV status, disability, veteran status or any other protected characteristic.

Mechanical Drafter / Designer
 
About the company:
 
Industrial company that designs and produces rotary damper drives, damper actuators, pneumatic and typical electric actuators for heavy industrial applications.   Products that maximize the potential of control systems.
 
About the job:
  • Position requires onsite work for 40 hours/5 days a week.
  • Directly perform engineering design documentation encompassing part drawings, solid modeling, drafting, detailing and bill of materials generation and engineering request investigations.
  • Assist sales with the design of new and re-use of existing valve mounting specifications.
  • Prepare outline dimension drawings and wiring diagrams.
  • Maintain and update documentation databases.
  • Provide document support to other departments as needed.
 
Required:
  • Associates Degree.   Must be from two-year college / technical school or equivalent experience 3+ years in an engineering environment.
  • 15+ years of related design and drafting experience.
  • Proficiency in SolidWorks and DraftSight CAD software.
  • Skilled in PC usage and associated software including Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, etc.…).
  • Solid understanding of drafting techniques and familiarity with engineering terminology.
  • Experience in managing CAD files via PDM software.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to coordinate projects, meet deadlines, and multi-task.
  • Predictable and reliable attendance is required.
 
Physical Requirements
  • Ability to lift 50 lbs.
  • Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
  • Work environment included regular exposure to manufacturing area that require the use of personal protective equipment such as safety glasses and hearing protection.

Position Overview:
Supports company quality standards by checking and measuring parts and assemblies for compliance with job documents.

Principal Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Reads blue prints and travelers to understand what aspect of the job needs to be inspected.
  • Determine the proper measurement tool required depending on the feature and tolerance being measured.
  • Measure and/or check the parts with the appropriate measuring tools to confirm they are within specification.
  • Sign off traveler when parts are acceptable.
  • When appropriate follow instructions or procedures for measurement.
  • Install fixtures, load parts and run metrology programs on CMM’s.
  • Fill out quality forms as required.
  • Maintain open communication with the CNC operator, supervisor and management regarding jobs status, problems or any changes to work in process.
  • Be observant for changes in the parts being measured to notice trends of declining quality or indications of problems.
  • Maintain ISO forms during free time.
  • Maintains safe and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations.
  • Keep work areas organized and clean.
  • Documents actions by completing production and quality forms.
  • Other duties as needed or required.
Supervision Received:
Regular Supervision. A quality technician can only measure parts after being trained for in-process or first piece inspection.
 
Qualifications & Skills:
  • Conscientious, organized and methodical work approach.
  • Proficiency using micrometers, calipers and other common shop measuring tools.
  • Understanding of the application and limitation of quality department tools.
  • Ability to read and interpret blue prints and work instructions.
  • Ability to do basic math and an understanding of x, y, z coordinates and geometry.  Proficiency in trigonometry is a plus.
  • Adequate eyesight and dexterity to perform duties and responsibilities.
  • Ability to work on multiple assignments at one time.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Windows and a basic understanding of MS Office applications. 
Education / Experience:
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Previous quality experience required ( 2 years )
Prior CMM experience preferred

Department:  Hospice

Status:  Part Time Flex  48-64 hours per pay period

Shift: Days:  Position has flexibility in scheduling: 3 (8) hour days/ week or 4 (6) hour days/ week. This position may have opportunity to cross train into other units 

 Bonner General Health Community Hospice is the only Not for Profit Community Hospice serving Bonner and Boundary Counties.
Our Hospice provides care for an average daily census of 20 patients in their homes.  Our Hospice team is very close knit, providing highly personalized, compassionate care in all they do.  Our team are highly dedicated, skilled, and compassionate coming from many different back grounds offering a wide range of skills and work experience.

Our interdisciplinary team includes a Physician Medical Director, a Nurse Practitioner, Nurse Case Managers, Certified Nurses Aides, Social workers, Chaplains, Volunteers, a Volunteer and Bereavement Coordinator, Hospital pharmacists and Therapists, our amazing office support team, as well as support from ancillary departments through our organization who all strive to provide excellence in quality compassionate care with a high degree of professionalism, knowledge and skill. Our nurses provide availability to our patients and their families  24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

Our department is looking for an individual who can work autonomously while functioning as a integral part of our team centered patient care. Someone with a passion for end of life care, who can critical think through variety of situations and who provide the highest compassion and caring support for our  patients and their families, our volunteers and our community. This position coordinates our Bereavement programs, provides some direct patient care in MSW Hospice role, provides Community education and coordinates fundraising events for Hospice.

If you are compassionate, have strong interpersonal skills, a great sense of teamwork and collaboration, demonstrated leadership and program development skills, this position may be for you!  Consider joining  North Idaho's premier Hospice team.
  
 

 
Education:  Graduate of accredited nursing aide program

Experience:   CNA experience one (1) year

Licensure/Certification: Current State of Idaho Nursing Aide license; current BLS certification (AHA);

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
* Minimum of 1-3 years electro-mechanical assembly experience. Mechanical assembly with electronic/electrical safety knowledge is acceptable.
* Ability to read blueprints and schematics; read and identify proper components and color schemes.
* Must present excellent workmanship standards.
* Must have good verbal communication skills.
POSITION SUMMARY:
Responsible for complex and diversified assembly of a variety of products in which mechanical drawings or work instructions are provided. Intricate fitting, adjusting, and aligning of a considerable number of parts (involving close tolerances and interrelated factors) are required to complete products, units, or sub-assemblies. Hand tools and usage of machines will be required to perform the assembly. Follows schedule provided by SAP and management.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
* Assembles and/or wires complex equipment following blueprints, models, and model prints. Skilled adjusting, fitting, and aligning are required within close tolerances.
* Follows work cell procedures or mechanical drawings and product structures.
* Sets up, operates, and maintains basic production machines such as component engravers, presses, crimpers, riveting or encapsulation machines.
* Is flexible and able to perform many operations on product in and outside of home department.
* Uses hand and power tools as required.
* Builds harness assemblies.
* Light usage of computers to monitor and report job status and component availability. Will need to be able to open prints or work instructions from system and write to excel or SAP databases.
* May perform thru-hole PCB assembly.
* Performs related duties as assigned by Supervisor.
* Works overtime as required.
* Strives to meet prescribed quality standards in an ISO environment.
* Follows proper use of PPEs to promote a safe work environment and performs 5S steps to ensure clean, hazard-free, and efficient work area.

Job Summary

We are growing and searching for a highly experienced Certified Public Accountant or EA / Tax Manager to join our team. Our ideal candidate has CPA or equivalent experienced tax manager. Our company goal is to focus on building a successful team, with family-oriented, high values and trust.

Responsibilities:

  • Requires excellent tax and accounting knowledge, as well as good client relations skills.
  • Review individual, corporate, partnership, and trust tax returns.
  • Identify industry/client tax issues and situations and assist with tax research and planning.
  • Advise and assist in resolving IRS and state issues and responding to governmental correspondence and audits.
  • Comprehensive year-end tax planning and closeouts for loan-out corporations and analyze payroll withholding requirements for state and federal.
  • Supervise and review work of other team members with accounting responsibilities as necessary.

Pay: $100,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Our Client is an MEP (mech, elect, plumb) + Structural design firm based in NJ/NYC that focuses design work on ultra-high end residential renovation and new construction projects in New York City, the Tri-State area, and sometimes further reaching. We work with top tier architects on completely custom home designs. Our work entails the engineering of all systems in coordination with an architectural program ranging in size from apartments to estates.
Our office environment is casual, but the work is challenging and fast-paced. We all engage in collaboration both within and outside the office to develop engineering designs of the highest quality for discerning clients. Our system designs must meet strict operational and acoustic performance criteria established at the onset of each project. If you find elegant and efficient system design engaging, then you may be an ideal fit.

Required Experience:
2+ years engineering design with field experience

 Candidate Qualifications:
  • CAD and REVIT literate
  • Familiarity with Trane Trace, Carrier HAP or similar HVAC load calculation software
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in designing HVAC systems for residential, commercial, retail, or institutional projects including:  Load calculations, equipment selection, ductwork/piping sizing and distribution, drawing and detail development, controls strategy, etc…
  • Experience with geothermal system design is desirable
  • Excellent spoken and written English skills
  • BSME required with a desire to obtain EIT and PE
  • Must be familiar with standard international code versions for review and interpretation ○  Specific NYC Code experience a plus
  • Self-motivated with an appetite for further education and personal growth
  • Passion for elegance in system design
  • Experience with commissioning a plus
  • Candidate must be comfortable interacting with architects, contractors, and other project consultants both in person and via remote means
  • An ideal candidate will be ready to be an integral design member from project inception through complete construction and close-out

Job Responsibilities:
  • Design of HVAC, plumbing, and fire protection sprinkler systems (though experience with HVAC as a baseline is a must)
  • Site survey of existing conditions at each project onset
  • Design air conditioning, heating, ventilation, humidification, dehumidification, boiler, chiller, VRF, domestic plumbing systems (water and waste), and fire protection sprinkler systems
  • Prepare calculations, design documentation, drawing layouts, riser diagrams, equipment selections, specifications, and details
  • Coordinate with architects and peripheral consultants to integrate all system designs. Prepare reports that might detail:
                           ○    Evaluation of alternative systems
                           ○    Evaluation of existing conditions
                           ○    Construction progress
  • Review of shop drawings and submittals against design intent
  • Inspect installed conditions against design requirements
  • Position requires approximately 15-20% field time
    Benefits:
    Job training, full health/dental/vision insurance, 401k plan with matching, paid holidays, vacation, and birthday off!
    Salary:
    Based on experience
    Summary:
    If you want to engineer unique private properties with an opportunity to learn and grow in your professional career, apply today.

Job Purpose :

The Project Engineer will be responsible for supporting the Project Manager in the management of both internal and external projects.  This includes but is not limited to assisting with customer interfacing, quotations, execution of project deliverables, and project tracking.

We are looking for a competent Caregiver to care for our clients in a professional and compassionate manner. It’s an often-demanding job as you will have to be taking care of other people. But it can also be very satisfying and rewarding, since people who are ill, injured, disabled or elderly are thankful for high quality assistance. The ideal candidate will be patient and friendly with excellent communication skills. You should be able to follow instructions and perform a variety of tasks to help clients.

You'll work one-on-one with your clients to enhance their quality of life, we focus on building relationships and strive to make great matches between Clients and CAREGivers because to us, it's personal. 

Benefits for Working for Right at Home:

·         Flexibility! We work with you to set your schedule

·         Ability to learn new skills

Responsibilities

  • Establish and implement process control activities to include capability studies and gage R&R studies.

Job Summary
We are seeking an experienced Shift Manager to join our team! As a Shift Manager, you will be responsible for the restaurant’s operational performance during your shift. You will supervise staff, and assign duties to ensure the restaurant runs smoothly. The ideal candidate is a strong leader with restaurant experience. 


Responsibilities: 
  • Train and manage employees and assign duties as needed
  • Lead team in providing exceptional customer service
  • Resolve customer complaints gracefully and with tact
  • Adhere to all health and safety rules and regulations
  • Provide sales and productivity reports to upper management
  • Maintain appropriate inventory levels, reorder and restock when necessary
  • Arrange to have shifts covered (e.g. when employees take time off


Qualifications: 
  • High school diploma/GED
  • Previous food service experience
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Office, restaurant management software, and POS software
  • Ability to remain calm and thrive under pressure
  • Excellent management and leadership skills
  • Strong communication and problem-solving skills

We are looking for a competent Caregiver to care for our clients in a professional and compassionate manner. It’s an often-demanding job as you will have to be taking care of other people. But it can also be very satisfying and rewarding, since people who are ill, injured, disabled or elderly are thankful for high quality assistance. The ideal candidate will be patient and friendly with excellent communication skills. You should be able to follow instructions and perform a variety of tasks to help clients.

You'll work one-on-one with your clients to enhance their quality of life, we focus on building relationships and strive to make great matches between Clients and CAREGivers because to us, it's personal. 

Benefits for Working for Right at Home:

·         Flexibility! We work with you to set your schedule

·         Health Insurance

·         Paid time off

·         Professional grow (Trainer or Leader)

·         Referral program (GAS GIFTCARD INCLUDED)

·         PAID training and development

·         Extremely positive work environment

·         Employee discount programs

·         Access to leadership

·         Recognition, celebrations, and great team interactions!

·         You choose your geographic area - no long commutes!

·         COVID Safety - We provide PPE and screen clients

·         Ability to learn new skills

·         Weekly pay

 

Responsibilities

·         Help clients take prescribed medication

·         Assist clients with ambulation and mobility around the house or outside (doctor’s appointments, walks etc.)

·         Help clients with physical therapy exercises

·         Plan and prepare meals with assistance from the clients (when they are able)

·         Do the client’s shopping

·         Perform light housekeeping duties that clients can’t complete on their own

·         Be a pleasant and supportive companion

·         Report any unusual incidents

·         Act quickly and responsibly in cases of emergency

Must Haves:

·         •Must be 18 years of age

·         Must be able to read, write, speak, and understand English as needed for the job

·         Must have reliable consistent means of communication

·         Must possess a valid driver’s license and current automobile insurance

·         You must have a high school diploma or GED

·         Must have the ability to pass a full employment background check

Director of Sales

The Director of Sales is responsible for planning and implementing sales, developing sales programs, establishes and maintains relationships with clients, guides and works with the Operations team for execution.

Job Description

  • Oversees and motivates the sales team daily.
  • Creates annual budgets, sets sales goals, and communicates monthly expectations.
  • Meets and exceeds monthly, quarterly and yearly financial goals.
  • Negotiates and closes contracts.
  • Makes decisions with the venues best interest in mind.
  • Seeks out and develops relationships with local industries (i.e. corporations, hotels, non-profits, etc).
  • Establishes a reporting timeline and format to report corporate sales trends, bookings, sales recaps and department productivity.
  • Coordinates networking mixers and events.
  • Establishes, develops, and maintains positive business relationships with industry influencers.
  • Works closely with front and back of house to coordinate all upcoming events.
  • Works closely with VIP to convert corporate events into nightclub table sales.
  • Works closely with Special Events on operations and event execution.
  • Trains new employees, including, but not limited to, Sales Managers, Special Events Managers, Restaurant and Nightclub Managers.
  • Off-site visits, and networking with clients to develop and maintain solid business relationships.
Experience/Skills

  • Microsoft Office knowledge, financial planning and strategy, budget tracking, marketing concepts, brand positioning, people management, competitive analysis, forecasting, client relationships, creativity.
  • 4-5 years of experience in management.
  • 1-2 years of experience in nightlife/fine dining experience preferred.

We are looking for a knowledgeable, experienced construction foreman to coordinate operations and assist with managing workers at our numerous construction sites. As the liaison between workers and supervisors, the foreman will be the key person in charge of overseeing the completion of the project with a keen awareness of material expenses, permits, and employee safety. The ideal applicant will have a solid background in the field, strong leadership skills and the ability to direct the work of others and make quick decisions. The ideal applicant will also be willing to step in and assist the team with whatever tasks that may be necessary to complete the project on any given day, whether that be pulling wire/cable, assisting with physical labor, troubleshooting, etc. The construction foreman must be well-organized and strongly focused on safety above all and at all times.

Foreman Duties and Responsibilities

  • Oversee and ensure that all safety rules are being followed at all sites at all times
  • Pull cable, help team with installation, and do physical tasks when necessary or assigned to them
  • Coordinate with Project Manager to assign daily tasks according to priorities and plans, adjusting as necessary due to weather, supply delivery, and personnel
  • Ability to delegate responsibilities and individual projects to the crew and contractors.
  • Provide for adequate resources and staffing to meet safety needs, regulations, best practices, laws and project schedule
  • Emphasis on the safe use of tools, machinery, and equipment including training on safety gear, helmets, and procedures
  • Develop and oversee quality standards on all sites
  • Assist with monitoring and managing project budgets on all sites
  • Resolve conflicts or miscommunication that may happen on-site quickly and amicably
  • Report project status to supervisors, site engineers and officials regularly
Foreman Requirements and Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree
  • Extensive knowledge of construction best practices, equipment maintenance, and use, and OSHA guidelines
  • Understanding of use and maintenance of electrical systems
  • Ability to read drawings, plans, and blueprints and convey this information to others
  • Excellent organizational and leadership skills
  • Ability to communicate and report effectively
  • Aptitude in math and strong problem-solving abilities

column3: CNA Health Unit Coordinator/Acute Care/Full Time
column4:
Department: Acute Care

Status:  Full Time Days

Shift: Days: 
 
    The Acute Care Unit at Bonner General Health offers the opportunity to provide care to a very diverse patient population. We care for patients of all ages who demonstrate a wide variety of healthcare needs. We are a team of committed, compassionate staff who offer excellent care and make a strong difference in the lives of our patients every day. We believe in providing the best care possible and advocating for the needs of our patients.

   Staff on the Acute Care Unit have the opportunity to spend time with our patients, the ability to use, build and retain nursing skills, and the gift of working in a friendly, team oriented environment. We care for people with any number of illnesses, surgical needs and/or medical needs. We welcome staff with considerable nursing experience as well as staff who are new to the nursing profession and have a desire to learn and grow. We work closely with the Bonner General Health Intensive Care Unit and offer the occasional opportunity to work and learn in that environment also. If you value strong, patient centered care, appreciate variety and want to be part of a great team we would welcome your application.
 

 
Education:  Graduate of accredited nursing aide program

Experience:   Hospital experience preferred; CNA experience one (1) year

Licensure/Certification: Current State of Idaho Nursing Aide license; current BLS certification (AHA);

Nightlife Manager $65-75K + benefits – Nightlife focused
 
About Us 
 
Carver Road Hospitality is opening two venues at the new Civilian Hotel. The two floor, 150-seat Rosevale Kitchen & Cocktail Room, will feature a chef-driven & seasonally influenced menu prepared with regionally sourced ingredients. On the rooftop, Starchild will showcase spectacular sunset views to the post-work crowd along with a concise menu of creative small bites. 
 
We are looking for a dynamic individual to support the team with all nightlife managerial duties
 
 
Immediate start date

About You
 
  • You are a natural leader, steadfast, positive, and reliable
  • You have a passion for hospitality and service for others
  • You lead by example and exhibit integrity in all that you do
  • You are looking to stretch and grow in your career
  • You have prior nightlife hospitality experience 
     
     As an important member of our team, you’ll receive:

  • Competitive salary commensurate with experience
  • Full Health, Dental, and Vision insurance
  • Paid Time Off to support you in having an active life outside of work

At Nothing Bundt Cakes, the Guest Services Representative sweetens up the place,
setting the mood and making a stop in the bakery an event worth posting about. You’ll
get to play party planner by helping guests order the right cake for their celebrations
and making sure their orders go off without a hitch. You’ll make everyone feel
welcome, and you’ll create an environment of generosity, happiness, and joy in your
community.

But it gets even better:

We close early so you can enjoy your evenings.
We offer flexible work schedules.
We’re keeping it casual. T-shirts and sneakers are where it’s at!
Cake discounts. Yummm!
You don’t have to be 18 to work here, so students can join us.
This job is fun. It’s literally a piece of cake!
This is a great place to make new friends!
You’ll get trained. Not only on crafting cake, but on growing your career.
We love to celebrate and bring joy to the community.

Apply now. Joy is the job.

The Executive Chef is responsible for the execution of all culinary business operations and management of all back of house staff including, hiring, training, and onboarding. The Executive Chef is also responsible for all back of house administrative processes. Banquet and Catering experience with Hotels is desired.

 
Duties and Responsibilities 

Demonstrate the Core Values of Gin & Luck:

  • Connection - We build relationships through intuition and empathy.
  • Professionalism - We are ambassadors of Gin & Luck, inside and outside our businesses.
  • A.B.K. - We execute with focus and work to completion.
  • Excellence - We will forever be chasing excellence; it is a pursuit without end.
  • Contagious Joy - When we're having fun, it emanates out and influences our work and the people around us. 
     
Teamwork & Communication:

  • Provide a strong sense of leadership, including both FOH and BOH hospitality and communication – lead by example.  
  • Maintain a strong sense of ownership of entire culinary offerings provided by Gin & Luck.
  • Execute Culinary offerings with a high level of precision and care.
  • Provide inspiration and creative influence to Culinary Team in keeping with G&L Core Values.
  • Maintain culinary management in all special projects, kitchen operations and menu development and banquet execution
  • Maintain effective communication with General Managers, Culinary Director and all staff of Hotel and Death and Company
  • Maintain a reasonable response time for all communication – minimal of a confirmation (by email, slack, text or call) same day with a timeline in regard to a full response. 
  • Contribute to public relations and press inquiries in a professional manner as directed by Company. This may include verbal, written, radio, video or online interviews, and photos. All press inquiries made directly to you must be referred to Company.
  • Maintain sanitation standards and procedures that comply with health and legal regulations with the advice of the Company.
  • Maintain a reasonable schedule with flexible availability.  On days or nights off, be on call and ready to manage and respond to emergency situations. 

Service Standards:

  • Assist in oversight of kitchen staff programming (service and hospitality standards) to ensure all duties are met and exceeded.
  • Provide creative and technical influence to Culinary Team in keeping with Gin & Luck Core Values.
  • Maintain patron satisfaction by monitoring, evaluating, and auditing food, beverage, and service offerings; build relationships with preferred patrons; maintain good community relations.
  • Directly oversee culinary staff development (service and hospitality standards) to ensure all duties are met and exceeded; handle escalated staff issues.
  • Oversee training of all kitchen management positions.
  • Be capable of covering any position in the kitchen at any time.
Administrative Duties: 

  • Lead hiring for all culinary positions throughout the company with assistance from General Manager.
  • Assist in the writing and execution of business policies, SOP’s, kitchen related job descriptions, quizzes, and disciplinary initiatives.
  • Directly responsible for all Culinary Administration duties including cost control, payroll/labor control, menu development, and scheduling with General Manager.
  • Maximize Company profitability with a target margin of 20%; monitor financial controls established by Culinary Director and General Manager.
  • Design and implement Company policies and standard operating procedures (SOP); evaluate and improve such policies and SOP. 
  • Maintain sanitation standards and procedures that comply with health and legal regulations with the advice of the Company.
  • Communicate all facility maintenance and improvements needs to the General Manager. Manager’s approval is needed for all initiatives over $250.  
  • Work proactively with Event Sales, Event Manager and General Manager to oversee all event coordination and execution.
  • Produce and perform staff reviews annual and biannually – dependent on position
 
Reporting Structure

  • Executive Chef report to the property GM, and Culinary Director.
Physical Demands
  • The physical demands for this position are seeing, hearing, speaking, reaching, frequently lifting up to 25 pounds, occasionally lifting up to 50 pounds, sitting, standing, for 4 to 8 hours, bending, and moving intermittently during working hours. These physical requirements may be accomplished with or without reasonable accommodations.
Compensation and Benefits

Salary: The annual salary of the Executive Chef is $70,000.
 
Healthcare: The Executive Chef is eligible to participate in provided healthcare offerings provided by Gin & Luck. 
 
Cellphone: Death & Co Denver LLC will provide and cover up to $100 of related carrier costs for the Chef de Cuisine’s cell phone, to be expensed by the employee for reimbursement.
 
Bonus: The Executive Chef is entitled to a variable bonus program held against operating profit targets, as approved by the board. The Executive Chef target bonus is equal to 5% of their annual salary, or $3500.00, assessed on a quarterly basis. Each bonus will be granted if the measurables are within a certain range of the planned budgets, as outlined in the Appendix A. Budgets will be set 30 days before the new year, with the exception of new projects, which will be set 30 days before any commitment (security deposit, etc). Bonuses will roll over, allowing the capture of the average % of the target. For example, if three quarters are down but the company ends at 100% of the target, the full bonus will be paid out after the last quarter of the year. Bonuses are paid 45 days after the end of the previous quarter. Due to COVID-19, bonuses are on pause until further notice. We are hopeful to reinstate them as soon as possible and will be sure to communicate with you once they are available again. 
 
Pay schedule: The Executive Chef will be paid according to Death & Co Denver LLC’s bi-weekly established pay schedule.
 
 
The duties of this position may change from time to time. Gin & Luck reserves the right to add or delete duties and responsibilities at their discretion. This job description is intended to describe the general level of work being performed. It is not intended to be all-inclusive.

At Mad Science, we pay you to have fun!

Mad Science Birthday Party Instructor (Part Time)
   
Compensation and benefits
  •  $60 to $70 per party (1.5 to 2 hours)
  •  Additional incentives including birthday party tips ($20 to $100)   
  •  Rewarding and enjoyable job
  •  Flexible hours 
Job Summary
 We are looking for fun and outgoing instructors to make kids birthdays very special. This is primarily weekend job.
 
What are we looking for in a Mad Scientist?
  • You must enjoy and have some experience working with elementary aged children
  • Positive energy and a sense of humor
  • Reliable personal transportation
Company Overview
Mad Science is the world’s leading provider of fun science programs for elementary-ages children. Our mission is to inspire children through science, sparking lifelong imagination and curiosity. For over 30 years, we have delivered unique, hands-on science experiences for children through our after-school programs, birthday parties, workshops, special events, and summer camps.
 
 Check our website: https://sandiego.madscience.org/parents-birthdayparties
 Questions? Email info@sdmadscience.org

column3: Executive Director Happy Valley Morning Pointe
column4:
EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR Happy Valley Morning Pointe

Our Senior Living/Memory Care Company has an upcoming opening for Executive Director at one of our communities! We are looking for compassionate leader who creates meaningful experiences for both our residents and staff. The ideal candidate is someone who leads by example, maintains a welcoming and encouraging environment, and builds relationships with everyone who touches our community.

Role


The Executive Director is responsible for the general management of the community including: business management, marketing and revenue management, staffing and retention, compliance management, and community management.

  • Lead by example with genuine relationships and a “resident first” mindset
  • Develop trust with residents and their families by being a person of integrity
  • Ensure revenue achieved and expenses managed in order to meet expected NOI
  • Lead management team to create culture that reflects our core values
  • Ensure exceptional care and overall experience is provided for community resident
  • Promote positive image and build relationships to ensure favorable community relations
  • Assure compliance with company standards and local, state and federal regulations.
 

Licensure and Certification Requirements

  • Current/active state Administrator license as required by the state
  • Candidates must have a bachelor’s degree or a minimum of 5 years of professional experience in senior services, social work, management, or health care
  • Leadership and management experience required
  • Valid driver’s license and proof of insurability required
 

Expectations and Responsibilities

  • Responsible for the supervision and quality control for all aspects of operations including marketing, staffing, resident services, budgeting, safety and building maintenance.
  • Develop and implement a marketing strategy for the community that reflects service opportunities, competition, potential market area changes, and which maximizes census and revenues.
  • Develop positive relationships on behalf of the Company with government regulators, residents, families, other area health care providers, physicians and community at large.
  • Monitor resident, resident family, and associate satisfaction
  • Assure compliance with local, state and federal regulations.
  • Notify management of any visits by state officials
  • Give prompt attention to any cited deficiencies.
  • Manage turnover and solidify current and future staffing through development of recruiting sources, and through appropriate selection, orientation, training, staff education and development.
  • May work beyond normal business hours, on weekends, and in other positions temporarily, when necessary.
  • Subject to call-back during emergency conditions (e.g., severe weather, evacuation, post-disaster, etc.)

Job Summary
We are seeking a talented Bookkeeper to join our team. In this role, you will work closely with the Accounting department to maintain accurate financial records and ensure the company’s compliance with all legal requirements. Your responsibilities will include recording and verifying transactions, bringing the books to the trial balance stage, and completing tax forms. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, highly organized, and has a strong understanding of best practices in accounting.

  • Enter financial data and transactions
  • Verify the accuracy of transactions that have been entered
  • Prepare trial balance 
  • Analyze budgets and other financial information
  • Process accounts payable and accounts receivable
  • Complete required tax forms
 
Qualifications

  • Previous experience as an accountant, bookkeeper, or similar position
  • Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP)
  • Good with spreadsheets, experienced in Microsoft Excel, QuickBooks, and basic accounting systems
  • Strong mathematical and analytical skills
  • Excellent attention to detail, time management, and communication skills

QC / Maintenance **ENTRY LEVEL!!

Location: Hollywood, CA

Schedule: Monday to Friday - 6:00am to 2:30pm

Pay: $16.05 (minimum wage)

Time Frame: 3 - 4 months.

Does not require much experience or skills, just someone with a good attitude, active and reliable!

Responsibilities

  • Provide work to all auto machines
    • Constantly check up on workload for machines
    • Remove boxes of work completed and place in its proper place
    • Provide inks/pallets to operators when requested
    • Maintain all pallets of production organized
  • Clean squeegees/flood bars
  • Maintain floor clean
  • Throw out trash bags
  • Ensure the ink room is always organized and clean/ organize new incoming supplies

**THIS POSITION RECEIVES $10/HR PLUS TIPS!!** 
Your job as a Bartender is an important role because you create a wonderful experience for each bar guest and ensure the highest level of service.  This job is for You if you have a "Passion for Perfection" and a "Passion for Service", this job is for You!  The Bartender makes sure each guest has a great experience by meeting their every need by serving food and beverages to guests at the bar, according to the hotel standards.  This job aims to mix and serve alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks to patrons of bar and dining room guests. The bartender also ensures that the guests calling in orders, picking up orders, and bar clientele are completely satisfied during their visit.
As a Bartender, you will:       
  • Sets up bar at the beginning of the shift, following the Pre-Shift Procedures
  • Make sure the name of the Manager on Duty is posted on the grease board/chalkboard at the bar
  • Replenishes supplies as needed during the shift
  • Greets customers within 30 seconds
  • Mixes beverages according to Recipes
  • Fills all drink orders for servers
  • Strives to build regular bar clientele by obtaining and using customers’ names
  • Prepares all drinks by following company recipes and specifications
  • Obeys and enforces all state laws including checking the ID of any guest appearing to be under the age of 30
  • Handles all inside take-out orders placed
  • Orders or requisitions liquors and supplies
  • Slices and pits fruit for garnishing drinks
  • Rotates stock using the FIFO method
  • Accurately rings in food and drink orders to the POS system
  • Exchanges money for servers
  • Serves food to guests in the bar area
  • Follows sanitary practices for food handling, general cleanliness, and maintenance of bar area
  • Keeps work station clean and set up at all times during business hours
  • Follows weekly maintenance cleaning of the bar area
  • Complies with all health and safety regulations
  • Complies with State laws for serving Alcoholic Beverages
  • Performs other duties as required.
Fundamental Requirements
Prior hotel, conference center, restaurant, military, and other similar bartending and food service experience preferred. To be successful, you will need basic English communication skills. This job requires standing and walking 100% of the time, regularly bending, pushing, pulling, carrying, and the ability to perform repetitive motions for the entire shift. This job requires you to be able to push, pull, or lift a minimum of 30lbs. We administer pre-employment background checks.

Deliver Memorable Customer Experiences And
Produce Exceptional Results For Our Owners

Primrose School of Grand Peninsula, located at 2430 N. Grand Peninsula Drive, Grand Prairie, TX 75054, is seeking a Director for our private preschool. This position will ensure adherence to our mission of bringing the best and most trusted in early childhood education and child care services to families we serve. We are seeking an individual who is energetic, organized, a problem solver, and possesses great communication skills. This individual needs to be passionate about early childhood education and dedicated to the success of our next generation.
 
We are an accredited private preschool that provides a premier educational child care experience. We offer year-round programs for children from infant through elementary-aged school age.
 
Primary Responsibilities:
  • Overall responsibilities for managing and overseeing all aspects of a private preschool to include health and safety, enrollment and financial wellness, staffing, training and retention, campus management, and delivery of high-quality education and care 
  • Maintain strong relationships with our families, faculty, and vendors
  • Manage budgets/forecasts, licensing and marketing initiatives
  • Cultivate and maintain a safe and enjoyable culture while working in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to perform all essential functions for each position in the School, including, but not limited to, other Leadership Team positions, teacher, Food Service Teacher, and Bus Driver. 
 
Desired skills and experience: 
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Early Childhood Education, Primary Education, or in related field
  • 3-5 years of Director experience in a licensed child care facility
  • Strong background in state licensing regulations, staffing, enrollment and budget management
  • Demonstrated highly-effective organizational, time management, and multitasking skills
  • Demonstrated responsibilities in overseeing all preschool operations including human resources, quality assurance and facility operations
  • A proven track record in hiring, developing and retaining staff
  • Strong commitment to building positive relationships with families and the community
 
 
Each Primrose school is a privately owned and operated franchise, and the respective Franchise Owner is the employer at each school. Franchise Owners set their own wage and benefit programs, which vary among Franchise Owners. Primrose Schools and its Franchise Owners are equal opportunity employers. Positions and position titles vary by school.

Position Summary
The Food & Beverage Manager is hospitality-focused and is our daily operations manager with a focus
on our restaurant food and beverage programs in all venues with the Civilian Hotel.

Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Oversees food & beverage program in conjunction with GM.
  • Prepares weekly/bi-weekly beverage orders to maintain pars while anticipating volume
    fluctuation.
  • Possesses knowledge of all front-of-house job duties.
  • Possesses in-depth knowledge of all operational systems in use including but not limited to
    payroll, inventory and purchasing.
  • Ensures that all mechanical systems are in good working order and compliant with all federal,
    state, and local ordinances.
  • Delivers exemplary hospitality for internal and external guests.
  • Responds quickly to all guest feedback.
  • Maintains Bar staffing pars. Interview and hire accordingly in conjunction with AGM/GM
  • Oversees that training programs are in place for employees to update their knowledge on
    relevant industry practices.
  • Oversees that the venue is compliant with all federal, state, and local laws and regulations and
    company policies.
  • Foster a positive work environment.
  • Monitors staff performance.
  • Educates self with full understanding of all food and beverage products.
  • Works in conjunction with AGM to create and maintain continuing product education.
  • Effectively schedules Bar personnel to established staffing pars.
  • Maintain a clean work environment that exceed health code standards.
  • Protects establishment, guests, and employees by adhering to and overseeing that the
    Department of Health and company sanitation standards are followed.
  • Maintain professional appearance standards as directed in the Employee Handbook.
  • All other duties as assigned.
Our Ideal Candidate:
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience as a Food & Beverage Manager in full service, moderate to high volume restaurants. 
  • Proficient with computers (Microsoft Products), POS and technology.
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule inclusive of varying shifts such as days, evenings, weekends,
    and holidays.
As an important member of our team, you’ll receive:
  • Full Health, Dental, and Vision insurance
  • Paid Time Off to support you in having an active life outside of work.

WE DO URGENT CARE DIFFERENTLY

  • On-Demand Care: Immediate Care for Injuries, Illness, Primary Care and Wellness
  • A Winning Culture: Supportive Teammates, Transparent Leadership, and Non-Bureaucratic Decision Making
  • Profit Sharing: All Employees Work Together, See the Results, and Share in the Success
 

Revenue Cycle Manager: Maintains and oversees the effective and efficient operation of the billing team including coding, save finalizing, chart auditing, and charge entry processes. Coordinates and supports the day-to-day operations of the billing team. Coordinates coding and charge entry processes with other departments. This is a working supervisor position. Managing all aspects of full-cycle medical billing. 

Education and Experience:

  • High School Diploma or equivalent required 
  • Associate Degree or Certification in a related field, preferred 
  • Previous supervisory experience for a Billing/Coding team, required
  • Minimum 3 years previous billing and/or coding experience, required
  • Experience in multi-specialty coding, preferred 
Pay and Benefits:

  • Starting at $60k
  • Generous employee profit-sharing bonuses paid quarterly
  • Full-Time Benefits Eligible
  • Health services provided by AFC Portland for employees and dependents
  • 401k at 1 year, with 3% Employer Contribution
  • 3 Weeks of Paid Time Off 
Schedules and Location: Future Hybrid Opportunity

  • Full-time, ~40 hrs/week
  • Monday - Friday 7:30 am - 4 pm
  • Traditional office setting in Tigard, OR
    Headquarters office 8060 SW Pfaffle St. Tigard, OR 97223
 

What We Need: We are seeking a highly organized and proficient Revenue Cycle Manager to oversee and promote teamwork within our Billing department. Must have strong communication skills, work well under pressure, prioritize effectively, and possess exceptional leadership qualities. The ability to train and educate a team, research and resolve problems, and work at a rapid pace are important attributes. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Oversees and monitors Managers and their team members including but not limited to; Billing & Coding team and Save & Finalize team.
  • Evaluates and ensure overall goals and expectations are being met in an accurate and timely manner to create overall success in all areas of revenue cycling.
  • Regularly meets and provides feedback on performance for each member in weekly 1:1’s.
  • Implements improvements to organizational structure and workflows as needed.
  • Oversees team members' schedules, time cards, call-outs, and PTO requests.
  • Regularly participates in continued education, webinars, seminars, etc., and shares knowledge with staff to help enhance skills and keep up-to-date with the latest policies.
  • Participates in staffing needs for the Billing department by conducting interviews, coordinating the training of new hires, and performance evaluation tracking. 
  • Ensures visit queues are completed and closed, and troubleshoots claims in limbo making necessary corrections are made before resubmitting. 
  • Verifying the end-of-month work queue is completed by assisting with the complete closure of all open charts, claims, and correct documentation/codes are added. 
  • Serve as an expert resource for all coding needs and questions including staying current with reimbursement requirements for government programs and third-party payers. 
  • Accurately apply ICD and CPT codes to complex outpatient encounters in the EMR system.
  • Assist and offer input on troubleshooting appeals for denials.
  • Creates reports and presentations for administration including but not limited to; coding accuracy, timely filing, first-time claims submission, and compliance evaluations per government policies.
  • Upholds HIPAA laws and guidelines while performing all duties without exception.   
 

Exhibit Company Core Values:

  • Commitment - Commitments are clearly made and met
  • Health - Healthy living for everyone is promoted through sustainable and responsible behaviors
  • Excellence - Excellence in everything we do
  • Celebrate - Celebrate wins - both small and large
  • Trust - Trust builds teamwork through vulnerability and respect
Safety & Wellbeing:

  • Vaccination Policy: As a healthcare company, AFC believes that the safety and well-being of our staff and patients is a top priority. Therefore, we require new hires to have received all required vaccinations, including, but not limited to, measles, mumps, flu, and COVID-19
  • Alcohol and Drug-Free Policy: We are an alcohol and drug-free workplace. Offers are contingent on the successful completion of background and drug screenings

column3: Customer Service Representative - State Farm Agent Team Member (Customer Relations Focus)

column4:
Full Job Description

Summary Perform radiographic and other diagnostic imaging procedures to assist physicians in the diagnosis of injuries and disease. In addition to x-ray tech duties, this position will also serve as a medical receptionist.
Essential Functions
  • Greet patient, ensure that the patient has removed all jewelry and metal objects, is wearing the appropriate medical gown and is not pregnant.
  • Prepare and position the patient for diagnostic imaging procedures.
  • Adjust immobilization devices to obtain optimum views of specified area of the body as requested by the physician.
  • Explain procedures to patient to reduce anxieties and obtain patient cooperation.
  • Practice radiation protection techniques to minimize radiation to patient and staff.
  • Maintain a neat and clean working environment and ensure all supplies have been ordered and stocked.
  • Process images and review for proper identification and quality control.
  • Utilize both digital and non-digital diagnostic imaging equipment, ensuring compliance with approved radiology techniques and all AFC/Doctors Express policies and procedures.
  • Prepare images for reading by physician as well as contact any additional physicians if a second opinion is needed.
  • Aid physician with prescribed patient treatments in accordance with approved standards, policies, procedures and protocol as necessary.
  • Perform routine maintenance, diagnose malfunctions, and make minor repairs on equipment, arranging for repairs as needed.
  • Complete forms and maintains records, logs, and reports of work performed.
  • Observe safety and security procedures; promote a safe and pleasant work environment.
  • Maintain complete and accurate documentation.
  • Report potentially unsafe conditions to management.
  • Regular attendance to ensure efficient clinic operations.
Marginal Functions
  • Manage difficult or emotional customer situations, respond promptly to customer needs.
  • Treat people with respect, inspire trust of others, work with integrity, and uphold organizational values.
  • Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness.
  • Serve as Medical Receptionist if/when needed
  • Adapt to change in work environment, manage competing demands
  • Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
  • High School diploma or equivalent, graduation from an accredited school of Radiologic Sciences and Limited Medical Radiology Technician (LMRT) license in Texas.
  • Previous medical clerical experience preferred.
  • Basic computer knowledge, e.g., Microsoft Office.
  • Accuracy and detail orientation.
  • Positive customer service skills.
Physical Demands required for this position include: the ability to speak clearly, close vision, the ability to stand for extended periods, the ability to reach and bend, periodic lifting and moving of items of no more than ten (10) pounds, and walking.
Work Environment while performing the duties of this job are working in an indoor healthcare environment, working with a moderate noise level, working with a potential exposure to bloodborne pathogens and diseases with a requirement to wear appropriate PPE, (ie. gloves, masks, etc.)
Benefits (available for full-time employees ONLY)
  • Medical
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • 401(k)
  • Life/AD&D
  • STD
  • LTD
  • Health insurance

POSITION ACTIVITIES AND TASKS

  • Welcomes guests immediate upon seating with a non-scripted greeting
  • Using acquired menu knowledge, offers menu suggestions, answers questions and anticipates guests’ needs.
  • Deliver Hot Food – Check completed food orders for accuracy, appearance and temperature, deliver to the table immediately.
  • Deliver Perkins Service – Show a desire to please with your genuine hospitality, personality and specific suggestions at every step.  Actively engage Guests who have concerns and remedy them. Ensure that each Guest is 100% satisfied with his/her dining experience.
  • Clean – Keep tables/station, pantry line area and dining room common areas clean.  Complete assigned Perkins cleaning system duties.
  • Attends to any additional guests’ needs or requests
  • Maintains dining area – pre-bussing, detailing etc.
  • Maintains cleanliness of his/her stations and pantry.
  • Performs side work during shift downtime including but not limited to; rolling silverware, restocking cleaning works stations and bussing tables, etc.
  • Executes the service cycle and team responsibilities at all times. Ensures 100% guest satisfaction on every visit.
  • Communicates with Manager on Duty and coworkers regarding product/service deficiencies. equipment, safety problems. Etc.
  • Keeps General Manager and Manager on Duty informed of problems and/or issues and proposes alternative solutions for consideration.
  • Processes Orders
  • Writes guest check and/or operates POS equipment pursuant to company policies.
  • Anticipates, identifies and corrects system breakdowns to achieve maximum guest satisfaction.
  • Assists Team Members
  • Maintains service stations, garnish line, service bar and common areas of the restaurant
  • Restocks service station with glasses, tea, ice and plates
  • Restocks garnish line
  • Fills condiments
  • Sorts, polishes and rolls silverware
  • Cleans mirrors and artifacts
  • Runs food for all servers to ensure hot food is served hot
  • Maintains cleanliness of dining room, and pantry area.
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ENVIRONMENT/WORKING CONDITIONS
  • Extensive standing and walking for up to 8 hours
  • Must be able to see at a distance (20) feet, at close range (12 inches), distinguish between shapes and utilize peripheral vision to avoid hazards.
  • Must be able to communicate clearly
  • Exposure to heat, steam, smoke, cold
  • Reaching heights of approximately 6 feet and depts. of 2 ½ - 3 feet.
  • Must have high level of mobility/flexibility in space provided
  • Must have time management skills
  • Must be able to read, write and perform addition/subtraction calculations
  • Must be able to control and utilize fingers to write, slice chop and operate equipment.
  • Must be able to fit through openings 30” wide
  • Must be able to work irregular hours under heavy pressure/stress during busy times
  • Bending, reaching, walking
  • Carrying trays of food products weighing about 50 pounds for distances up to 30 feet
  • Lifting up to 50 pounds
  • Exposure to dish and cleaning chemicals


SUPERVISION RECEIVED:
Receives direction and training from  Manager on duty as to the specific procedures and assignments.
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIRED:
Basic skills such as sanitation, safety, and customer service can be taught through in house training.
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
None
 
Disclaimer
This position description in not intended, and should not be construed to be, an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, efforts or working conditions associated with job. It is intended, however, to be an accurate reflection of those principle job elements essential for making decisions related to job performance, employee development and compensation. As such, the incumbent may perform other duties and responsibilities as required.

The Nothing Bundt Cakes Dishwasher sets the stage and makes the magic in our
bakery possible. You’ll keep the bakery team’s equipment clean and ready to make
cakes that bring joy to thousands of people every day.

But there’s so much more to a career here.

Enjoy your evenings: We close earlier than most food service jobs.
We offer flexible work schedules.
We’re keeping it casual. T-shirts and sneakers are where it’s at!
Cake discounts. Yummm!
It smells great in here, all the time, and you will too!
This job is fun. It’s literally a piece of cake!
This is a great place to make new friends!

Apply now. Joy is the job.

Local growing HVAC service company has opportunities for skilled, experienced HVAC Service Technicians. Join our company of exceptional people that can furnish the right person a rewarding career. Must have great people skills, professional appearance and clean driving record. Two years HVAC service experience required. Benefits are available. COVID vaccination not required. Interested applicants please send resume.

Job Responsibilities:
* Troubleshoot and diagnose issues on all makes and models of heating and cooling equipment
* Know how to measure delta T and static pressure
* Perform repairs as needed after estimate approval
* Know how to recover and charge equipment with refrigerant
* Be able to locate any future issues that may arise and address them accordingly
* Have an EPA certification
* Understand wiring diagrams and schematics
* Perform preventive maintenance
          Locate any needs customer may not be aware of
          Look for opportunities that may be beneficial to the customer including IAQ and insulation
* Be available for on-call after hours and weekend emergencies
* Adhere to company values and policies
* Customer service and image
          Achieve 100% customer satisfaction
          Maintain a clean appearance for customers according to company uniform codes
          Maintain a clean and organized truck
* Be a team player
* Communicate any issues found with the manager
* Tech training
          Commit to all company sponsored tech training
          Commit to all service meetings
* Maintain a positive attitude when working individually as well as with others

Overview 
Atlas Rental Property is one of the fastest growing property management companies in the Southeast. We currently manage approximately 1800 rental properties in North and Central Alabama as well as Chattanooga, Tennessee with plans to continue expansion in new and adjacent markets. 
 
Responsibilities:
  • Hit Weekly Leasing/Deposit Goals 
    • 20/week
    • Monitoring other metrics that are lead indicators for this number
      • Showings, apps, leads, etc.
  • Support Leasing Team 
    • Coach, manage, and develop team 
    • Resolve any questions/issues that arise 
    • Approve bi-weekly commission sheets 
    • Ensure all mileage reports are sent and approved 
    • Address (reasonable) repair/cleaning requests with team when necessary
  • Bi- Weekly check-ins 
    • Standings vs. goals
    • Coaching
    • Overarching issues 
    • Checking/knowing inventory
  • Training 
    • New team member training 
    • Continued training for existing members when needed
  • Personnel Management
    • Constantly interviewing for pipeline of new Agents
    • VA management 
    • Networking with Real Estate Agents 
    • Review candidates/resumes 
    • Interview potential agents
    • Hiring or termination 
    • Approve/deny time off requests 
  • Lead Daily Leasing Meetings 
    • Pulling numbers 
    • Tracking historic numbers 
    • Ensure all team members attending (unless excused) 
  • Weekly Reporting 
    • Occupancy 
    • Total number of deposits 
    • % to goal 
    • Weekly department number sheet 
    • Deposit tracker
    • Days to deposit
    • Agent deposit stats 
  • Marketing 
    • Facebook/Instagram marketing (5 posts/week, including alternate markets) 
      • Creating and posting content 
    • New listings 
    • New strategies
    • Promotions/Events – Create/manage new promotions and/or events based on season 
    • Weekly audit to make sure all new listings on market and priced correctly 
    • Marketing materials (signs, brochures, etc.) 
  • Lockboxes 
    • Maintain/order Inventory 
  • Tenant Resolution 
    • Handle any escalated prospect issues 
  • Text Magic
    • Send out and respond to daily texts (shoppers, showings, e-leads) 
    • Handle incoming questions/leads (disburse)/get deposits 
  • Real Estate Commission 
    • Maintain Active Real Estate License 
    • Ensure Team maintains active RE Licenses 
  • Manage Lease Signings and Tenant Transition 
Experience/Technical Requirements:
  • 3+ years of proven experience in a management role preferably in Property Management/Real Estate/Leasing
  • College degree is preferred; relevant experience will be considered in lieu of college degree
  • Energetic and proactive attitude
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to clearly communicate with Directors, Managers, tenants, and vendors
  • Strong Problem-Solving Skills
  • Strong multitasking and organization skills
 
Total Compensation 
The compensation package for this role includes a base annual salary of $55,000-$60,000 as well as the potential for performance bonus up to 20% after six months in role. We offer a comprehensive benefits package including PTO accrual that begins on day one and 401K with employer contribution after one year of service. We observe eight paid holidays in addition to PTO accrual and we offer paid parental leave after one year in role.

Are you looking for purposeful work? If so, please consider joining Vibrant Health Homecare. We are a homecare and supported living agency based in Tacoma. Our mission is to support seniors and individuals with disabilities to achieve their individually defined goals.
Are you a people person?
Do you like supporting people to accomplish tasks on their own?
Do you enjoy seeing seniors and individuals with disabilities live a wholesome life?
Do you think outside of the box?
If you answered "yes" to any of the questions above, this job is for you, please join our team to help us further this mission

CURRENT OPEN POSITIONS/SHIFTS:
  • We're currently hiring for a wonderful client in Tacoma Washington. Available shifts:
  • Sun-Wed 9 am-9 pm or Thur-Sat 9 am-9 pm
  • Sun-Wed 9 pm - 9 am or Thur-Sat 9 pm-9 am

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Support clients to accomplish tasks to the best of their abilities.
  • Support clients to achieve their desired goals
  • Provide companionship and conversation
  • Provide support with personal care tasks such as bathing, grooming, dressing, bathroom needs, and feeding
  • Plan and prepare meals for or with the client
  • Ensure clients have taken scheduled medications 
  • Provide transportation to and from appointments
  • Support clients to access and enjoy resources in the community
QUALIFICATIONS
  • CNA or CNA license desired. If you don't have it, training opportunities are available
  • Ability to treat clients with dignity and respect
  • Ability to interpret the client’s provided plan of care
  • Valid driver’s license and transportation
  • Ability to be flexible and adapt to new situations
  • Prior experience with senior care and individuals with disabilities is desired and not required
WHY JOIN THE INDUSTRY?
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits are available
  • PTO & Sick leave
  • Weekly pay
  • Competitive compensation
  • Flexible scheduling
  • Training and support for our caregivers

Overview 
Atlas Rental Property is one of the fastest growing property management companies in the Southeast. We currently manage approximately 1800 rental properties in North and Central Alabama as well as Chattanooga, Tennessee with plans to continue expansion in new and adjacent markets. 

Primary Responsibilities 
  • Tenant communication (calls, texts, email and portal communication) regarding the following 
    • Past due rent 
    • Payment arrangements and pre-collections 
    • Pro-rated rents 
    • Eviction notices 
  • Posting daily rent payments 
  • Completing bank deposits 
  • Balancing deposits in PropertyWare 
  • Posting property deposits 
  • Verifying occupancy remotely (Alabama Power dashboard) and in-person 
  • Collections of terminated ledgers 
    • Preparing and sending files 
    • Communicating with attorneys and collection agency 
    • Attending trial for money judgement 
    • Tracking payment arrangement through PropertyWare and Excel 
  • Assisting with evictions remotely and in-person 
    • Preparing and sending files to eviction 
    • Posting termination notices 
    • Attending unlawful detainer trials when necessary 
    • Updating eviction tracker 
  • Collaborative communication within AR team and other departments affected by non-payment 
  • Application review using Findigs 
    • Obtaining rental references and employment verification for pending applicants 
    • Running applicants with criminal history through Alacourt 
    • Applicant decision within 48 hours 
    • Related communication and conflict resolution with leasing team 
  • Section 8 housing 
    • Communicating with caseworkers regarding payments 
    • Updating Section 8 tracker 
  • Partnering with leasing team on lease signings and verifying receipt of necessary documentation 
  • Monitoring multiple (email) inboxes 
Please note that this role does involve in-field duties as well as court appearances, candidates must be willing and able to perform all functions of the role as outlined and must have reliable transportation, valid ID and proof of insurance in order to do so.

Role Requirements 
Proficiency in Word, Excel and PowerPoint 
Minimum typing speed of 30 WPM 
Experienced with Cloud based software 
Excellent communication skills 
Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills 
Experience in accounts receivable, collections or payment processing 
 
Necessary Soft Skills
Tenacity 
Sense of urgency 
Team player 
Determination and follow through 
Inquisitive 
Calm demeanor (not easily frustrated) 
 
Total Compensation 
The compensation package for this role includes a base annual salary of $45,000 as well as the potential for performance bonus up to 25% after six months in role. We offer a comprehensive benefits package including PTO accrual that begins on day one and 401K with employer contribution after one year of service. We observe eight paid holidays in addition to PTO accrual and we offer paid parental leave after one year in role.

Servers at Cortina
Cortina, situated in the heart of downtown Seattle, is positioned at the foot of one of the city's most notable commercial
high-rises, Two Union Square. Offering delectable Italian cuisine and expertly crafted cocktails, guests can enjoy an
expansive bar area and intimate dining room or reserve our private event space for special occasions. This is a day shift position from 12-4pm


Our essential team members enjoy:
*Competitive Pay
*Flexible Schedules
*Career Path Opportunities
*Paid Training 
 
For more than 60 years, ServiceMaster Clean has been creating cleaner, healthier, safer work environments for our customers. As a ServiceMaster Service Partner, you belong to a team that works together to deliver the best solutions and customer service to our clients. 
 
Job Position Description:
This position plays a critical role in staff and patient safety by cleaning and disinfecting the facilities to the highest standards. The EVS Technician is the front line of defense for patients and the spread of disease. They ensure all procedure rooms are thoroughly and meticulously cleaned and disinfected, which keeps patients, families and medical safe from the transmissions of pathogens. Duties include but not limited to:  
  • Perform all cleaning duties for facilities using provided ServiceMaster products, tools and procedures
  • Sweeping, mopping, polishing, trash removal, restroom cleaning, windows, dusting
  • Maintain inventory of supplies and equipment.
  • Use proper PPE where required
Physical Demands and Qualifications:
  • Constant (up to 100%) standing, walking, pushing, kneeling, twisting, reaching
  •  Must be able to lift and/or carry up to 25lbs.
  • Ability to differentiate between cleaning products and uses
  • Will provide on the job training to those with strong work ethic and willingness to learn.
  • The ability to be flexible and work at a fast pace in a multi-tasked job is a must.
  • Contribute to the overall team effort including being in uniform, dependable and on time
  • Treat all co-workers and customers with courtesy and respect
 
Apply and become a part of ServiceMaster, one of the most respected professional cleaning companies in the Country. We pride ourselves on creating cleaner and healthier environments for our customer, their employees and customers. As a ServiceMaster Service Partner you belong to a team that works together to deliver the best solutions and customer service to our clients.  
We offer paid training, excellent work/life balance and opportunities for advancement and a career path that matches your interests and goals.

Job Summary: 
We are looking for a new team member to generate, manage and grow our sales and events department.  Sales & Events Coordinator is responsible for aggressively soliciting, selling, booking events, and generating onsite group dining sales as well as off-site catering sales at all BigRedF restaurants.  You must be a fervent ambassador for BigRedF Restaurants and skilled at building relationships and networking with current and prospective clients and building and fostering relationships within the events & hospitality industry and beyond.  You will work intimately with clients, guests and restaurant managers to develop BEOs and blueprints for successful BigRedF events. 

You must be able to effectively cope with change, decide and act without having the total picture, and not get upset when things are up in the air, with a focus on always meeting and exceeding the needs and requests of your guests. You are passionate about helping people with their events & catering needs, are energetic and thrive in a fast-paced environment.  You are a multitasker extraordinaire and are able to efficiently manage and prioritize your time within a self-managed environment.  You are organized, detail-oriented and an effective communicator. You thrive on closing deals.

Responsibilities: 
  • Proactively and successfully sell the restaurant and private dining spaces and catering offerings of BigRedF restaurants in Boulder
  • Work in conjunction with Senior Sales & Events Coordinator
  • Reach or exceed quarterly and yearly budgeted sales goals
  • Receive and respond to leads within 24 hours 
  • Perform site visits and arrange tastings for prospective clients 
  • Negotiate and secure contracts and collect deposits for all confirmed events 
  • Plan and confirm event menus and details for all events 
  • Coordinate all rentals, florals and additional special details as requested 
  • Prepare BEOs and communicate all event details to restaurant management teams 
  • Attend events as needed 
  • Process and manage events & catering payments 
  • Perform sales outreach to build relationships and generate sales 
  • Assist with all needs of the sales & events team 
Qualifications: 
  • 3 years experience in sales for the retail and/or hospitality industries
  • 2 years experience in sales / events management and oversight of at least $500k in annual sales.
  • Possess basic financial skills 
  • Proficient knowledge of web based project management software, Triple Seat and/or other web based event management software
  • Working knowledge of POS/Aloha, Scheduling Software, Excel (spreadsheets) and Google Suite
  • Experience managing social media content (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc.)
  • Basic understanding of Adobe Creative Suite (menu creation)
Physical Demands: (If necessary)
  • Flexibility to travel to BigRedF restaurants and outside venues for meetings, client walk-throughs, training, etc.
  • Flexibility to work nights, weekends and holidays 
  • Availability to respond to client emails and calls at all times of the day 
Equal Opportunity Employer: 
We could care less about your sexual, religious, or political affiliations. Your age, disability, military background and favorite condiment are of little concern to us. We are looking for the right personality, talents and skills to fill this position.

Compensation & Benefits:
  • Competitive Base Salary + Commissioned on sales - Total Compensation estimate including commissions: $70-$75k
  • Paid Vacation
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
  • Basic Life and AD&D Insurance
  • Company Sponsored 401k
  • Long Term Disability Insurance
  • BigRedF Restaurant Dining Stipend
  • Continuous Training
 
Company Summary:
The Big Red F Restaurant Group is in the business of people. The people we work with and the people we welcome everyday as our guests. Our success and longevity is due to the many unique, funky, authentic, righteous, passionate, amazing, humble, honest, hardworking and dedicated people who have worked within our walls and under our roofs since 1994. The Big Red F Family consists of 16 locations among 6 unique brands including Jax Fish House, Centro Mexican Kitchen, West End Tavern, The Post Chicken & Beer, Post Brewing Company and Red F Catering + Provisions.

This is a day shift position from 12-4pm

  • Great small business work environment
