General Manager (Retail/Health/Wellness)

L5 Be Well LLC, dba Restore Hyper Wellness, is seeking a General Manager with strong leadership skills and a knack for business development and sales. If you thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and have a background in the health and wellness or retail landscape, we want to meet you.

As a General Manager, you’ll play an integral role in driving the Restore culture. You’ll have the opportunity to build your own team, train and coach them to be successful wellness professionals, and become part of the health and wellness community. This is your chance to join Restore on a mission to help people feel better so they can do more of what they love.

Responsibilities 
People Management
  • Lead performance management activities with each staff member, including setting goals, ongoing coaching, career development, and performance reviews.
  • Assist in hiring and developing high-performance employees
  • Oversee onsite onboarding and the training of new employees
  • Ensure 100% completion of all required ongoing training (monthly and annually) per Restore compliance standards.
  • Enforce store policies, procedures, and productivity standards.
  • Monitor and formally document staff performance/behavior with the support of the HR Department.
  • Oversee employee schedules to maximize usage and efficiency while ensuring adequate coverage during peak hours and special events.
  • Audit and verify payroll information for each pay cycle and ensure staff commissions, bonuses and tips are accounted for.
  • Conduct and attend regular staff meetings and 1:1’s to communicate promotions, goals, trends, and other relevant information.
Sales & Marketing
  • Drive store sales through membership, packages, and retail opportunities while adhering to sales success metrics.
  • Maintain a strong local presence through partnerships with community and business organizations.
  • Participate in local events and wellness initiatives and establish partnerships with fitness and wellness enthusiasts to generate interest in Restore’s services.
  • Lead store team in service and product knowledge and motivate them to meet and exceed sales goals.
  • Manage the proven sales process and work to exceed all sales while maintaining budgetary targets.
  • Set daily, weekly and monthly goals across all services to ensure clear expectations for staff and the success of overall store performance.
  • Manage or delegate social media channels for the store to create compelling posts and communicate with guests and leads.
  • Ensure all lead generation platforms are managed effectively and all marketing campaigns are followed.
  • Create and maintain a highly engaged group of ambassadors and influencers that promote the store and brand.
Operations Management
  • Maintain a safe, clean and secure environment for all guests and staff.
  • Continuously improve operational execution through attention to detail and adherence to operating and safety standards.
  • Communicate any equipment maintenance or construction needs to lead and help oversee repairs.
  • Accept guidance and collaborate with your supervisor to ensure optimal store performance and staff development.
  • Ensure an exceptional store experience that engages and retains customers.
  • Be flexible with your schedule - you’ll work hours based on business needs and store operating hours. This will include some weekends and holidays.
  • Make timely and effective decisions regarding customer service issues.
  • Daily reporting of appointments, revenue, and inbound/outbound calls.
  • Report all safety and medical incidents through formal in-store communication and to the corporate team.
Qualifications
  • You have at least three to five years of management experience.
  • You love the fast-paced retail lifestyle and have a proven track record of sales.
  • You’re passionate about fitness, athletic achievement, and general health and wellness.
  • Your verbal and written communication skills are on point.
  • You’re a numbers person and can deliver action plans based on key metrics.
  • You’re tech-savvy and have experience processing payroll and creating employee schedules.
  • You embrace a leadership role and are also a strong team player.
  • You’re driven to meet monthly, quarterly, and annual financial goals for yourself and your team.
  • You get joy and fulfillment from helping people feel better and live healthier lifestyles.
  • You place importance on ethics and integrity and exhibit this every day.
  • You have earned a High School Diploma; Undergraduate Degree preferred
  • You be eligible to work in the US for any employer
Benefits We Offer
  • Bonus opportunity (up to 10k annually)
  • Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance
  • Complimentary Core Services
  • Discounts on Specialty Services
  • Discounts on products and apparel 
  • Fun, friendly, wellness-focused environment
 More About Us
Restore Hyper Wellness + Cryotherapy is the leading retail provider of alternative health and wellness modalities in the United States. Our goal is to make Hyper Wellness® widely accessible, affordable, and fun. This means helping people from all walks of life feel better and perform at a higher level so they can DO MORE of what they love in life. 

Learn more about us here: https://www.restore.com/ 

Position Type
Full-time 
Exempt (salary)
 
This location is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment should be directed to the franchisee of this location and not to Restore Corporate.  

L5 Be Well, LLC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all team members.

Our ideal candidate has 3 - 5 years of leadership experience, is a responsible, driven individual with exceptional communication skills, great problem-solving quick thinking, and an ability to work independently. We are looking for someone interested in a long-term role in a stable and positive environment with tremendous opportunity for professional growth. Prior spa industry experience or membership-driven sales experience is a plus, but not a requirement for consideration. 

Benefits GALORE!
  • Medical Insurance with a generous monthly employer contribution, Dental Insurance, as well as a $25K Life Insurance policy at no cost to you! 
  • 401K plan with 5% company match!
  • We offer a competitive compensation structure, salary plus a generous performance based bonus structure - earning potential is practically unlimited for strong sales performers!

  • Service and product discounts
  • Professional and safe working environment

Our goal is to provide our valued members and guests with a world-class experience, and our Spa Directors are a critical link in ensuring that our clients' experience in our spa is nothing short of exceptional! Our SD's set the tone for the spa, coach and train the team to excellence, drive sales performance, and grow the business. Working with a team of department leaders, the Spa Director will lead the location to achieve goals while delivering a world-class client experience.
 
As a Spa Director, you will
  • Provide excellent customer service and experiences to all clients and members through the answering of phone calls, setting appointments, greeting clients and membership sales and management.
  • Oversee and manage daily operations of the Spa.
  • Manage spa sales performance.
  • Recruit, hire, and develop talented spa professionals
  • Train, monitor, and coach performance of all sales and service staff.
  • Membership education and sales - including sales goals and incentives
  • Passionately promote products and services with effective, clear communication
  • Communicate with Service Provider team and maximize appointment book
  • Find opportunities for grassroots marketing and local community connections to build prospect counts and brand awareness
  • Administrative duties including reporting, P&L analysis, payroll, cash handling, inventory and ordering, etc.
Role Requirements
  • Proven passion for communicating with people and providing consistent, excellent service
  • Capability to work flexible hours including nights, weekends and holidays
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • A fast learner, with a positive attitude
  • Comfortable in a fast-paced, high-volume environment.
  • Computer proficiency; knowledge of retail/appointment booking computer systems is a plus
  • A strong team player with the ability to work independently under minimal supervision
  • Exceptional organizational skills, including attention to detail and multitasking
  • Critical thinking skills, including customer conflict resolution

Hand & Stone is a national franchise that specializes in massage, facial, and hair removal services. We offer  competitive compensation and a robust benefits package, while maintaining our amazing spa culture focused on our client experience and team wellbeing with a "family" vibe. We are in the people business, and our people come first!

What We Offer:

Opportunities for Growth: On-going training and professional development, tuition reimbursement, and leadership pathways to help you meet your goals as an educator.

Position Overview

As an Agent Team Member, you will receive...

·  $35,000 - $45,000 Base Pay plus commission/bonuses, earning between $52,000 - $85,000/yr
·  Base pay will be determined upon interview and work experience 
·  Paid time off (vacation and personal/sick days)
·  Medical
·  Monday - Friday Daytime Hours, no weekends required 
·  Growth potential/Opportunity for advancement within the agency

Are you outgoing and customer-focused? Do you enjoy working with the public? Are you organized and enjoy helping people succeed? If you answered yes to these questions, working for our local agency may be the career for you! 

Responsibilities

·  Establish customer relationships and follow up with customers, as needed.
·  Use a customer-focused, needs-based review process to educate customers about insurance options.
·  Develop leads, schedule appointments, identify customer needs, and market appropriate products and services.


Requirements

·  Ability to commute to our office in Chicago, IL
·  Current Illinois Property and Casualty License – Required 
·  2+ years of active insurance sales and customer service experience – preferred 
·  Interest in marketing products and services based on customer needs
·  Excellent communication skills - written, verbal and listening
·  People-oriented
·  Detail oriented
·  Proactive in problem solving
·  Able to learn computer functions
·  Ability to work in a team environment


If you are motivated to succeed and can see yourself in this role, please complete our application. We will follow up with you on the next steps in the interview process.


This position is with a local agent, not with corporate. Employees of agents must be able to successfully complete any applicable licensing requirements and training programs. Agents are independent owners who hire their own employees. Agents’ employees are not employees of any corporate entity or corporation the Agent represents.

Build a brighter future for all children.
Teaching is more than a job. It’s an opportunity to foster curiosity, creativity and compassion in children—all while helping them develop a lifelong love of learning.  As a Pre-Kindergarten Teacher you’ll create a fun, safe environment for students to discover new concepts with confidence through multi-sensory learning experiences. Enjoy the freedom to modify lessons in order to meet children where they are in the learning cycle as you help them refine kindergarten readiness skills while nurturing their social, emotional, cognitive, creative and physical development.
 
Make a difference every day. 
  • Spend your days building genuine relationships with each child.
  • Help children learn about language and literacy, math, science, life skills, and more.
  • Work with your co-teacher to implement the lesson plans from the research-informed Balanced Learning® curriculum.
  • Maintain a well-kept classroom that encourages children to create, explore and make decisions with confidence.
  • Discover what works best for each child as you teach them about the world around them.
 
Get everything you need to give children everything they need.
At Primrose of Cornelius, you bring the passion, and we’ll give you all the tools and training to be successful.
Our Balanced Learning® approach was developed with early learning experts. It provides clear daily plans so you can focus your time in the classroom on forming connections with the children—and spend your time outside of school focused on yourself.
Classrooms come fully stocked with everything you need, and our supportive Leadership Team works every day to create a safe, healthy environment and a culture where all children and team members can thrive.
And if that’s not enough, just wait until you help a child learn something new and see their face light up with excitement.
 
Let’s talk about building a brighter future together because we offer:
  • Lesson Plans & Resources Provided
  • Paid CPR/First Aid Training 
  • Paid Time Off 
  • Professional Cleaning at Night (not teacher's responsibility)
  • Team Building Opportunities 
  • Catered Lunches 
  • Uniform Shirts & Primrose Cups provided
  • Resource Room Treats
  • Staff Appreciation Gifts
  • Special Birthday Gift 
  • Anniversary Paid Day Off
  • Child Tuition Discounts 
  • NO WEEKENDS!
Position does require a minimum AA Degree, Bachelor Degree preferred

Looking for individuals to join our home care family.
At ComForCare Home Care we value our employees like family. We celebrate success and have fun. Our focus is to help our clients and employees live their best lives possible.
*Each office is independently owned and operated.
 
POSITION SUMMARY
Provides data entry functions and assists with the Agency invoicing process. Ensures accurate and timely submission of payroll information. Prepares claims for submission as directed by the Operations Manager and/or Administrator.
 
REPORTS TO: Operations Manager or Administrator
 
QUALIFICATIONS
  • High school graduate; Associate's or Bachelor Degree preferred.
  • Minimum of three (3) years of general office experience with some data entry.
  • Computer literate for functions of data entry and basic word processing.
  • Knowledge of medical terminology and/or general medical background desirable.
  • Accurate and detail-oriented approach to projects.
  • Accounting experience preferred
  • Experience with HHA Exchange billing preferred
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/AREAS OF ACCOUNTABILITY
  1. Assists in client invoicing and third-party claim submission. 
    1. Enters client data into system.
    2. Verifies signed physician orders prior to claim submission.
    3. Verifies services provided from employee time record and documentation.
    4. Prepares claims for submission.
    5. Submits claims either manually or electronically per Agency protocol.
    6. Responds to client inquiries regarding accounts.
  2. Posts cash receipts.
  3. Completes the accounts receivable billing and charge entry duties in a timely manner.
  4. Processes payroll for field staff timely and accurately. 
    1. Audits time card records and identifies discrepancies.
    2. Batches timesheets for computer input as needed.
    3. Processes payroll withholding amounts.
    4. Responds to employee inquiries regarding payroll.
  5. Documents employee personnel changes for computer and passes this information to data entry staff.
  6. Completes all reports for the management team and forwards in a timely manner.
  7. Maintains confidentiality of all client and employee information.
  8. Performs job in compliance with Agency policies and procedures as well as community standards and applicable laws.
  9. Communicates necessary information to Supervisor and management staff to assure accuracy of data and coordination of Agency functions.
  10. Performs additional duties and responsibilities as deemed necessary.
 
PHYSICAL/ENVIRONMENTAL DEMANDS
The information below is intended to describe the general context/requirements for performance of this job. During a typical workday, this position requires the activities listed. It is not to be considered an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities, or requirements and does not limit the assignment of additional duties.

Lead Mitigation Technician /Supervisor


 Position Overview
      Reporting to the Production Manager, the Lead Mitigation Technician/Supervisor supports emergency response and restoration projects to ensure the goals and needs of the insurance companies and our customers are being met.

The Mitigation Technician Lead is responsible for providing technical direction for jobs and projects involving fire, smoke, water, mold and bio-hazard restoration. Assist in overseeing and the coordination of all facets of restoration.

Job Duties
 ● Work on job sites providing the following services
o Water pumping and extraction
o Mold remediation
o Moving & re-setting contents o Selective demolition as required to accommodate the drying process
o debris disposal
 o Setting drying equipment
o Capable of moisture mapping the affected area, inclusive of temperature, relative humidity and MC moisture content readings
● Participate as directed in the following activities:
o Vehicle safety and maintenance inspections
o Ensure vehicle is cleaned and restocked at end of shift
o Constructing polyethylene enclosures
o Maintaining equipment
● Will practice good housekeeping at all times to ensure a safe and non-cluttered worksite
● Provide excellent customer service
● Work under time constraints to meet specific timelines
● Ensure attention to detail and keen sense of safeguarding other people’s property and information
● Participates in and demonstrates an understanding of safety principles and practices; follows all safety policies and procedures to support a safe working environment, including safe operation of machines and equipment
● Comply with all company policies and procedures, as well as follow safety handbook policies
● Proactively communicate job site conditions and concerns that may or are affecting completion of the job to the appropriate person
● This role could be required to act as a “lead” periodically as designated by their manager
● Attend all/complete all  company  training courses

 JOB Requirements :

  • Participate in 24-hour emergency on call rotation (nights, weekends, holidays)
  • Be able to work more than 7 consecutive days when required due to work load on a large loss
● IICRC certification for Water Restoration Technician (WRT) required
● IICRC certification for Applied Microbial Remediation Technician (AMRT) an asset but not required
● 2+ years industry related experience, Construction / Restoration / Insurance preferred 
● Familiarity with chemical products including use, disposal, and Safety Data Sheets 
● Comprehensive understanding of customer service, principles and practices 
● Eligible to operate a motor vehicle  
● Ability to work within a team or independently as needed 
● Strong written and verbal communication skills 
● Proven ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment 
● Basic computer and/or Tablet / iPad experience
● Willing to work evenings, on call and weekends when requested 
● Criminal Record Check Physical Demands 
● Frequent lifting from 5-40 lbs, unassisted (from 35-65% of the time) 
● Occasional lifting from 41 lbs +, assisted (up to 50% of the time) 
● Access and mobility in tight spaces 
● Fit Testing – half and full face mask as needed, annual certification required 
● Working at Heights - over 5 feet, periodically 
● Sustained periods of standing, sitting, walking, bending, and kneeling

column4:
We are looking for Assistant Managers who want to be part of the Planet Fitness team!  As an Assistant Manager, you will be responsible for providing a superior level of customer service to Planet Fitness members, prospective members, and guests, ensuring an exceptional "Judgement Free" member experience, and leading a team of associates to achieve operational excellence!

Why you should join Planet Fitness: 

  • Great growth opportunities - we are a dynamic and growing company!
  • An excellent Training program.
  • Set Schedule
  • Employee Referral Bonus program 
  • Medical, Dental and Vision insurance benefits.
  • 401(k) with a generous employer match
  • Profit sharing program!
  • FREE Black Card Membership (inspiring you and your closest friend to be your best!)
  • A generous paid time off policy that is available on your start date and increases along with your tenure!
  • This position has a $1/hour premium added to any hours worked 6:00 PM-6:00 AM. 
  • A sparkling clean work environment (where we all pitch in to keep the club pristine!)
  • Contribute to changing people's lives every day by helping us create a healthier Planet
  • Work hard play hard with an amazing group of talented, dynamic team members
Some of your responsibilities will include:

  • In partnership with the General Manager, the Assistant Manager is responsible for the entire operation and management of the Club, ensuring positive member experience, teamwork and operational excellence. 
  • The Assistant Manager, manages and is responsible for all aspects of the Club’s operation in the absence of the Club General Manager. To work productively as part of a team and to motivate and inspire the team to achieve club productivity and customer service goals.  To follow all Company standards, ensuring that the work shift contributes to the financial best interests of the Club, ensuring the individual and collective skills of the team are utilized effectively, and both the staff and member experience is positive. 
  • The Assistant Manager will assist with recruitment, hiring and training in order to ensure that the club is fully staffed at all times. 
  • Ensures excellence in Company Customer Service/Member Service at all times by consistently creating a welcoming environment for the members by greeting and assisting, as well as quickly responding to member inquires and needs. 
Qualifications and Physical Demands:

  • Fitness, retail or management experience strongly preferred 
  • Associate’s degree in Exercise Science, Business, Kinesiology, or similar degree, or a combination of experience and education preferred.
  • Must be 18 years of age or older.
  • Continual standing and walking during your shift.
  • Continual talking to members and potential members in person and on the phone during your shift.
  • Must be able to lift 45 pounds.
Joining the Planet Fitness family means being part of a company that cares about bettering the health and wellbeing of our communities. It means being a part of a supportive, engaging workforce with an inclusive culture that values diversity and creates an environment where everyone can feel they belong. It means encouraging professional growth and development. It means making true, lasting connections with you co-workers. It means creating a positive impact in our local communities through our Judgement Free Generation philanthropic initiative. It means being part of a brand that you can be proud of!

Equal Opportunity Employer

Job description

The Customer Service Associate is front and center in our El Paso, TX location and is responsible for maintaining solid customer relationships by handling customer inquiries and concerns with speed and professionalism through daily interaction with customers, insurance carriers, and fellow employees while conducting specific service and marketing activities.

Responsibilities

  • Provide service to existing clients related to updating policies, providing quotes, taking payments, answering questions, providing documentation.
  • Answer customer calls and correspondence regarding new or existing insurance policies and refer all claims to the appropriate department.
  • Work with new clients in El Paso, TX and the surrounding area and support each other in our office team in an effort to understand customer needs, gather necessary data, research policy options, present options, finalize and bind new coverage, cancel old policies, and negotiate with carriers when necessary.
  • Support each other in the office and review existing policies, review liability limits and exposures, explore other coverage needs, evaluate replacement costs, round out accounts, and bind renewals.
  • Confer with customers to provide detailed information about products and services, quote new business, process renewals and/or cancel accounts, take payments, and provide requested documentation.
  • Resolve product or service issues by clarifying the customer's concern, determining the cause of the issue, selecting and explaining the best solution to solve the issue, expediting correction or adjustment, and following up to ensure resolution.
  • Review audits or policies; verify accuracy and facilitate corrections, as needed, between client and carrier.
  • Maintain records of customer interactions and transactions, recording details of inquiries, comments, and actions taken in the agency management system.
  • Collaborate with team members, mentor staff, provide expertise and answer questions, and participate in formal and informal meetings as needed.
Qualifications

  • Hold the Property and Casualty insurance license required by the State of Texas or be willing to obtain license and have a minimum of one year experience or comparable work experience.
  • Have a reliable vehicle and Auto Insurance that will provide the ability to commute to our El Paso, TX office location.
  • Demonstrate strong knowledge of insurance products and usages, rating procedures, underwriting procedures, coverages, and industry operations to effectively manage, maintain, and write assigned clients and prospects.
  • Demonstrate strong customer focus and an excellent phone manner; display strong written and verbal communication skills as well as excellent math and reading skills to perform calculations.
  • Possess a sense of urgency, attention to detail, organization, multi- tasking, and follow up skills and the ability to handle difficult situations with customers and solve complex problems without direct supervision.
  • Have excellent time management skills with a personal accountability mindset as well as technology and computer proficiency, including agency management systems, rating tools, and carrier website navigation.

EMPLOYMENT STATUS:  hourly, Mondays and Tuesdays, 5 pm to 9 pm, Thursdays and Fridays, 8 am to 5 pm, second, third, and fourth Sunday of the month, 3:30 pm to 6 pm, other hours as needed, non-exempt

ACCOUNTABLE TO:
The Receptionist position shall report directly to the Senior Administrator and work in a collegial relationship with all staff and councils of First Presbyterian Church of Evanston.
 
PURPOSE:
To serve the church by providing a welcoming presence to the public and security of the church property.
 
PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
1.     Provide a welcoming atmosphere at the front desk after hours.  Greet the public when they arrive; answer basic questions; seek out the answer to the public’s question if answer is not immediately known.
2.    Provide information and give directions to those seeking appropriate meeting places.
3.    Have visitors and staff sign-in and sign out.
4.    Notify police, then the Director of Facilities Management in case of emergency, including:
a.    Break-ins
b.    Trespassing
c.    Vandalism
d.    Theft
e.    Assault
f.     Accidents to persons
5.    Ensure that church buildings are protected from unauthorized visitors and monitor who is coming in and out of the building and be aware of suspicious packages and bags, etc.
6.    Utilize steps outlined in building security written procedures to immediately respond to the situations outlined in #3 and #4 above.
7.    Have members and visitors fill out accident or incident reports as necessary.
8.    Direct building traffic before and after church services and other events.
9.    Register all people entering the building in accordance with the Building Security Policy.
10. Be aware of all safety procedures and assist staff, visitors and members if necessary.
11. Cooperate with the Administrative Associate by performing any other duties when asked to do so, such as folding bulletins or other clerical tasks
12. Maintain and tidy up the front desk area.

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
Telephone Skills, Verbal Communication, Microsoft Office Skills, Listening, Professionalism, Good people skills, Organization

The Customer Service Representative’s mission is to answer incoming phone calls and assist customers with product or service information.

The Customer Service Representative is responsible for carrying out all duties required to ensure the mission described above is satisfied. The expectations of this job are as follows:

  1. Open New Work Order
    • Greet customers in a friendly and professional manner
    • Obtain all information from the customer needed to look up the invoice (name, phone, date of purchase, etc.)
    • Open customer’s work order in an efficient and timely manner
    • Verify unit’s warranty and email warranty company for verification if necessary
    • Transfer call to appropriate department (scheduling, triage, etc.)
    • Note work order with necessary details (technician initials, warranty information, etc.)
    • Ensure work order’s are placed in proper status and job type within Dispatchtrack
  2. Look Up Existing Work Order
    • Greet customers in a friendly and professional manner
    • Obtain all information from the customer to look up existing work orders (name, phone, etc.) 
    • Verify what the customer is asking for (part eta, status update, etc.)
    • Determine if call needs to be transferred to another department
    • Verify customer's address and phone numbers before transferring the call
  3. Additional tasks, both within the scope of this position and outside of it, will be assigned and are expected to be completes within the agreed upon timeframe. 
Qualities:
  • A self-starter with strong multitasking skills
  • Someone that can work independently or within a team environment
  • An individual who has the financial well-being, public confidence in, and image of the Company in mind at all times.
Minimum Qualifications:
  • High School Graduate or GED
  • Strong computer skills with efficiency in Microsoft Office suite
  • Strong interpersonal skills

This office cleaning job is located on Delorme Drive in Yarmouth, Maine.   Monday through Fridays, approximately 5:30 pm - 9:30 pm.   WE OFFER COMPETITIVE WAGES.   Duties include mopping, vacuuming, dusting, emptying trash, cleaning bathrooms and eating areas and some glass.   We will attempt to contact interested individuals within 15 minutes of being notified of their summitting their application or resume.  This would be a good job for any individual including those who are retired.

We use all ServiceMaster products and equipment.   Employees are not expected to provide anything and are not required to come to our office to pick up anything.   They only have to let our Business Manager know when they are running low on any cleaning products, and they will be delivered to the account by our supervisor.     

Company and Culture

It takes a certain kind of person to work for ServiceMaster Clean.  Let's see if this is you.   First, you want or need a flexible schedule, and... you're not doing weekends.   Second, you take pride in your work and would welcome paid, on-the-job training.  You want to work with others who are proud of what they do and want to be the best is the biz.   With me so far?   Also, you're someone who likes people, but are perfectly happy in an autonomous position.... meaning you're kind of your own boss, working solo most of the time.  Maybe you've worked at other places that had a negative vibe and ridiculous office politics.  Enough of that, right?   If I'm checking all of your boxes, then you need to check out ServiceMaster Clean in Falmouth.  We're looking for you.

One other thing, forget any preconceived notions that you have about cleaning companies or cleaning for a living- ServiceMaster is completely professional, top to bottom.   Call Donna-Rae at 207 797-6060 to apply.   She will be happy to speak with you.  Alternatively, you can email her at servicemaster@maine.rr.com.

Early Childhood Program Manager 
 
Reports to: Deputy Director                                                                                                 
 
Salary (Grade): $55,806.40/Yr                                                                                             

Status: Reg., Full-Time (Exempt) 
                                                                                                                                                                     
Location: Human Services Department, Winnebago NE, 68071                                                                              
  
Job Purpose & Position Overview 
Under the supervision of the Deputy Director in collaboration with the PNF Program Manager, this position will oversee the license of the child care center(s), daily operations of a childcare facility and also work with the FDA food program. This position will be applying to the State of Nebraska for the Child Care Director Licensure and must meet their requirements.  This position will also be in charge of recruitment and licensing of childcare providers. This position will work closely with Human Services staff, licensed providers, and State of Nebraska and Iowa. This position is responsible for documentation, data entry and processing payments. This position will help assist in the development of a tribally specific licensing program that meets tribal, state and federal guidelines. Responsible for the child count that is required by CCDF regulations. Responsible for the development and implementation of training for childcare providers. 

Specific Job Duties/Responsibilities: 
  • Demonstrates the Winnebago Tribe’s core mission, vision, and values. 
  • Oversee the child care facility day to day operations, which includes providing care for eligible children. 
  • Processing applications and determining eligibility for child care services 
  • Maintain supplies, meet reporting deadlines, issue verbal and written communications on behalf of the center, participate in conference calls, training sessions, and webinars 
  • Recruit and assist persons interested in becoming providers through State of Nebraska 
  • Understand and explain requirements, licensing protocols, and agency standards, policies, and procedures to providers. Inform and educate individuals on licensure requirements and the components of quality services for children including cultural competencies. 
  • Recruit and maintain a list of providers 
  • Complete home visits and health and safety checks.  
  • Provides guidance to providers working to obtain licensure through contracts, referrals, and/or assistance. Required to visit providers once each year to assess their needs and provide feedback or assistance. 
  • Identify, facilitate referrals, and develop training for providers. 
  • Assist in development of tribal licensing standards. 
  • Understand all assistance available in the service area, maintain applications and eligibility information, and development and maintain relationships with program staff. 
  • Work with clients to secure childcare for them to maintain compliance with their case plans or court ordered requirements. 
  • Understand and implement program assistance in accordance with the approved plan, policies, procedures, and regulatory guidelines. Process applications and payment accordingly. 
  • Responsible for documentation, records maintenance, and data entry to ensure the accurate and timely processing of payments. 
  • Conduct child count for the service area as required by CCDF regulations 
  • Prepare and submit monthly reports that are required 
  • Develop and maintain a supportive and informative relationships with families, service providers and stakeholders to encourage participation in the Tribe’s programming with an emphasis on provision of culturally competent services. 
  • Duties listed are intended as an illustration of various types of work performed. 
  • The omission of specific duties does not exclude them from this position if the work is similar, related, or a logical assignment.
Required Qualifications/Skills:
  •  Bachelor’s Degree or four years of accredited college course work with two years of experience in child care, community work related to children and youth, or other areas involving contact and interaction with youth or families OR an equivalent combination of education and experience, substituting the equivalent of one year of full-time professional work experience for each year of the required education. 
  • Preferred candidate meets Nebraska Early Childhood certificate requirements or is able to obtain in the Nebraska Early Childhood guidelines within 12 months of hire.
  •  Knowledge of state of Nebraska Licensing Standards and Iowa Licensing Standards is highly desirable and a willingness to learn is required. 
  • Knowledge of the Childcare Development Fund is highly desirable and willingness to learn is required. 
  • Knowledge of State of Nebraska and State of Iowa’s assistance program is highly desirable and a willingness to learn is required. 
  • Experience in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel required. 
  • Must have excellent interpersonal, communications, and organizations skills.
  • Must have excellent presentation and facilitation skills. 
  • Must be timely, dependable, courteous, and maintain a business-like appearance. 
  • Knowledge of federal laws and regulations concerning confidentiality, release of client information and social service delivery.
  • Knowledge of Winnebago culture and traditions is highly desirable and a willingness to learn is required. 
  • Must possess a valid driver’s license, maintain a valid insurance, and be insurable under the Tribe’s insurance policy. 
  • Must be of good moral character. 
  • Will be required to pass the following but not limited to: National, In-State and Inter/Outer State background checks and submit to pre-employment drug testing.
Supervisory Responsibilities:
  •  Will be responsible for supervision 
Training Requirements:
  •  Nebraska Early Childhood certificate requirements or is able to obtain in the Nebraska Early Childhood guidelines within 12 months of hire.
 Physical Requirements:
  •  Normal to light office work which includes the ability to lift up to 10 lbs.
  •  Regularly required to walk, stand, and sit for extended periods of time and use hands to operate computer keyboard, phone, and various office equipment.
  •  While performing daily duties, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear.
 Mental Requirements:
  •  Reading, writing, calculating
  •  Public Speaking
  •  Above average social interaction skills
  •  Reasoning/Analysis
  •  Works with minimal to no supervision
Language Requirements:
  •  Must possess the ability to read, write, and speak the English language fluently.
  •  Must be able to continually and effectively employ professional verbal and written communications skills.
 Certificates, Licenses & registrations:
  •  All applicants will comply with 45 CFR 1301, Subpart D, Section 1301.31, C and D, which require all prospective employees to sign a declaration prior to employment regarding all arrests and convictions of child abuse or violent felonies and to comply with PL 101-630 and PL 101-637 regarding criminal records check.
  •  Preferred candidate meets Nebraska Early Childhood certificate requirements or is able to obtain in the Nebraska Early Childhood guidelines within 12 months of hire.
 HOW TO APPLY:
  • Submit an application at www.winnebagotribe.com, a resume, cover letter, and two (2) letters of recommendation are required. Applications submitted after the closing date or without proper documents will not be considered.
  • If claiming Native American or Veteran preference, please include pertinent documentation. 
  • Call Human Resources at 402-878-2272 for further information.

  • Build relationships with families and coworkers and create a dynamic environment where play and learning happen seamlessly.

Must meet any applicable background screening or state licensing requirements for the role.

JOB DETAILS
This office cleaning job is located on Forest Falls Drive in Yarmouth, Maine.   Tuesday evenings and anytime over the weekend - 3 hours per week.   Duties include mopping, vacuuming, dusting, emptying trash, cleaning bathrooms and eating areas and some glass.   We will attempt to contact interested individuals within 15 minutes of being notified of their summitting their application or resume.  This would be a good job for any individual including those who are retired.  WE OFFER COMPETITIVE WAGES.

We use all ServiceMaster products and equipment.   Employees are not expected to provide anything and are not required to come to our office to pick up anything.   They only have to let our Business Manager know when they are running low on any cleaning products, and they will be delivered to the account by our supervisor.     

Company and Culture

It takes a certain kind of person to work for ServiceMaster Clean.  Let's see if this is you.   First, you want or need a flexible schedule, and... you're not doing weekends.   Second, you take pride in your work and would welcome paid, on-the-job training.  You want to work with others who are proud of what they do and want to be the best is the biz.   With me so far?   Also, you're someone who likes people, but are perfectly happy in an autonomous position.... meaning you're kind of your own boss, working solo most of the time.  Maybe you've worked at other places that had a negative vibe and ridiculous office politics.  Enough of that, right?   If I'm checking all of your boxes, then you need to check out ServiceMaster Clean in Falmouth.  We're looking for you.

One other thing, forget any preconceived notions that you have about cleaning companies or cleaning for a living- ServiceMaster is completely professional, top to bottom.   Call Donna-Rae at 207 797-6060 to apply.   She will be happy to speak with you.  Alternatively, you can email her at servicemaster@maine.rr.com. 

We Are Experts and dominate the industry in scale and scope with an adaptable, extensive network that consistently delivers exceptional results

We Are Committed to our customers and are guided in all we do by their needs.

We Are Complete and seek to provide exceptional service and engage in proactive behavior.

We Are Driven to pursue the highest standards and continuously improve in all aspects of our business.

We Are Steadfast and here for the long haul with consistent service that ensures ongoing customer satisfaction

  • Paid Training • Competitive Pay • Flexible Schedules • Career Path Opportunities • Positive Atmosphere •
 

Job Position Description:

This position is responsible for creating cleaner and healthier environments for our customer’s buildings and grounds by performing the following essential duties and responsibilities. Other duties may be

  • Perform all cleaning duties for facilities using provided ServiceMaster products, tools and procedures
  • Cleaning duties include: sweeping, mopping, polishing, trash, and cleaning offices, bathrooms & breakrooms
  • Maintain inventory of supplies and equipment.
  • Use proper PPE where required
  • Opens and locks facilities, enable and disable security system as required.
  • 1-2 years’ experience as a custodian, janitor, housekeeper a plus but not required
  • Will provide on the job training to those with strong work ethic and willingness to learn.
  • Experience working for a professional janitorial company, office complex, hotel, hospital or school is a plus.
  • The ability to be flexible, work at a fast-paced and in a multi-tasked job is a must.
  • Contribute to a positive work climate with a pleasant attitude and contribute to the overall team effort including being in uniform, dependable and on time
  • Has respect and understanding for co-workers and customers
  • Must be able to communicate in English
 

Physical Demands and Qualifications:

  • Please opt-in to text messaging to speed up the hiring process.
  • Constant (up to 100%) standing, walking, pushing, balancing, stooping, kneeling, crouching, twisting, reaching over head, reaching forward. Must be able to lift and and/or carry 25lbs.
  • Ability to read cleaning instructions
  • Ability to differentiate between cleaning products and uses

Job Description
Build a brighter future for all children. Teaching is more than a job. It’s an opportunity to foster curiosity, creativity and compassion in children—all while helping them develop a lifelong love of learning.  As an Early Preschool/Preschool Teacher at Primrose School of Cross Creek, you’ll create a fun, safe environment with a daily schedule designed to develop children’s confidence and independence. You’ll help guide these little ones through small group instruction as they grow their ability to absorb new content and understand increasingly complex information.

We offer very competitive pay, a full benefits package, PTO, and several other incentives to join our wonderful team!

Make a difference every day.
• Spend your days building genuine relationships with each child.
• Help children learn about language and literacy, science, life skills, and more.
• Work with your co-teacher to implement the lesson plans from the research-informed Balanced Learning® curriculum.
• Maintain a well-kept classroom that encourages children to create, explore and make decisions with confidence.
• Discover what works best for each child as you teach them about the world around them.
• Grow in a fun, professional, supportive work environment.

Get everything you need to give children everything they need  .At Primrose School of Cross Creek you bring the passion, and we’ll give you all the tools and training to be successful.  Our Balanced Learning® approach was developed with early learning experts. It provides clear daily plans so you can focus your time in the classroom on forming connections with the children—and spend your time outside of school focused on yourself.  Classrooms come fully stocked with everything you need, and our supportive Leadership Team works every day to create a safe, healthy environment and a culture where all children and team members can thrive.  And if that’s not enough, just wait until you help a child learn something new and see their face light up with excitement.

Please find all of the benefits we offer here at Primrose below:
• Competitive pay with annual reviews.
• 8 paid holiday days off a year.
• Sick Pay provided
• 50% off childcare tuition and all fees waived.
• Eligibility for a Simple IRA plan (retirement with contributions from the employer).
• Vision and Dental insurance options.
• Aflac discounts for supplemental insurance.
• $25 toward uniforms/swag at each year anniversary
• Apple of Our Eye awards voted for every other month (gift card given to “employee of the month.”)
• Paid time off accrued every week!
• Principle of Service and Values gifts awarded at each in-service
• Monthly staff appreciation gifts or events to thank our wonderful teachers!
• Early schedules given to teachers based on reliability and seniority
• Paid training and professional development: 35 hours initially, up to 20 hours per year thereafter
• Participation in the Primrose Teachstone CDA program, covering 100% of the costs towards earning a Child Development Associates Credential
• Participation in the TEACH scholarship program, covering most of the cost towards earning an Associates or Bachelor degree in Early Childhood Education Let’s talk about building a brighter future together

Maple Street Biscuit Company has a mission to help people, serve others, and be a part of the community. We serve fresh-made comfort food with a modern twist from 7 am - 2 pm, Monday-Sunday. We are looking for both full and part-time team members to join our family.
 
Why should you work for Maple Street when you could work at almost any restaurant?

  • We promise to be a safe space, where you will never be yelled at or cursed at. 
  • We offer benefits to both full and part-time team members.
  • We give you an opportunity to serve your community in a way you and the team feel passionate about.
  • We care about our team members as people, not just job titles, and have an In It Together fund to help our team members when they need it.
  • You will get paid every Friday.
  • We house-make all our food, so you can be proud of what you are serving.
  • We close at 2, so even if it takes a long time to close, you're still home for dinner.
  • We have so many growth opportunities: we're growing fast throughout the Southeast and you can grow with us!
  • Who doesn't love free food? When you work a shift, enjoy a meal on us.
  • Our goal is to be the most inclusive place for both our guests and our teams. You will feel at home here.
  • A great work environment with monthly team meetings. You may find our teams carving pumpkins, enjoying a baseball game, or sharing pizza and ice cream.
What are we looking for in a new team member?

  • A desire to learn. You could be making biscuits, greeting guests, making lattes, cooking our house-made food, working the grill, or cleaning dishes on any given day.
  • Graciousness. We treat all people with gracious service and we expect the same of you.
  • Dependability. Your team is counting on you to show up on time for your scheduled shifts.
  • Sense of urgency. We want to get the food out to our guests in under 6 minutes, so we like to see some hustle.
  • Ability to work weekends- these are our busiest days where we get to meet more of our community, so it takes a bigger team to care for them well.
Does this sound like a good fit for you? Apply today- we can't wait to meet you and introduce you to the Maple Street family!

This Maryland Licensed Psychologist will conduct evaluations with teens and adults for diagnostic clarification of Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). This involves diagnostic interviewing, administration, scoring, and summarizing results of the Autism Diagnostic Observation Schedule – Second Edition (ADOS-2), along with administering other measures, as appropriate. The licensed psychologist will provide feedback and recommendations to clients, families, and other providers. In addition to conducting independent evaluations, there will be opportunities to collaborate with another psychologist, administering/ summarizing the ADOS-2, to be integrated into a comprehensive evaluation.  

Depending on skills, areas of expertise, and client flow, the licensed psychologist may opt to increase to full-time, also conducting comprehensive evaluations that assess attention, learning, and emotional disorders.
 
A flexible schedule and competitive compensation are available for this independent contractor position in a fee-for-service practice. Working for a psychologist, who owns an 11-office, 1-story office condominium in a park-like setting in Columbia, MD allows for networking opportunities.

Responsibilities 
  • Demonstrates well-developed knowledge/skills in differential diagnosis of psychiatric disorders and psychological assessment. 
  • Maintains accurate and complete records, conducting evaluations and writing reports in a timely fashion.
  • Has current knowledge of relevant literature and empirically validated treatments.
  • Consults and collaborates with other professionals regarding diagnosis and treatment planning.
Qualifications 
  • Doctoral degree in Psychology (PsyD or PhD) from an accredited institution
  • Verification of training and experience with the ADOS-2
  • Strong interpersonal, interviewing, assessment skills, and report-writing skills 
  • Three (3) years of experience in clinical psychology settings 
  • Post-doctoral fellowship focused on ASD evaluations/treatment (preferred)
Licensure 
  • Licensed Psychologist, verifiable by the Maryland State Board of Examiners of Psychologists

DO YOU HAVE A DESIRE TO HELP OTHERS?


We are growing our team and looking for compassionate caregivers to provide companion care and daily living assistance to the elderly and those requiring recuperative or continuing care.

Here at Home Helpers, our mission is to improve lives through dedicated care.  Please do not apply if your main purpose is to find any job that will get you by in the short term.  But, if you are passionate about providing care, and are willing to challenge yourself daily to make a positive impact on the lives of those you care for, we want YOU on our team. 
 
We do not do any medical care, we are strictly Personal and Companion care.  Join our team today and make a difference in the lives of others! We offer flexibility and are able to work with your schedule.

Full Time/Part Time

Looking for an administrative assistant with bookkeeping and customer service experience. Pay Depending on Experience and Background

  • Answer Phones and handle incoming calls
  • Various Data Entry
  • Accurately enter time cards
  • Help with Accounts Receivable. 
  • Enter Credit Card Charges
Performance Competencies

·        Oral Communication – Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations.  Able to effectively calm excited customers, use questioning to accurately identify the type and extent of problem and describe the steps that will be taken.  Adaptable and able to think on his/her feet.

·        Written Communication – Writes clear, precise, well organized letters, proposals and emails.  The individual edits work for spelling and grammar and is able to read and interpret written information.  Uses appropriate vocabulary and grammar.

·        Planning & Organizing – Plans, organizes, and schedules their time in an efficient and productive manner.  Focuses on key priorities.  Effectively manages multiple tasks simultaneously.  Pays attention to details.  Manages personal time well.

·        Process Orientation – Approaches tasks with an understanding of the overall set of steps involved in completing the work.  Awareness of what is required for them to complete their job and what others require.  Has a continuous improvement mindset – is always thinking about ways to improve and streamline business processes.

·        Technology – Regularly uses standard word processing, spreadsheet and presentation software tools to enhance efficiency and accuracy of work performed and is capable of providing routine troubleshooting and user support for software and hardware used in the office environment.
 
 

Qualifications - Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

·        Education and Experience

Associates (2-year) degree in administrative or business-related field or high school (or GED) diploma plus three (3) to five (5) years of office or bookkeeping experience.  Minimum of 3 years of office and customer service experience.

·        Bookkeeping and Accounting 

Basic understanding of bookkeeping and cash flow.  Experience using bookkeeping software such as Quick Books, Peachtree, Great Plains, etc.

·        Mathematical skills

Adequate math skills.  Ability to compute ratios and percentages and to interpret financial reports and analyze performance against business plans and industry benchmarks.

·        Computer skills
Demonstrates intermediate to advanced proficiency in the use of computers and computer software, especially MS Office, Word and Excel.

·        Certificates, Licenses and Registrations

None required for this position

Wenco Industries Inc. is a family-owned business started in 1975 and continues to grow today. 
Our growth is driven by the strength of our culture and deep industry expertise. We believe in hiring and maintaining pride filled and empowered employees through an industry leading culture. We utilize the best brands, have empowered employees and a unique culture, which provides the best service to our loyal customers. 
Wenco Industries owns and operates 2 of the best brands in the automotive aftermarket industry- Midas Auto Service and Big O Tires. We are the premier multi-shop franchisee in the Rocky Mountain Region. Both Midas and Big O have a rich history and are some of the most recognized brands in our market space. 

We offer affordable benefits, 401K, Sunday’s off and paid time off. 

At Midas we are dedicated to providing quality services to customer vehicles in the areas of inspection, diagnosis and repair utilizing the expertise attained through ASE Certifications and/or years of automotive repair experience.
 
Position Summary 
We are looking for automotive service advisors to Supervise and direct all service department activities of a retail store engaged in selling tires and related automotive parts and mechanical services. This position is a Store Manager developmental role. Midas is committed to training our associates and promoting from within the organization.
 
Responsibilities
As a Midas automotive service advisor, you will supervise automotive and general service technicians in the operation of the shop while delivering exceptional customer service. Some additional responsibilities would be in the following: 
    • Communicating and connecting with Technicians to complete vehicle needs. 
    • Supervising bays and building computerized repair orders and sourcing parts. 
    • Deliver and discuss pricing estimates with customers as well as promoting shop service specials.
    • Customer consulting/sales for vehicle needs. 
    • Lead, manage, and train team while keeping in tune with our companies’ vision, purpose, core values, and Wenco culture.
    • Meeting weekly and monthly matrix goals 
    • Vendor communication and continuing strong relationship connections.
    • Overall cleanliness and organization of the facility grounds.
    • Other duties as assigned. 
Qualifications
  • A minimum of 2 years of customer service and sales experience
  • General automotive knowledge
  • Excellent customer service disposition
  • Good communication skills
  • Leadership ability
  • Team building skills
  • Ability to work a flexible retail schedule including weekends, evenings and holidays
  • Valid driver’s license
We are an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment on any basis including race, creed, color, age, sex, religion or national origin. We are committed to building a culturally diverse faculty.

Job Summary 
We are looking for automotive technicians/mechanics that are able to work independently of others, while also being able to work collaboratively at times with peers. We have a full-service facility and we are looking for automotive technicians to help us create an environment of success!
 
Responsibilities
As a Midas automotive technician, you’ll be exposed to and have responsibility for performing a wide range of diagnostics, repairs and maintenance, including:
  • Diagnostics using state-of-the-art computer systems
  • Tires and tire repair
  • Car heating and air conditioning
  • Steering and suspension
  • Belts and hoses

  • Brakes and brake repair
  • Oil changes
  • Check engine light
  • Mufflers and exhaust services
  • Visual safety and courtesy inspections

  • Ability to repair vehicles independently, while also having experience working well in a team environment
  • Knowledge in automotive brakes, exhaust, suspension, & engine diagnostics
  • Track record of high personal productivity
  • Knowledge of, and adherence to, safety and environmental standards for repair facilities
  • Experience using shop equipment such as lifts, tire changing equipment, alignment machines and scan tools
  • High School Diploma or equivalent - technical degree a definite plus
  • State-specific auto repair certifications
  • Valid driver’s license
  • Own tools/equipment (diagnostic scanner / tools preferred also)
  • Able to service both foreign and domestic vehicles

IT Project Manager 

Remote Flexible = WFH Monday and Friday, In office Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday

With headquarters in Lakewood, Colorado, and colleagues from Milan to Brazil this is truly a global team of innovators passionate about helping others realize their entrepreneurial dreams. We are a fast-paced bunch and openly collaborate across all departments. We take pride in doing our best work together and mostly we love celebrating our successes as a team.


As an established market leader in the Design, Print, and Shipping space we empower our network of owners to build upon AlphaGraphics’ and PostNet’s demonstrated recipe for success and continuously push the creative boundaries for our end customers.


As our plans and goals continue to grow, so too does our corporate family! We are eagerly looking for a Project Manager to join our team in Lakewood, Colorado.


This position will work with our internal stakeholders and development teams (internal and external) to leverage people, processes and technologies to deliver high value, best in class programs and platforms throughout AlphaGraphics.

  • The Project Manager will work with the CTO and development teams to ensure all development projects are properly prioritized, managed and implemented for stable operation of the Company. This includes documentation, project management, and management of systems predominantly built on a LAMP stack.  

 WHAT WE EXPECT OF YOU: 


The Project Manager is responsible for managing projects and other initiatives within the IT Department.  Working  across teams,  the essential duties and responsibilities of the Project Manager are as follows:

  • Identify new functional requirements including wireframe design with business stakeholders
  • Create requirement specifications
  • Work with offshore development team to provide a solution for the system requirement
  • Manage development team, and provide guidance in solution design and execution against prioritized requirements
  • Develop acceptance test scenarios and work with QA team to develop test scripts
  • Work with offshore UI team to create wireframes for the system
  • Ensure sign off from Vendors for all the deliverables
  • Act as a Single Point Of Contact (SPOC)
  • Provide thought leadership for the web applications and online user experience best practices.
  • Participate in estimation and project planning meetings
  • Create the High Level Design and Low Level Design Documents
  • Conduct estimation meetings & planning meetings
  • Supervise the offshore development processes and make sure that they meet the standards
  • Execute delivery management systems with efficient resource models and processes to successfully deliver development projects.
  • Works with VP of Technology to ensure the appropriate blend of onshore/offshore resources depending on specific project needs.
  • Responsible for enabling teaming between onshore and offshore teams.
  • Must understand offshore resource skill sets, experience, and availability to ensure appropriate fit with project assignment.
  • Assists with escalations and organizational issues.
  • Work with VP of Technology to define information and deliverable handoff processes.
  • Executer oversight process and ensure it is being adhered to by onshore and offshore consultants.


COMMUNICATIONS:

  • Ability to communicate with business and IT leadership at a business level and with engineers at a technical level and translate between the two
  • Leverage multiple communication channels for effective communication
  • Keep team members and peers well informed of changes applicable to them.
  • Provide proactive and timely updates to reporting manager, associates, peers and other stake holders
  • Actively participate in all department and company meetings.


The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work performed by those in this job. It is not an exhaustive list of all duties, and other duties may be assigned.

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE: 


B.S. degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or equivalent preferred.  5-6 years of experience in design and solutioning the web applications using technologies like PHP and RESTful web services.


Excellent communication skills


Strong understanding of Project Management 


Ability to work effectively with diverse teams, Self-motivated, strong communication and analysis skills


Ability to present to Sr. Management


Excellent Project Management skills with experience in managing remote development teams


3+  years experience in providing solutions around software development and delivery  platforms


EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

  • PHP 
  • Previous experience with project management.
  • Previous experience with project managing concurrent development projects.
  • Strong organization, time management, Project Management, and execution skills.
  • Ability to present to Sr. Management.
  • Ability to work effectively with diverse teams, self-motivated, strong communication and analysis skills.
  • Excellent project management skills with experience managing remote development teams.
EXPERIENCE PREFERRED

  • PMP certification.
  • Experience in the franchise industry.
  • Experience with Print Industry 
  • Working knowledge of controls for Compliance (SOX).
  • Experience with Websites, Ecommerce Storefronts, or similar

GENERAL SKILLS:

  • Team-oriented and places a high value on cross-functional participation, values diversity, consensus, establishes trust, communicates proactively, embraces and fosters change.
  • Possess a strong sense of accountability and the ability to execute successfully in a complex and fast changing environment.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group including executives, managers, subject matter experts (SME) and vendors. Ability to work under pressure and adhere to deadlines
  • Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously and adapt to changes within a dynamic environment.
  • Be aware of his/her own strengths and challenges and have the desire to seek constructive feedback and self-develop.
  • Must be tenacious while maintaining integrity and trust

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT OF US:

  • Hard work, collaboration, humanity, fun, and laughter. We are a small, passionate, driven, and highly collaborative team that is fully invested in the success of our company, and value contributions from each team member

  • A commitment to professional development and support of your individual growth

  • An opportunity to make a deep impact and fully contribute to the growth of our organization

  • Annual base salary in the $70,000.00 - $85,000.00 range based on experience

  • Team and individual performance-based bonus up to 20% of your annual salary.

  • Highly competitive compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, PTO, 401(k) Match, Life Insurance, Short-term and Long-Term Disability, Pet Insurance, and a completely free Employee Assistance Program

  • Flexible start times and ½ day Fridays during the Summer and Winter months!

Job Description
Build a brighter future for all children. Teaching is more than a job. It’s an opportunity to foster curiosity, creativity and compassion in children—all while helping them develop a lifelong love of learning  .As a Support Teacher at Primrose School of Cross Creek, you’ll help to create a fun, safe environment for little ones as they explore and learn through purposeful play that nurtures their social, emotional cognitive, creative and physical development.

Make a Difference Every Day
• Spend your days building genuine relationships with each child.
• Help children explore the world, improve their motor skills and grow their vocabulary.
• Work with your co-teacher to implement the lesson plans from the research-informed Balanced Learning® curriculum.
• Maintain a well-kept classroom that encourages children to create, explore and make decisions with confidence.
• Discover what works best for each child as you teach them about the world around them.

Get everything you need to give children everything they need. At Primrose School of Cross Creek, you bring the passion, and we’ll give you all the tools and training to be successful.  Our Balanced Learning® approach was developed with early learning experts. It provides clear daily plans so you can focus your time in the classroom on forming connections with the children—and spend your time outside of school focused on yourself.  Classrooms come fully stocked with everything you need, and our supportive Leadership Team works every day to create a safe, healthy environment and a culture where all children and team members can thrive.  And if that’s not enough, just wait until you help a child learn something new and see their face light up with excitement.

Please Find All of the Benefits We Offer Here at Primrose Below:
• Competitive pay with annual reviews
• 8 paid holiday days off a year
• Sick Pay provided

• Eligibility for a Simple IRA plan (retirement with contributions from the employer)

• Apple of Our Eye awards voted for every other month (gift card given to “employee of the month.”)
• Paid time off accrued every week!
• Principle of Service and Values gifts awarded at each in-service
• Monthly staff appreciation gifts or events to thank our wonderful teachers!
• Early schedules given to teachers based on reliability and seniority
• Paid training and professional development: 35 hours initially, up to 20 hours per year thereafter
• Participation in the Primrose Teachstone CDA program, covering 100% of the costs towards earning a Child Development Associates Credential
• Participation in the TEACH scholarship program, covering most of the cost towards earning an Associates or Bachelor degree in Early Childhood Education

  • 18 years or older
  • Legally authorized to work in the United States
