Wenco Industries Inc. is a family owned business started in 1975 and continues to grow today. 
Our growth is driven by the strength of our culture and deep industry expertise. We believe in hiring and maintaining pride filled and empowered employees through an industry leading culture. We utilize the best brands, have empowered employees and a unique culture, which provides the best service to our loyal customers. 
Wenco Industries owns and operates 2 of the best brands in the automotive aftermarket industry- Midas Auto Service and Big O Tires. We are the premier multi-shop franchisee in the Rocky Mountain Region. Both Midas and Big O have a rich history and are some of the most recognized brands in our market space. 

We offer affordable benefits, 401K, Sunday’s off and paid time off. 

At Midas we are dedicated to providing quality services to customer vehicles in the areas of inspection, diagnosis and repair utilizing the expertise attained through ASE Certifications and/or years of automotive repair experience.

Job Specifics
We are looking for general service technicians that are able to work independently of others, while also being able to work collaboratively at times with peers. We have a full-service facility and we are looking for automotive technicians to help us create an environment of success!
 
Responsibilities
As a Midas general service technician, you’ll be exposed to and have responsibility for performing a wide range of automotive maintenance services, including:
  • Perform routine vehicle maintenance, including fluid exchanges and oil changes
  • Visual safety and courtesy inspections
  • Mounting, balancing and rotating tires
  • Replacing batteries
  • Changing bulbs, belts and hoses
  • Maintaining and cleaning shop areas
  • Other shop maintenance items as needed
Qualifications
  • Entry level technicians must have prior knowledge of automotive basics
  • Knowledge of shop equipment
  • Strong mechanical aptitude and troubleshooting skills
  • Deadline and detail-oriented
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Valid driver’s license
We are an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment on any basis including race, creed, color, age, sex, religion or national origin. We are committed to building a culturally diverse faculty.

Reports To: Operations Manager

What does a Carpenter do with Paul Davis do?

  • Serve your community when it needs it the most.
  • Communicate with clients and Project Managers the scope and expectations for rebuild.
  • Enjoy a wide range of projects and tasks from drywall to cabinets to finish carpentry.
  • Get results and set proper expectations for others.
  • Have fun and be part of a growing business and community!
Our skilled trades are a critical component to our operation.  You will be called upon for your skill and creativity time and again as we meet the challenges in insurance restoration.

Why The Team Needs You? Serving others in their time of need is not easy. We will need you to build foundational relationships based on trust, actively listen, and bring in work for project managers to complete. We also want a fun personality that enjoys getting results.

Why Join The Team? We are an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and commercial properties throughout the United States and Canada. Built upon principles of customer service, dynamic decision-making and leadership, we have the tools to continue our rapid growth.

Values: Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.
Vision: To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need
Mission: To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results
 
Team Compensation and Benefits:

  • Ongoing Leadership Development Program and industry events
  • Access to Paul Davis University and regular training opportunities
  • Benefits
  • Flexible schedule
  • Profit sharing
  • RRSP matching
 
Team Qualifications (Requirements):

  • Ability to clearly deliver truth and give certainty when property owners need it most
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Valid Driver’s license and satisfactory driving record required
  • Having our own tools and vehicle
  • High level of organization
  • Significant training and or experience in carpentry, drywall and painting
Role on the Team (Job Functions):

  • Carpentry - framing, finish carpentry, roof construction, decks, fences, drywall
 
Skills Desired of Team Member:

  • Self-motivated to get results
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Strong carpentry skills and understanding of construction.

WHO IS NAPA?

"We're in the business of people; we just happen to sell parts" (Bob Dyson, Owner). At NAPA we value a healthy work-life balance while reaching our goals. If this resonates with you, then NAPA Auto Parts is the company for you! 

JOB PURPOSE: 

The Accounts Payable Specialist is responsible for tracking and paying all received invoices and statements. This position is a key contact point for our store managers and outside vendors to ensure all bills are being paid accurately. 

DUTIES: 

  • Build good relationships with NAPA employees and outside vendors
  • Balance and reconcile statements 
  • Pay all bills on time. 
  • Assist stores with questions and problem solving. 
  • Keep organized records

BENEFITS:

  • Paid Time Off
  • Paid holidays
  • Medical
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • 401 (k) match
  • Store discount 
  • Mon-Fri 8am-5pm schedule

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Previous experience in accounts payable. 
  • GED preferred. 
  • High attention to detail 
  • Trustworthy with confidential information
  • Works well with others. 
*This is not a complete list of responsibilities. Other duties may be required as needed.

column4:
Overview

Gold's Gym Housekeeping Associates/ Porters are vital members of the gym staff team.  They ensure that the facility is clean and meets the expectations of members.  Housekeeping Associates will be responsible for any combination of cleaning duties on the gym floor, equipment, and locker rooms.  Housekeepers work under the direction of the Gym Manager. 
 
Responsibilities
Housekeeping Associates perform any combination of light cleaning duties to maintain the gym in a clean and orderly manner.  Some of the various duties housekeepers have include:
 
  • Cleans outside glass
  • Wipes down equipment, doors and floors as necessary
  • Empties trash receptacles daily
  • Sweeps and mops floors/stairwells/staircases 
  • Cleans carpets and floors as needed
  • Changes light bulbs as necessary
  • Cleans all fitness equipment, bathrooms (tile, tub, walls and sink), mirrors and glass, 
  • Dusts furniture and fixtures daily
  • Cleans the management offices weekly
  • Mops and sweeps lobby floors
  • Cleans the locker room (sweeps, mops, trash removal, dusts, cleans out lint); buffs locker/lobby room floor
  • Maintains and organizes mops, brooms, vacuum cleaners and other equipment/supplies in good condition in designated storage areas
  • Picks up debris on carpet and vacuums carpet
  • Replaces or adds required supplies in locker rooms and restrooms
  • Cleans vacuum cleaner bags or canister daily
  • Reports maintenance problems in an accurate and timely matter 
  • Performs monthly/ weekly deep cleanings as assigned by  management, such as window cleaning, equipment dusting, spot-cleaning walls, etc.
Qualifications
  • At least three (3) months experience in housekeeping or janitorial services and three (3) months customer service experience desired; experience in hospitality or health clubs is a plus
  • High school diploma or general education degree (GED) preferred
  • Must be able to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing                        
  • Must have excellent organization, interpersonal and time management skills
  • Must have proven ability to work both collaboratively and autonomously
  • Must be able to collaborate and work as part of a team in a professional manner

An expeditor, also known as a food expeditor or just “expo” for short, is responsible for project management within the various departments of a restaurant, from expediting food service, to supply management, to the flow of communication. The food expeditor acts as a liaison between the kitchen staff and the waitstaff, which ensures a steady workflow throughout the various departments of a restaurant. An expeditor is also responsible for facilitating kitchen orders, maintaining quality control, and monitoring food safety.

Our Expeditor will be responsible for:
  • Process orders quickly. An expeditor organizes ticket orders—which is a printed ticket for an order a customer places—and helps the kitchen staff to prioritize outgoing meals. The expeditor ensures that no orders are lost, forgotten, or delayed.
  • Maintain quality control. The expeditor is the final line of defense for quality control of the food. As expeditors pick up outgoing dishes from the pass—or the surface where completed dishes are placed in the kitchen—they must ensure that the temperature of the food is perfect and that all food safety regulations have been followed. An expeditor may also plate the food or add final garnishes or condiments.
  • Deliver food to tables. Expeditors sometimes assist wait staff in delivering plates to customers. In this role, an expeditor must listen carefully to the customer and relay any complaints or requests to the kitchen staff.
  • Monitor the storeroom. Along with the kitchen porter, the expeditor is responsible for overseeing inventory management of the storeroom and the kitchen. A good expeditor should be aware of all inventory delivery dates, purchase orders, and ensure the procurement of supplies that are running low.
  • Facilitate communication between the front of house and the kitchen. The expeditor is responsible for the steady flow of information between different departments in a restaurant—like wait staff, kitchen, and management. The expeditor ensures that the different departments of a restaurant can communicate without leaving their stations.

For more than 60 years, ServiceMaster Clean has been creating cleaner, healthier, safer work environments for our customers. As a ServiceMaster Service Partner, you belong to a team that works together to deliver the best solutions and customer service to our clients. 
 
Job Position Description:
This position plays a critical role in staff and patient safety by cleaning and disinfecting the facilities to the highest standards. The EVS Technician is the front line of defense for patients and the spread of disease. They ensure all procedure rooms are thoroughly and meticulously cleaned and disinfected, which keeps patients, families and medical safe from the transmissions of pathogens. Duties include but not limited to:  
  • Perform all cleaning duties for facilities using provided ServiceMaster products, tools and procedures
  • Sweeping, mopping, polishing, trash removal, restroom cleaning, windows, dusting
  • Maintain inventory of supplies and equipment.
  • Use proper PPE where required
Physical Demands and Qualifications:
  • Constant (up to 100%) standing, walking, pushing, kneeling, twisting, reaching
  •  Must be able to lift and/or carry up to 25lbs - 50lbs.
  • Ability to differentiate between cleaning products and uses
  • Will provide on the job training to those with strong work ethic and willingness to learn.
  • Contribute to the overall team effort including being in uniform, dependable and on time
  • Treat all co-workers and customers with courtesy and respect
  • Must have a means of transportation 
  • Good work ethic  
Apply and become a part of ServiceMaster, one of the country's most respected professional cleaning companies. We pride ourselves on creating cleaner and healthier environments for our customers, their employees, and customers. As a ServiceMaster Service Partner, you belong to a team that works together to deliver the best solutions and customer service to our clients.  
We offer paid training, excellent work/life balance, and opportunities for advancement, and a career path that matches your interests and goals.

Wenco Industries Inc. is a family-owned business started in 1975 and continues to grow today. 
Our growth is driven by the strength of our culture and deep industry expertise. We believe in hiring and maintaining pride filled and empowered employees through an industry leading culture. We utilize the best brands, have empowered employees and a unique culture, which provides the best service to our loyal customers. 
Wenco Industries owns and operates 2 of the best brands in the automotive aftermarket industry- Midas Auto Service and Big O Tires. We are the premier multi-shop franchisee in the Rocky Mountain Region. Both Midas and Big O have a rich history and are some of the most recognized brands in our market space. 

We offer affordable benefits, 401K, Sunday’s off and paid time off. 

At Midas we are dedicated to providing quality services to customer vehicles in the areas of inspection, diagnosis and repair utilizing the expertise attained through ASE Certifications and/or years of automotive repair experience.

Job Specifics
We are looking for general service technicians that are able to work independently of others, while also being able to work collaboratively at times with peers. We have a full-service facility and we are looking for automotive technicians to help us create an environment of success!
 
Responsibilities
As a Midas general service technician, you’ll be exposed to and have responsibility for performing a wide range of automotive maintenance services, including:
  • Perform routine vehicle maintenance, including fluid exchanges and oil changes
  • Visual safety and courtesy inspections
  • Mounting, balancing and rotating tires
  • Replacing batteries
  • Changing bulbs, belts and hoses
  • Maintaining and cleaning shop areas
  • Other shop maintenance items as needed
Qualifications
  • Entry level technicians must have prior knowledge of automotive basics
  • Knowledge of shop equipment
  • Strong mechanical aptitude and troubleshooting skills
  • Deadline and detail-oriented
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Valid driver’s license
We are an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment on any basis including race, creed, color, age, sex, religion or national origin. We are committed to building a culturally diverse faculty.

JOB SUMMARY
 
Greet and direct the public to the appropriate area of the office for assistance, answer phone lines, data entry, assist with social media, and provide friendly and knowledgeable service.
 
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS (But not limited to)

  • Assist members of the public as they enter the facility, directing them to the appropriate area of the facility in accordance with their needs.
  • Handle and oversee use of cash drawer and receipt for donations, t-shirts, and collars.
  • Answer multiple phone lines and provide friendly and knowledgeable service, answering questions in a professional manner and deferring to appropriate staff if guidance is needed.
  • Fulfill tasks as directed by staff members such as: Printing and folding brochures, making phone calls, mail-outs, etc.
  • Keep front lobby office cleaned, supplies stocked, and organized.
  • Social media management (respond to messages and comments, make daily posts)
  • Monitor Home to Home listings.
  • Create content and maintain our monthly newsletter, The TMAS Paw Print.
  • Assist with Happy Hour program.
EDUCATION, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES

·         Will be asked to communicate with the public in a variety of ways daily in a professional manner.  Must have typing ability, communicate clearly and correctly in written word as well as spoken word.
·         Must support TMAS policies and practices.
·         General use of computers and phones (must have experience with MS Office).
·         Must be upbeat, friendly, and highly motivated.
·         Must be familiar with social media.
·         Must be able to learn basic veterinary concepts such as vaccine protocols, deworming protocols, and information about diseases prevalent in animals.
·         Must be able to stand or sit for 8 or more hours.
·         Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds.
·         Must have good range of motion, have good vision, and possess good hand-eye coordination.
·         Must be able to work under stressful situations and work efficiently and effectively under those conditions.
·         Must be able to cope with varying degrees of injured animals and with euthanasia.
·         Ability to cope with frustrating situations and remain calm.
·         Ability to rapidly and accurately process information.
·         Ability to recognize the need for assistance and ask for help.
·         Ability to work independently and work as a team.

POTENTIAL FOR PROLONGED EXPOSURE

·         Prolonged exposure to various aqueous solutions, including but not limited to, dish soaps, laundry detergents, bleach, etc.
·         Prolonged exposure to hydrogen peroxide.
·         Prolonged exposure to various zoonotic diseases.

PREFERRED

Candidate should be a highly motivated, enthusiastic self-starter with a positive professional attitude.  Customer service experience preferred.  Experience working in an animal shelter environment or veterinary clinic preferred.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The offices and operations of an animal shelter can be high stress and very busy at times.  This position has mostly a set schedule, but can change based upon need.  Will mostly work during office hours.  Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday, and Saturday.  Candidate must be flexible with schedule changes and short notice requests.

Build a brighter future for all children.

Make a difference every day.

In order to inspire children to eat healthy, you need a school that inspires you.
Primrose Schools is a mission-driven brand, and at {{ account.name }}, there are not only opportunities for professional development and growth but also for giving back to your local community through Spring Fling and charity events.
As the leader in early education and care, our research-informed Balanced Learning® approach provides teachers with the tools and guidance to accommodate children’s natural curiosity and to fully support each child while building problem-solving skills and confidence.   
We are continuously working toward our mission of building a brighter future for all children—not only those who are able to attend a Primrose school—and every member of our organization plays a critical role in accomplishing that mission.
 
Let’s talk about building a brighter future together.

Build a brighter future for all children.
Teaching is more than a job. It’s an opportunity to foster curiosity, creativity and compassion in children—all while helping them develop a lifelong love of learning.
As an Infant/Toddler Teacher at {{ account.name }}, you’ll help care for little ones who range in age from six weeks to two year old. They are eager to learn about and explore their world, and through singing, dancing, and storytelling, you’ll provide a safe and loving environment that nurtures the social, emotional, cognitive, creative and physical development of each child. 
 
Make a difference every day. 
  • Spend your days building genuine relationships with each child thanks to low classroom ratios.

  • Work with your co-teacher to implement the lesson plans from the research-informed Balanced Learning® curriculum.
  • Maintain a well-kept classroom that encourages children to create, explore and make decisions with confidence.
  • Discover what works best for each child as you teach them about the world around them.
 
Get everything you need to give children everything they need.
At {{ account.name }}, you bring the passion, and we’ll give you all the tools and training to be successful.
Our Balanced Learning® approach was developed with early learning experts. It provides clear daily plans so you can focus your time in the classroom on forming connections with the children—and spend your time outside of school focused on yourself.
Classrooms come fully stocked with everything you need, and our supportive Leadership Team works every day to create a safe, healthy environment and a culture where all children and team members can thrive.
And if that’s not enough, just wait until you help a child learn something new and see their face light up with excitement.
 
Let’s talk about building a brighter future together.

About Urban Growers Collective 

Urban Growers Collective (UGC) was founded by Laurell Sims and Erika Allen in the fall of 2017. Rooted in Growing Food, we cultivate nourishing environments which support health, economic development, healing and creativity through urban agriculture. Our approach is to demonstrate and support development of community-based food systems where produce is grown, prepared, and distributed within neighborhoods. In this way, communities help themselves by learning how to provide for their own needs in a sustainable manner. 

We operate seven urban farms on 11-acres of land predominantly located on Chicago’s south-side. These farms are production oriented with staff integrating education, training, and production to meet program goals. Each farm site ‘demonstrates’ the capacity for both large volumes of production and the ecological and social impacts of farming in society. In addition to farming on 11-acres in Chicago, Urban Growers Collective focuses on two key areas: food access and education. To address food access, we operate the Fresh Moves Mobile Markets, a program that transformed three buses into farmers’ markets on wheels and sells fresh, culturally appropriate food on the West and Southside of Chicago. Our education programs include youth employment, farmer training, a head-start preschool farm, as well as urban agriculture and equity building workshops and events. 

Our core values as an organization honor shared leadership and collective decision making; racial, economic, gender and LGBTQ equity; as well as employee well being: we have witnessed how these values lead to thoughtful, holistic programming and yield environments that nourish and create prosperity. 

About Urban Growers Collective’s Youth Corps 

Urban Growers Collective Youth Corps engages and employs over 300 youth annually throughout our urban farm sites. Our farms serve as a safe space for teens to explore their interests, work collectively, share their talents and learn from one another. During their time spent on the farms, youth expand their understanding of many aspects of urban farming and community food system development. 

Through hands-on instruction, teens learn the technical skills essential for farming in an urban environment. Teens grow organic vegetables, herbs and flowers and participate in all phases of farm production. Teens learn to produce compost, prep growing beds, and how to identify, plant, harvest and market the vegetables growing at the farm. They also assist with general farm tasks, pest management, site beautification and infrastructure development. At many of our locations, youth also manage an onsite farm stand, increasing access to fresh, healthy, affordable produce for their community, and providing a window into the economic and entrepreneurial opportunities that exist within food system development.

In addition to hands-on instruction at the farm, youth explore the science behind farming, through several inquiry-based experiments and take part in nutrition, hunger, cooking, art, food justice and food politics activities. This program aims to serve as both a job training experience and to encourage leadership development. It is our goal that teens graduate with a comprehensive understanding of sustainable food system development and the ability to connect and communicate how the skills they’ve gained at the farm translate to any career path they may follow. 

Position Description 

The Youth Program Instructor will specifically focus on providing instruction during the Urban Growers Collective Youth Corps Summer Program, a six-week program focused on farming, community food system development and leadership. Looking for individuals with experience working with young people and the ability to teach a multidisciplinary youth program at a farm. In this position you will lead teens in daily farm work and facilitate workshops on science, nutrition, hunger, cooking, work readiness, food justice and food politics activities. The Youth Program Instructor will provide lead instruction and supervision of up to 17 teens. 

Primary responsibilities include but are not limited to: 
- Recruitment, supervision and orientation of Youth Corps Participants. 
- Independently deliver UGC Curriculum to up to 17 students in a farm setting. - Maintain organized student paperwork and daily attendance (paper and online). - Communicate with parents when teens are absent or late to program. 
- Coordination and planning of summer lesson plans and curriculum in partnership with the Youth Program Coordinator. 
- Enforce Covid-19 guidelines to youth corps participants while working on farm sites. - Report incidents or challenges to supervisors and complete necessary paperwork. - Assist with farm work management, community outreach and production goals as needed. 

Desired Qualifications: 
- Youth leadership development experience and skills. 
- Experience teaching in an interactive, project-based environment. 
- Interest and knowledge of food systems and organic sustainable farming. 
- Ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships with teens, parents, community partners and residents. 
- Experience teaching youth in both in-person and virtual settings. 
- Excellent organization, communication and follow-through skills. 
- Maintains appropriate professional boundaries in working with teens. 
- Ability to think critically and creatively. 
- Ability to work as part of a team in a collaborative environment. 
- Passion for food justice, dismantling racism, youth development and urban farming! 

Duration: 8 weeks, (June 12, 2023 – August 5, 2023) Orientation + program prep (2 weeks; June 12 - June 24 2023), Youth Program facilitation ( 6weeks; June 26 - August 4, 2023 ) Instructor Exit Interviews (August 5, 2023)

Compensation: Hourly, commensurate with experience (average $20/hour)

Will lead teens in daily farm work and facilitate workshops on science, nutrition, hunger, cooking, work readiness, food justice and food politics activities. Ability to travel and work on the farm, as needed is preferred. This is a year round program and there may be opportunities to continue instruction during the school year.

Ability to travel and work on the farm, as needed. This is a seasonal position only.

FranFund, Inc. is a growing financial services company, and we’re searching for a Retirement Plan Administrator. This role is an entry-level position within the Third-Party Administration Department. Each Associate works directly with a senior administrator to learn aspects of retirement plan administration, compliance, and accounting. 


About You
You enjoy a challenge and have an aptitude for math and logic. You enjoy helping customers and take pride in delivering quality work. You enjoy learning and improving your skills.


About Us

FranFund is headquartered in Fort Worth, TX, and is a leading franchise and small business funding provider. We help businesses get their doors open and then get bigger. It’s a big job, and we need people with big goals, big ideas, and big hearts to do it. Our team is small but mighty. We work hard to get the job done but take time to incorporate fun to help us stay connected and energized.
 
At FranFund, you will learn about a dynamic industry, while having the opportunity to make contributions from day one. Our teamwork-focused culture encourages collaboration, creative problem-solving, and delivery of top-notch services.

What You’ll Be Doing

-    Prepare and send work product
-    Invite clients to electronically sign 5500 and follow-up as needed
·         Gather, record, and track receipt of all year-end documents 
·         Other projects and duties as needed

Knowledge & Skills
·         Advanced typing and data entry skills
·         Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite with intermediate to advanced skills in Excel
·         Strong analytical and mathematical skills
·         Work well in a high-volume production environment 
·         Demonstrate critical thinking abilities and exercise judgment when needed
·         Excellent customer service skills with high attention to detail
·         Prioritize workload based on department requirements and customer needs
·         Ability to multi-task in other areas of the unit
·         Positive attitude and team-oriented
·         3+ years financial industry experience 
·         Retirement Plan industry experience is a plus  
 
Benefits & Perks
·         Competitive salary, PTO, and paid holidays
·         Robust medical benefits with generous employer contribution
·         Dental, Vision, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, Life/AD&D Insurance plans

We are proud of our Mission & Values and live by them daily:
 
Mission: Providing opportunity to business owners and their employees in a reputable and responsible manner.

  • Choose positivity- Attitudes are a choice. We strive to be kind, caring and optimistic. We turn obstacles into opportunities.
  • Celebrate success- Work hard. Have fun. Win. Make history. Recognize those who make each victory possible.

column3: Part Time Overnight Member Services Rep + Custodian
column4:
Title: Overnight Member Services Rep Custodian
Department: Operations    
Reports to: Club Manager
FLSA: Non-Exempt
 
If you would love working for a rapidly growing company that changes people’s lives for the better every day, helps them live healthier, doesn’t judge anyone, and supports their communities and the Boys and Girls Club (because they don’t judge either), then this may be your dream job!  United PF believes that everyone is a leader.  We define leadership as influence, which is independent of hierarchy and can be used positively regardless of the situation.
 
What’s your role?
As an Overnight Custodian you are a high energy, positive member of the team who loves to see results. You like to check things off your to-do list. You serve our members in a way that means the most by providing a super clean club as they work toward their fitness goals in a judgement-free environment.  You will create “raving fans” by delivering 1% service when you take pride in the details of the work you will do.
Some of your primary responsibilities:
  • You will ensure cleaning standards are achieved daily because members value this and we’re known for that too!  The details of your work matter…people notice!
  • You may not see many members on your overnight shift but when you do, you will assist them at the welcome desk checking them in.  You may even have a tour or two, member enrollment or other club responsibilities but 80% of your time will be devoted to your cleaning responsibilities.
  • Be a leader!  Be passionate – love what you do!  Have fun and invite members to do the same!
A few other things we want you to know:
  • Your schedule could vary although hours worked will be overnight, including weekends and holidays.
  • United PF offers competitive salaries, PF Black Card membership and opportunities for growth.
 
We would love to hear from people with:
  • Birthdate that confirms you are a minimum of 18 years of age.
  • Passion for serving others.
  • Custodial experience would be helpful.
  • Initiative to get the job done without supervision.
  • Understanding the physical demands may involve but are not limited to, communicating, standing, walking, bending, lifting up to 50lbs, reaching, climbing, balancing, kneeling and handling potentially hazardous chemicals.
  • On-time dependability because you know people are counting on you.
  • English language; ability to speak, understand, read and write. Bilingual - Spanish helpful.
  • High School diploma or GED equivalent.
 
About United Fitness Partners
United Fitness Partners ("UFP") is the largest developer and operator of fitness clubs under the Planet Fitness brand. UFP operates in the High Value Low Price (HVLP) segment of the fitness market and serves 1.1 million members across more than 190 clubs. UFP is diversely positioned across 14 states – Arizona (40 clubs) and Texas (26 clubs) represent its two largest markets – and multiple market types ranging from urban metro to small markets. The Company was formed in 2016 via the merger of five Planet Fitness franchisee platforms and has grown through consistent organic site development and four additional tuck-in acquisitions. UFP is headquartered in Austin, Texas. UFP is owned by American Securities, a leading U.S. private equity firm that invests in market- leading North American companies with annual revenues generally ranging from $200 million to $2 billion and/or $50 million to $200 million of EBITDA. American Securities and its affiliates have approximately $23 billion under management and based in New York with an office in Shanghai. 

About Planet Fitness
 Founded in 1992 in Dover, NH, Planet Fitness is one of the largest and fastest-growing franchisors and operators of fitness centers in the United States by number of members and locations. As of March 31, 2022, Planet Fitness had more than 16.2 million members and 2,291 stores in 50 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, Canada, Panama, Mexico and Australia. The Company’s mission is to enhance people’s lives by providing a high-quality fitness experience in a welcoming, non-intimidating environment, which we call the Judgement Free Zone®. More than 90% of Planet Fitness stores are owned and operated by independent business men and women.

Are you passionate about hard work and committed to improving the lives of others? Do you thrive in a supportive environment and love working outside? Then you are a perfect fit for our team!
As a Mosquito Control Specialist at Mosquito Authority, you will use proven mosquito-control products and techniques on both commercial and residential properties. Our Mosquito Control Specialists provide expert mosquito control in a friendly, respectful, and efficient manner. If you’re dedicated to impeccable client service and enjoy physical work, this is a great opportunity for you. 
 
The best part? There’s no experience needed! You will be provided with expert training when you join our team. 
 
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Participate fully in training opportunities provided to enhance knowledge and to meet requirements for licensing.
  • Work in a safe manner in accordance with state requirements, OSHA policies and procedures, and maintaining and utilizing required safety equipment when performing duties. 
  • Operate a backpack blower (up to 60 pounds) in heat and humidity, often through uneven terrain.
  • Responds to basic customer inquiries and requests and notifies owner(s) of complaints or issues to ensure timely resolution. Complete job documentation accurately and in a timely manner.
  • Maintain a clean company vehicle and operate vehicle safely and legally.
 
Requirements:
  • High School graduate / GED preferred
  • Valid Driver’s license
  • Job requires standing, walking, moving, climbing, carrying, bending, kneeling, reaching, handling, pushing, and pulling
  • Extended hours and weekends opportunities possible during peak periods
 
Perks:
  • Paid training
  • Competitive compensation
  • Additional performance-based compensation opportunities
  • Healthy approach to work/life balance available
 
About Us:
Our mission is simple: help protect families from mosquitoes and the diseases they carry. Each and every one of our team members is dedicated to providing the best services out there so our customers can enjoy the outdoors with peace of mind.
 
Join our team today! 
 
By applying to this position, I understand that I am applying to work at a location that is owned and operated by an independent franchisee, not Mosquito Authority Corporate.  I acknowledge that each independent Mosquito Authority franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Mosquito Authority Corporate is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

Fitness Consultant

The Fitness Consultant is responsible for promoting and selling memberships to potential new members and selling renewals/upgrades to current gym members.

Major Responsibilities:
  • Generates sales through Company–sponsored (walk-ins and TI’s) and employee sponsored (outreach and promotions). 
  • Maintains accurate records of all Company-sponsored and employee-sponsored. 
  • Follows up on all prospects by using established Gold’s Gym sales systems. 
  • Conducts gym tours using established Gold’s Gym sales systems. 
  • Conducts telephone inquiries using established Gold’s Gym sales systems. 
  • Establishes and maintains a minimum of 10 lead boxes/bowls in the community on a monthly basis. 
  • Must establish and maintain a minimum required referral program as defined by Gold’s Gym Company standards. 
  • Maintain FC planner using established sales systems. 
  • Must be current on Gold’s Gym Company pricing and promotion schedule.
  • Maintains information on club history, background, philosophy, facilities, staff and policies. 
  • Has a thorough knowledge of, adheres to, and enforces Company policies and procedures as they pertain to gym operations. 
  • Assumes responsibility for developing selling skills. 
  • Prepares for, attends and actively participates in sales meetings. 
  • Maintains a positive relationship with the rest of the staff. Supports other staff in achieving their goals 
  • Participates in all scheduled meetings as directed by the General Manager or Assistant General Manager. 
  • Successfully completes the FC Training courses.
Qualifications & Requirements:
  • High school diploma and some college course completion required. College degree, either Associate or Bachelor’s preferred. 
  • Excellent sales, communication and customer service skills. 
  • Must be able to successfully pass all testing requirements including gym tours, telephone inquiry, counselor planner audit, guest card audit, lead box/bowl program, referral program and corporate outreach program. 
  • Ability to achieve acceptable level of units per month. 
  • Thorough understanding of Gold’s Gym’s membership sales systems. 
  • Demonstrated understanding of the Daily Sales Stat report and its contents. 
  • Basic computer skills.
  • Current CPR Certification

Fitness Consultant

column3: Personal Caregiver / Part Time/ ALL SHIFTS/FLEXIBLE SCHEDULING/MILWAUKEE AREA
column4:
Job Description Personal Caregiver, Part-Time 
We Love Our Caregivers!  Right at Home, Milwaukee was awarded a “Top 25 Agency for Caregiver Satisfaction” based on a national, independent survey of hundreds of agencies.  Join the best team in town! If you have a compassionate spirit and enjoy serving others - especially Seniors and those with Disabilities, we have job opportunities for you. The application deadline ends soon.  APPLY NOW!
 
Duties 
  • - Provide personal care assistance that may include, bathing, grooming, dressing, stand-by assistance, respite care for family caregivers, medication reminders, physical, occupational or therapy exercise reminders, laundry / housekeeping / meal preparation, grocery shopping, continence care / toileting, transfers
 
What We Offer:
  • - An Employer who Cares as much about you as our clients.
  • - Caregiver satisfaction - Few things feel better in life than giving back. As a Right at Home caregiver, you will have the privilege of giving back to your community with every shift you complete. That feeling is priceless.
  • - Competitive pay.
  • - Flexible Scheduling / Flexible start dates.
  • - Part-time positions, weekdays / weekends.
  • - Shifts ranging from 3 hours – 12 hours.
  • - “Caregiver of the Month” recognition.
  • - PPE provided to ensure your safety.
  • - We try to match caregivers with clients near your house.
 
Requirements:
  • - A passion for serving Seniors, or Adults with Disabilities.
  • - Driver’s license and person vehicle preferred
  • - Reliable transportation to shifts within Milwaukee County.
  • - Smart Phone for using the “Caregiver Go App”.
  • - Ability to pass a drug screen test and a background check.
  • - Excellent people skills.
  • - Two references.
  • - Covid 19 Vaccination preferred
Suggested Requirements:
  • - Experience giving cares to Seniors and/or people with disabilities.
  • - CNA, CBRF, or in progress toward achieve either.
  • - Two references.
 
We individually review the care of each of our clients, and make personal introductions between them and you.  We have monthly Caregiver communication meetings to stay connected, share experiences and to help you learn best practices.
 
Come join our team! We have an excellent rating from both employees and client.

FranFund, Inc. is a growing financial services company, and we’re searching for an experienced Retirement Plan Administrator. This role is a mid-level position within the Third-Party Administration Department. Each associate works directly with a senior administrator to learn aspects of retirement plan administration, compliance, and accounting. 

About You
You enjoy a challenge and have an aptitude for math and logic. You enjoy helping customers and take pride in delivering quality work. You enjoy learning and improving your skills.

About Us
FranFund, Inc. is headquartered in Fort Worth, TX, and is a leading franchise and small business funding provider. We help businesses get their doors open and then get bigger. It’s a big job, and we need people with big goals, big ideas, and big hearts to do it. Our team is small but mighty. We work hard to get the job done but take time to incorporate fun to help us stay connected and energized.
 
At FranFund, you will learn about a dynamic industry, while having the opportunity to make contributions from day one. Our teamwork-focused culture encourages collaboration, creative problem-solving, and delivery of top-notch services.


What You’ll Be Doing
  • Maintain client accounts 
  • Advanced client communication and inquiries (corrections, control group, RMD, compliance testing)
  • Educate clients regarding Employee and Employer contributions 
  • Consult regarding exit strategy and facilitate plan termination process
  • Facilitate additional investments
  • Educate employer about responsibility to the 401(k) and employees (i.e., enrolling)
  • Document all plan transactions during the year (loans, distributions, rollovers, contributions)
  • Prepares all required and optional plan amendments and restatements
  • Perform year-end review of client data
  • Prepare plan financials and 5500 with all schedules
  • Perform compliance testing
  • Determine eligible employees based on census and plan document eligibility parameters
  • Invite clients to sign 5500 and follow up as needed
  • Communicate with accountants/CPAs regarding their clients’ ROBS plans
  • Provide training to staff as needed
  • Other Projects as Needed
 
 
 

Knowledge & Skills
  • High school diploma
  • Advanced typing and data entry skills
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite with intermediate to advanced skills in Excel
  • Strong analytical and mathematical skills
  • Works well in a high-volume production environment
  • Excellent customer service skills with high attention to detail
  • Positive attitude and team-oriented
  • 3+ years retirement plan industry experience 
  • ASPPA / QKA credentials is a plus
Benefits & Perks
  • Competitive salary, PTO, and paid holidays
  • Robust medical benefits with generous employer contribution
  • Dental, Vision, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, Life/AD&D Insurance plans
  • Medical and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs)
  • 401(k) Plan with employer contribution
  • Varying degrees of remote work dependent on experience and location 
  • Continuing Education opportunities (QKA certification, ASPPA membership, etc.) 


We are proud of our Mission & Values and live by them daily:
 
Mission: Providing opportunity to business owners and their employees in a reputable and responsible manner.
 
Values: A Tradition of Winning Results
  • Model excellence- We are courageous, high performing problem solvers powered by industry expertise, grit, and accountability. We are continuously evolving, improving, and exceeding expectations.
  • Embrace relationships - We are a people-driven company with deep internal and external relationships. We demonstrate fierce commitment through teamwork, trust, authenticity, and unparalleled communication.
  • Expedite quality - We operate with urgency, never sacrificing quality or integrity. We’re trusted to do it right every time and we do.
  • Choose positivity- Attitudes are a choice. We strive to be kind, caring and optimistic. We turn obstacles into opportunities.
  • Celebrate success- Work hard. Have fun. Win. Make history. Recognize those who make each victory possible.

Does a thrill race through your heart at the thought of helping people find what they’re looking for?  Do people tell you that they love your speaking voice?  You could talk to hundreds of people all day, every day and not get tired.  The smiles of happy people make it worthwhile.  The only thing better is turning the team around you into a family…

We’ll cheer you on as your pleasant voice calms callers and points them to the right person.  You’ll schedule service requests and coordinate our field personnel.  You’ll be the main contact responsible for the efficiency and happiness of our team, and get paid like it…

Enjoy the comfort of a well paid position, medical and dental insurance, 401k and profit-sharing, vacation time, holiday pay and your birthday off (with pay) so you can enjoy time with your family.  We only ask in return that you stay nicely dressed, drug-free and as dependable as the joy in your voice.

Benefits/Perks
  • Career Growth Opportunity 
  • Competitive Compensation 
  • Complimentary Crunch Gym Membership
  • Discounts on services, products, and more!
  • A seriously fun work environment!
  • Training and Development Programs

Company Overview
Working at Crunch is more than a job, it’s an opportunity to inspire others to reach their fitness goals. At Crunch we Speak, Own, Understand and Live our Core Values.
  • RESPONSIBLE
  • KIND
  • INCLUSIVE
  • FUN
  • ALTERNATIVE
  • INNOVATIVE
  • PASSIONATE
What we need:
  • Group Fitness Instructors will have previous teaching experience in any or all of the following genres: Bootcamp based classes, Kickboxing, ZUMBA, TRX, Sculpt, YOGA, Pilates, Cycle, POUND, and HIIT classes. 
What you’ll be doing:
  • Deliver motivational instruction during the member Class-ic Group Fitness experience
  • Help members achieve their goals on their fitness journey
  • Respond with care to any member issues concerning group fitness classes 
  • Assist with accurately tracking class attendance numbers
  • Participate and be engaged with weekly emails, monthly ZOOMs 
  • Attend the quarterly staff meeting for onsite training and new quarter class roll out
  • Be involved with the instructor portal and social media for any updates and brand promotions
Who you are:
  • Outgoing and highly energetic, delivering exceptional and memorable classes
  • Positive, can-do attitude and passion for enriching the lives of others
  • Strong verbal communication skills
  • Exemplary customer service orientation
Your skills, education, and experience: 
  • Maintain valid CPR/AED Certification
  • Nationally Accredited Group Fitness Certification: AFAA, ACE or NASM preferred 
  • Experience teaching exercise classes for clients of all levels (any or all the following genres: Bootcamp based classes, Kickboxing, ZUMBA, TRX, Sculpt, YOGA, Pilates, Cycle, POUND, and HIIT classes) 
Physical Demands:
  • Congruent physical ability in alignment with Group Fitness Instructor expectations

Company Overview:

It is our dream to bring fine Japanese ramen to the world. We believe sharing ramen is a meaningful way to achieve a continuity of culture and connection in our everyday lives. Our team advocates the sustainable management of water and is passionate about initiatives to secure natural resources for future generations. Utilizing ramen as a gateway we hope to share our passion for the craft of making food, sustainability, community involvement and community enrichment with the world.

We believe that people make the difference, and we are proud of our employees who are committed to doing the best job possible. It is our policy to recognize the individual rights of all employees and to treat them with courtesy and respect by maintaining an atmosphere of mutual trust. Our staff is our most valuable asset and contributor to our company as we build toward a successful future.

More than just ramen.

Job Description:

AFURI associates represent the brand in the best light, maintain the highest level of service standards and provide service to each Guest in a conscientious, pleasant, and professional manner. AFURI Bartenders are welcoming, knowledgeable, cheerful, responsible, and confident. Our associates are invested in their craft and take pride in their expertise. Always smiling!
 
Preparation and cooking of food for service to guests. Supports fellow line cooks, prep cooks, and dishwashers in performing their duties. Familiarity with Japanese food is preferred but not necessary. Division of responsibilities: approximately 90% Line Cooking, 10% Non- culinary. The Line Cook is expected to be on the line cooking on their assigned station as their primary job duty.

The individual must also follow all appropriate Company policies and procedures outlined in department training and employee handbook in support the direction of the restaurant in the context of the restaurant group.
Reaching “Higher” is a key element in our success. We hire people that are friendly, take pride in what they do and share an affinity for taking care of the guest.

Responsibilities:

  • Working as a team with FOH and BOH to ensure consistency and timely experience for AFURI guests through customer service and food quality.
  •  Knowledgeable in all the menu items prepared in the station. Executes menus, recipes for all food as directed by the Executive Chef.
  •  Ensures that standard recipes and techniques for food preparation and presentation are followed correctly to assure consistently high quality and to minimize food costs; exercises portion control for all items served.
  • The “Shelf Life” of products is adhered to in accordance with the corresponding recipe.
  • Consistently demonstrates health department regulations for proper food storage in all refrigeration units and dry storage areas.
  • Ensures all food items prepared in the kitchen meet or exceed Company’s food quality standards.
  • Records all waste on the provided waste sheet but keeping waste to a minimum. Maintains existing controls to minimize food and supply waste and theft.
  • Ensures the station is prepared for anticipated levels of business.
  • Maintains high standards of sanitation, cleanliness, and safety. Practices “clean as you go” techniques in an organized manner, in food preparation areas and storage areas and floors.
  • Follows regular cleaning standards and maintenance schedule for all kitchen areas and equipment.
  •  Demonstrates and practices safe knife skills.
  • Knowledgeable in the equipment used on the line and always use in a safe manner following all safety procedures.
  •  Consistently demonstrates an understanding of health department regulations pertaining to basic hygiene.
  • Follows all Company accounting policies and procedures regarding employee meals.
  • Engages guests, coworkers, and managers with a positive, friendly, professional approach during all interactions.
  • Participates in all training initiatives to increase their knowledge about safety, sanitation, and accident prevention principles.
  • Attends weekly kitchen meetings when possible.
 
Qualifications

  • Must be able to explain and demonstrate the essential functions of the job, with or without reasonable accommodation.
  • Able to obtain a valid food service permit.
  • Must be able to work a variety of scheduled shifts, based on the needs and volume of the operation (example: late hours, holidays, weekend, etc.).
  •  Must work well in a high pressure fast-paced environment.
  • Follows Company and state safety guidelines to provide a safe working environment.
  • Must be able to continuously stand and lift up to 10 pounds.
  • Must be able to frequently walk, bend, and reach overhead.
  • Will be occasionally lifting up to 50 pounds.

If you have heard it once, you have heard it a million times.  We are looking for CAREER oriented people to join our growing team.

What might be different is the fact that we aren’t concerned with what experience you have.  The team at one Hour Heating & Air Conditioning is looking for great teammates who have a desire to further their career and their life.

Our administrative team is looking for the next great teammate to assist in all things clerical.  You need not be an expert at any of the following, but you must be passionate about learning and helping others:

-        Invoice processing
-        Accounts Payable & Receiveable
-        Basic payroll administration
-        Report generation
-        …and much more

When you join our team, you have access to these great benefits:

-        Health Insurance
-        Dental Insurance
-        Life Insurance
-        Death insurance
-        Disability Insurance
-        401k with company match
-        PAID day off on your birthday and company anniversary
-        Fun Friday’s
-        …and much more

Are you a jack of all trades?

Have you been going from odd job to the next odd job, but always yearning to put your skills towards a CAREER?

Two of Hampton Roads most recognizable names, One Hour Heating & Air Conditioning and Timely Electric, are looking for a PROFESSIONAL handyman.  The perfect team member will be someone who can pass all of our strict background checks as well as pass both pre-employment and random drug screenings.

Our goal, whenever in someone’s home, is to exceed their expectations.  The perfect team member will be clean, safe and reliable and will be able to assist with multiple different types of repairs.  Examples of work that you must have the proper tools for includes, but is not limited to:

-        Ceiling repairs (all types)
-        Attic and crawl spaces access creation and/or repairs
-        Minor wall and floor repairs
-        Painting
-        …and much more

As a full-time member of our team, you will receive great benefits.  Those include:

-        Competitive wages
-        Health, life, dental and disability insurance
-        Matching 401k plan
-        Paid on-going training
-        Company vehicle to use for work
-        …and much more

People who posses skills in carpentry and another field (HVAC and/or electrical) are preferred but we are willing to cross train to ensure steady hours.  This is a HANDYMAN position first and we are looking for someone who takes great pride in their work.

column3: Caregiver for AM shifts or PM shifts
column4:
Right at Home, In-Home Care & Assistance – We are currently looking to hire a Caregiver who 
wants to make a positive impact on the lives of those we care for. Our positions provide the 
opportunity for Caregivers to share their passion and dedication while making a difference in the 
lives of our clients. 
 
Essential Functions: 
*Personal Care Assistance: bathroom functions, bathing, grooming, dressing, and eating. 
*Prepare meals and snacks according to instructions. 
*Accompany patients on errands or medical appointments. 
*Ensuring the client's home is organized according to their needs and safety measures. 
*Provide support and motivation to perform daily tasks. 
*Provide mobility assistance: bed, chair, or a wheelchair. 
*Monitoring and reporting changes in health and needs. 
*Ensure client's rights adhere to HIPAA and maintain client confidentiality. 
 
Qualifications and Skills: 
  *High school diploma or equivalent. 
*HCA # (obtained via registration with the State of California). 
  *Reliable transportation. 
  *Current TB Test. 
*1-3 Years of Experience 
 
“Why Join Right at Home Inland Valley” 
GET PAID EVERY FRIDAY!  
Flexible Scheduling   
Employee Referral Bonuses  
Paid Training & Development  
Energetic & Attentive Office Staff  
Caregiver Recognition & Rewards Program   
Proudly Serving the Community for 12 Years  
2019 & 2020 Caring Star Award  
A willingness to work flexible hours, which may include weekends, night shifts, and holidays.  
CALL (909) 795-8838 to set up an interview today! We are looking forward to your call!

Full Time & Part Time, Monday-Sunday flexible shifts between 6am-9pm. Pay based on experience,$18-22/hour with sick pay accrual.
$500 SIGN-ON BONUS with 1st half at 90 days, and 2nd half after 180 days. Staff is revered and treated like family!
Healthcare and Personal Training Students Welcome! Great position for Fitness Instructors and Athletic Trainers.

Looking for Health, Wellness and Fitness Professionals to be on the forefront of a national movement, the Stretch Zone Method of innovative stretching techniques.

Compensation:
$18 to $22 Hourly

Benefits: 
  • $500 sign-n BONUS 
  • Sick time accrual
  • Room to grow within our company
  • Telemed option
  • Commission
  • 401K coming soon
  • No experience necessary
  • Flexible scheduling, part and full-time available
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Deliver one-on-one assisted stretch sessions.
  • All trainees must pass a week of training to learn and master our modalities.
  • Encourage and motivate clients throughout stretch sessions.
  • Build Stretch Zone membership and retain current clientele.

Stretch Zone is the world's leading source and educator for today's advanced practitioner-assisted stretching.

Home Care Pulse rated our Right at Home Franchise as Employer of Choice and the Leader in Experience for 2022 based on our caregivers' feedback as well as the benefits, bonuses, and flexible schedule we offer!

Location: Serving Dane county including Waunakee, Deforest, Sun Prairie, Stoughton, Verona, Monona, Madison, Middleton, Fitchburg, and more!

Hours: Flexible schedule

FINALLY... A job that is RIGHT for you!

Right at Home is seeking qualified candidates who want a meaningful career in caring, take pride in a job well done and are willing to work together to accomplish our mission: Improving the quality of life for those we serve.

Help Us Provide the Right Care... Right at Home

Benefits to Working as a Weekend Caregiver With Right at Home

A key benefit of working as a Weekend Caregiver for Right at Home is the flexibility you will enjoy in your schedule. Full time. Part-time. Weekday. Weekend. First, second, or third shift. Right at Home can create a schedule that works with the demands of your personal life.

Right at Home offers paid health, dental, and short term disability insurance.

Other benefits of working as a Weekend Caregiver for the Right Team include:

  • Gratifying Work
  • Competitive Pay
  • Routine performance reviews and pay increases
  • Immediate interviews
  • Direct Deposit
  • PTO - Paid Time Off
  • Holiday Pay
  • Mileage reimbursement
  • Paid travel time
  • Flexible Scheduling
  • FREE Online Training
  • FREE Continuing Education
  • Recognition and respect from the office staff
  • Full and part-time positions available
At Right at Home, we:

  • Truly value all that you do to make a difference in the lives of others
  • Make you part of a care team that works together to make a positive daily impact on clients and their families
  • Recognize that you are at the core of our business and a pivotal member of the team
  • Uphold our "No Stranger at Your Door Policy"- Right at Home will provide introductions and the appropriate training when caregivers work with each client for their first visit, ensuring that the caregiver and client are compatible and comfortable.
  • Have supportive management- We can be flexible around your schedule as needed. We work with you to resolve any client issues or provide more training when needed.
Who Are We Seeking as a Weekend Caregiver?

A plus if you have experience as a resident aid, facility, CNA, caregiver, or in childcare.

Caring, kind and compassionate individuals who want to make a difference in the lives of seniors while working for a company they can be proud of.

The Right at Home mission is "to improve the quality of life for those we serve," and we are just as committed to being an employer that values what you do and your role in our success.

Are You Ready to Join Our Team as a Weekend Caregiver?

We can't wait to meet you!!

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Spartan Invest in Birmingham, AL, is a full-service turn-key real estate investment firm specializing in property acquisition, renovation, and property management. We are seeking an Investor Relations Specialist to join our team. 

 Spartan has been frequently recognized by Inc. magazine as one of Birmingham’s fastest growing private companies.  Each team member is given incredible autonomy and responsibility with the expectation of high-performance results. The marks of a Spartan include being honest, industrious, dispassionately objective, and extremely focused. 
 
The objective of the Investor Relations Specialist is to serve clients as a first point of contact, advocate and trusted strategic advisor, with a focus on maximizing client ROI. 
 
Responsibilities: 
  • Strengthen client relationships by working closely with all property management departments to ensure rent payments are collected, rents are maximized, turnover is minimized, maintenance is addressed in a timely manner, etc.

  • Experience using Salesforce 
Total Compensation 
The compensation package for this role includes a base annual salary of $50,000 as well as the potential for performance bonus up to 15% after six months in role. We offer a comprehensive benefits package including PTO accrual that begins on day one and 401K with employer contribution after one year of service. We observe eight paid holidays in addition to PTO accrual and we offer paid parental leave after one year in role.

Starting Pay Rate: $15-17 per hour, based on experience, eligible for up to a $0.50 raise after completing a 90 day probationary period.

FINALLY... A job that is RIGHT for you!

What You’ll Do and Who You Are: 
At Right at Home, we offer home care services to senior, adults with disabilities and those recovering from illness or injury.  Our care falls into four main categories:  assistance with personal cares & hygiene, light housekeeping, companionship & safety supervision, and transportation.  You are assigned to clients who's needs match your skills and experience, we also orient and train you with each client you work with.  No specific training required, and honestly, being compassionate and having experience as a parent or having helped a loved one or friend in a time of need is the best experience of all.
 
We have a great work culture at Right at Home and look for people with a similar mindset. We are looking for people who are honest, responsible, energetic, dependable and social.  We want those who take pride in their work; cope well under pressure, love helping others and can thrive during a challenge. 

We take special care to ensure our employees are supported in their work - we strive to have you work with clients that align with your skills & experience, as well as scheduling you with clients based on the hours you are looking for and where you live.  We have clients who need visits through the day & night, so can find shifts that meet the schedule you are looking for, be it days, nights, weekends or overnights.  Apply today, and we can start creating your custom schedule.

Anatolia is a leading importer and distributor of ceramic and stone tile and is a major supplier to some of the largest distributors throughout the United States and Canada. Based in Toronto, Anatolia Tile & Stone is a privately owned 100% Canadian corporation that is growing rapidly. Currently we are looking for eager, motivated Business Analyst PI/PO to join our growing team

POSITION SCOPE: 
The Business Analyst (PI/PO) acts as a functional consultant to support the SAP implementation project readiness and continuation. This role is responsible for the design, delivery and support of interfaces between SAP and non-SAP systems that combine functional business processes with the technical message based integration tools. This role will ensure all processes related to PI/PO modules are documented and will assist with any testing, handle any standard PI/PO configuration tasks and will integrate new businesses to SAP as needed. This position will provide go-live and ongoing post go-live support and is accountable for collaborating with the internal user community to provide exceptional SAP functional and technical guidance that facilitates SAP utilization, process improvements, expansion and integration.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: 
 
  • Responsible for all phases of the life cycle across all integrations supported by the team, including blueprinting, mapping, development, configuration, testing, go-live, and production support
  • Following initial map development, provides significant time and effort focused on the daily production support tasks. 
  • Responsible for closely monitoring the exceptions in daily EDI transactions, and collaborating with internal and external teams to resolve all critical EDI issues within defined SLA 
  • Ensures all EDI transactions being processed on a timely basis and takes action to minimize the EDI transaction error rates and EDI related fines 
  • Works closely with Business Analysts and key users to define and communicate the key integration requirements for business processes 
  • Interpret customer/supplier’s EDI specifications; create/modify EDI mappings in accordance with the EDI specifications, primary EDI transactions include but not limit to: 850, 855, 856, 860, 870, 810, 846, 824, 864, 812, 820, and 997 
  • Configures AS2, FILE, FTP, SFTP, HTTP/S, PROXY, IDOC, RFC, SQL, REST adapters 
  • Coordinates testing with EDI trading partners and application users as well as tests and deploys patches and upgrades on EDI application/mapping 
  • Acts as a subject matter expert on EDI and SAP integrations with Non-SAP systems; creates/updates documentation and training manuals and provides training and technical support for EDI applications (SAP/PO) 
  • Designs and defines Anatolia’s own EDI specifications when applicable 
  • Prepare and deliver training to end users as required and provide user support after go live            
  • Assists with user requests when required to ensure an appropriate level of internal customer service is achieved. 
  • Performs other duties as assigned    
 
This position also includes: 
 
  • Demonstrated experience and ability working with complex information that involve unrelated processes and methods using different variations in daily routine
  • Oversight demands are very complex and has a high degree of challenge including providing/receiving direction with general instructions. 
  • Demonstrated ability to deliver recommendations on significant policies
  • Demonstrated accountability for quality, accuracy and adherence to work instructions with discretion required when exercising duties within pre-determined limits and procedures
  • Demonstrated capability to work with minimal direction regarding routine work that has vague or no affiliated process instructions as well as working to resolve complicated issues
  • Demonstrated understanding that work contributions have some influence beyond the immediate department and as such duties are executed with care, accuracy and compliance to instructions
  • Demonstrated ability to proactively come up with creative/innovative solutions and generate new ideas as nature of work requires a moderate degree of creativity/innovation in carrying out duties.
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with other departments as interactions are generally with peers within the work area
  • Capable of interacting with internal and/or external customers, providing them with correct information, straightforward support and common courtesy
  • Understanding that work efforts may have a minor impact on the employer brand and public reputation and as such ensure that behaviour and communications shall be professional and accurate at all times
 
QUALIFICATIONS:
 
    • Post-Secondary Degree in Information Technology or Information Systems related discipline required
    • A minimum of 5-7 years of relevant experience required within a similarly related industry is required 
    • Advanced SAP PI/PO expertise, specifically Data Integration tool suites, deep knowledge in SAP IDOC and related transaction processes  
    • Expertise in EDI transactions for ANSI X12, Familiarity with integration adapters (AS2, VAN) 
    • Deep understanding in SQL, SQL Functions, Data structures, Data investigation 
    • SAP S4 HANA experience is necessary
    • Detail oriented and able to work both independently as well as collaborate with functional, business user and external 3rd party teams
    • Strong problem solving and business analysis skills and experience, including functional decomposition, requirements gathering and process modelling
    • Exceptional English communication skills, both written and verbal, including technical writing skills
    • Strong attention to detail and ability to work in a consultancy role             
    • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities, ensuring deadlines are met on time and on budget. 
    • Self-motivated and directed, with keen attention to detail 
    • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with others of all levels within the organization 
    • Demonstrated experience and ability working with complex information as related to analysis, problem solving, and reasoning to provide substantial opportunity for planning and intellectual challenge
    • Must be adaptive to technical change and be able and willing to acquire new skills to support new business application 
    • Understanding of project management an asset
    • Must be able to provide flexible support with evening, weekend or off-shift support as required 
WORKING CONDITIONS:               
              
  • All work is performed in a standard office environment with limited exposure to adverse conditions or health and safety risks
  • Position requires moderate level of sustained visual attention, moderate manual dexterity on a regular basis with sitting at length.
  • Work requires the ability to sit for extended periods of time        
 
We thank all who apply, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
