JOB TITLE: Bartender
JOB DESCRIPTION:
The Bartender is responsible for serving every customer who approaches efficiently, while adhering to
established procedure for the preparation, service and close out of each transaction. Additionally, the
Bartender must service server’s the service well with the same accuracy and mannerisms. Bartenders
are responsible for presenting themselves as a positive reflection of the venue while marketing to
potential customers.
JOB FOCUS:
Focus is on, but not limited to the following:
 Acts as an ambassador of the venue, marketing the venue and all products offered to the targeted
customer base.
 Is aware of the impact individual behavior will have on the venue presents oneself as a public
relations steward always.
 Collects customer information for the venue database, while constantly striving to increase the size of
your personal clientele.
 Constantly provides customers with accurate information about the venue and property as well as
the entertainment offered in each.
 Meets marketing requirements established by management.
 Prepares all products per established venue recipes, focusing on proper portion size control.
 Welcomes all customers to the venue professionally and courteously, per the established venue
sequence of service.
 Works with a sense of urgency to anticipate customer needs. Work with the same degree of urgency
to assist other team members when the opportunity arises.
 Follows established cash handling procedures to close out all transactions, ensuring closing bank
balances with opening bank and POS reconciliation.
 Offers a sincere thank you and farewell to each customer as they leave the bar, using the
customer’s name when possible.
 Works with a high level of professionalism towards all customers, ensuring they will return to the
venue.
 Communicates with management and service staff immediately to rectify all customer needs and
requests.
 Communicates and work with all support staff to ensure bar is properly stocked and prepared for
operations.
 Communicates and work with all support staff to ensure inventory is maintained at established
par levels.
 Maintains a clean and visually appealing bar always.
 Cleans and maintains all bar equipment to keep in proper working condition, informing
management any time equipment needs repair or replacement.

Full Job Description

Web Developer / SEO Specialist Wanted

We are seeking a talented and motivated web developer / SEO specialist to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for creating high-quality websites, a strong understanding of search engine optimization (SEO) practices and online digital marketing campaigns. App creation is a plus.

Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain websites using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP

Implement SEO strategies to improve website ranking and visibility

Conduct keyword research and analysis to optimize website content

Monitor website analytics to track and improve search engine performance

Collaborate with the marketing team to create and implement effective SEO campaigns

Stay up-to-date with the latest SEO trends and best practices

Develop and Implement digital marketing campaigns



Requirements:

Proven experience as a web developer and SEO specialist

Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP

Experience with SEO tools and analytics, such as Google Analytics and Google Search Console

Familiarity with search engine algorithms and ranking factors

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Ability to work independently and as part of a team

If you are a motivated and talented web developer / SEO specialist looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity, we encourage you to apply. We offer opportunities for growth and advancement within our company.

To apply, please submit your resume, a cover letter, and a portfolio of your work.

Job Type: Part-time

Schedule:

  • Flexible
Experience:

  • HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP: 1 year (Required)
  • as a web developer and SEO specialist: 1 year (Required)
Work Location: Remote

Our caregivers are the heart and soul of our organization because they are on the front line for those we serve. Our caregivers have direct knowledge about the needs and interests of those for whom they care. Therefore, listening to our caregivers - their information, ideas, concerns, etc. is a priority for our leadership team. If you join our team, we promise to honor, trust, and listen to you because we care about how you care for those we are privileged to serve!

Job Description

  • We are looking for caregivers that want to learn and grow with us within the senior care industry.
  • We want you as a caregiver if you are reliable, dependable, honest, and compassionate.
  • Serve your purpose by creating in-depth relationships as a caregiver.
  • Help us provide rewarding in-home care for the elderly.
  • Help us provide meaningful connections with our clients.

Benefits

  • Flexible hours, full-time work available
  • Use our new Care App to track your work schedule, see caregiving responsibilities for each shift, help with family communication, and more
  • Competitive pay
  • Advancement opportunity to team leadership positions
  • Online Training programs include 12 hours of paid annual coursework
  • On-going CEUs available to maintain certification eligibility
  • Referral bonuses provided for exceptional caregiver recruits
  • Paid holidays
Requirements

  • Must be able to provide verification of any certifications held
  • Experience as a caregiver in a home care setting or skilled facility
  • Must pass national and multi-jurisdictional background checks, Department of Motor Vehicle checks
  • Must be able to meet quality standards of care during shifts and follow standard procedures for engaging with the rest of the care team
  • Must possess a valid driver’s license and automobile insurance
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $13.00 - $15.00 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
To keep our caregivers and client safe, we provide all necessary PPE gear.

Hand & Stone Massage and Facial Spa Frederick - Westview is expanding our team of skincare professionals! We have both FULL TIME and PART TIME hours available! 

Benefits GALORE!
  • Full Time team members are eligible for our benefits package which includes Medical Insurance with a generous monthly employer contribution, Dental Insurance, as well as a $25K Life Insurance policy at no cost to you! 
  • 401K plan with a 5% company match.
  • Paid Time Off available for both full time and part-time team members
  • Tips are paid out the same day - no waiting for your paycheck to get your tips!
  • We offer a competitive per-service compensation structure, with opportunity to increase overall earning per client with enhancements and upgraded services 
  • Service and product discounts
  • Our beautifully appointment spas have fully equipped rooms, including heated tables, sinks, towel warmers, and all necessary linens, tools, and supplies
  • We offer a variety of progressive treatment options to our clients, including Dermalinfusion, Cryoskin, NuFACE, LED Phototherapy, Microdermabrasion and more!
  • We provide continuing education and training opportunities to our Estheticians, investing in your professional growth and development - we celebrate our Elite Estheticians, those who have completed all vendor training and have elevated their knowledge and service to their clients
  • We offer discounts on liability insurance through our professional partnership with ASCP
  • Our flexible Lifestyle Program provides a steady clientele and our Estheticians are able to build their books quickly
  • AND MORE!
Our goal is to provide our valued members and guests a variety of skincare options that fit every skin concern and budget. Our facials and treatment options are results-driven, and our service menu includes the latest innovations including Diamond Glow Dermalinfusion, LED Phototherapy, chemical exfoliation, NuFACE Microcurrent technology, Microdermabrasion, and more! We have also recently added Cryoskin facial and body contouring services to our service menu as well. Our Estheticians are a critical link in ensuring that our guests' experience is nothing short of exceptional! This is achieved through a combination of in-spa progressive treatment options and building a home care regimen, designed to achieve the results that the client is looking for.

As an Esthetician, you will
  • Adhere to state and local licensing laws and regulations
  • Carry liability insurance
  • Effectively communicate with clients, spa management, and staff
  • Work comfortably within defined service protocols and approved service combination guidelines
  • Demonstrate a core understanding of skincare and skincare science
About FGG Spa, LLC
Hand & Stone is a national franchise that specializes in massage, facial, and hair removal services. With over 500 locations across the country, Hand & Stone is a leader in the membership-based spa service industry. FGG Spa, LLC is a growth-focused franchisee, currently operating 48 locations across 8 states. We have locations in New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Delaware, Maryland, Virginia, North Carolina, Tennessee, and Florida. The size of our organization allows us to offer benefits that other family-owned businesses are not able to provide to their teams, but at the core of our company and our company culture, we are still a family-owned operation. We offer  competitive compensation and a robust benefits package, while maintaining our amazing spa culture focused on our client experience and team wellbeing with a "family" vibe. We are in the people business, and our people come first!

We can’t wait to meet you!

Maid Right Cleaning Services: 
As a Housekeeping Maid, you will clean residential and light commercial properties. Most all work is done Monday through Friday 8am-5pm. Maid Right exists to inspire people to find, embrace, and unleash the power of extraordinary within a culture where everyone is treated with dignity and respect. 
  • Weekly Paycheck (Direct Deposit) 
  • Tips and Bonuses based on performance
  • No Evenings (Unless Requested) / Some Weekends
  • Paid Time Off for Birthdays
  • Quarterly Company Events
  • Monthly Recognition
Details about the job:
We're looking for great people who are ambitious with a good attitude, and are totally trustworthy! Become a Maid Right Cleaner today and we will pay you to learn all the tricks to a rewarding career!
  • Mon-Fri 8am-5pm 
  • Service Area: Bell County
  • This is a physical job (remember we 'glisten' here) and not a boring stand behind a register or desk job (*yawn)
Must Have:
We only work with team players. Must have a good attitudes, can communicate well. Please no negative attitudes or complainers.
  • Be 18 and over with a valid TX driver's license
  • Must have a car with current insurance
  • Speak & read English
  • Smartphone & bank account
HUGE Plus:
Being bi-lingual in speaking Spanish and English is a HUGE plus!

Our Meineke Car Care Center is an independently owned and operated automotive repair franchise. We currently have an opening for an Automotive Service Advisor in all of our locations.

We pride ourselves on outstanding service and a heavy focus on the shop environment for our employees. We’re looking to bring on new Automotive Service Advisors who are excited, passionate, and look forward to working at a fast pace!

Automotive Service Advisor Benefits:

  • Hourly + Commission based starting at $15/hr. + Comm (Parts & Labor)
  • Company Bonuses and In-House Spiffs
  • Health insurance after 30 days (Medical, Dental, and Vision)
  • Paid vacations, sick/personal days, and free uniforms
  • Only 5-day work weeks
  • Company-paid ASE certifications and training
Automotive Service Advisor Requirements:

  • At least two years in sales and estimate writing
  • At least one year working with customers and automotive technicians
  • At least one year in automotive service center management
  • Valid driver's license with a clean driving record required
  • Very competent in navigating computers and estimating software
  • Willingness to undergo a background check/drug screening
  • Position is full-time, five days per week
  • Excellent appearance, and verbal & written communication skills!
Automotive Service Advisor Responsibilities:

  • Answering phones, greeting customers, and consistently following up
  • Evaluating customer concerns, preparing the proper work order, and communicating that between customers and our techs
  • Selecting proper parts, preparing written estimates, presenting estimates to customers, and ordering what's needed
  • Participating in training when required
  • Key Holder - Opening/Closing the store location when needed
About Us

As a leader in the automotive aftermarket, Meineke is constantly looking for driven and talented individuals to join our team. In over 700 shops spanning coast to coast, we look for those who share our passion for high-quality repair work to help get our customers back on the road.

A career with Meineke means putting your knowledge and hard-earned skills to work in a locally-owned shop. Whether you’re looking for a position as a Shop Manager, Technician, or Service Advisor, Meineke provides opportunities for real-world experience in your local area.

For more than 60 years, ServiceMaster Clean has been creating cleaner, healthier, safer work environments for our customers. As a ServiceMaster Service Partner, you belong to a team that works together to deliver the best solutions and customer service to our clients.  
 
Job Position Description:
 
Supervisor responsibilities include working within a support team to train and organize employee shifts. This position plays a critical role in ensuring all assignments are preformed to ServiceMaster standards. 

Responsibilities
  • Assist in training cleaners on ServiceMaster’s standards, products, and procedures
  • Evaluate staff performance and ensure all assignments are completed in accordance to set task schedule
  • Perform inspections and provide constructive performance feedback to staff members
  • Respond to customer requests in a timely and caring manner
  • Must be able to communicate in English. Bilingual is a plus 
 
Apply and become a part of ServiceMaster, one of the most respected professional cleaning companies in the Country. We pride ourselves on creating cleaner and healthier environments for our customer, their employees and customers. As a ServiceMaster Service Partner you belong to a team that works together to deliver the best solutions and customer service to our clients.  
We offer paid training, excellent work/life balance and opportunities for advancement and a career path that matches your interests and goals.

We're looking for a friendly, helpful, and hard-working person to join our team. This is a great entry-level position with opportunities to expand skills and experience.

Responsibilities:

  • Preps and prepares hot food items
  • Replenishes items during breakfast hours

We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Payment Processing/Accounting Support Administrator. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the payment processing team by performing a variety of administrative tasks. You will also cross train with and assist the Accounting and Finance team in performing monthly billing and accounting administrative duties. 


Key Responsibilities: 


●     Receive, review and verify payment processing applications 
●       Data entry of customer accounts 
●     Assist with the preparation of payment processing reports 
●     Assist with the management of the payment processing system and database 
●       Review and respond to credit card disputes 
●       Assist Accounting with A/R including collections and bounced payments 
●       Assist Accounting with tracking unreturned equipment and generating invoices for such 
●       Assist Accounting with daily and monthly invoicing 
●     Assist as needed with other general Accounting and Finance Team duties 
●     Communicate with customers and clients via phone and email to provide assistance and resolve issues 
●     Perform general office duties such as answering phones, filing, and maintaining electronic records 


Qualifications: 


●     High school diploma or equivalent 
●     Strong attention to detail and ability to multitask 
●     Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
●     Proficiency with computer systems and office software, including Microsoft Office 
●     Previous experience in an administrative support role is preferred 
●     Experience in the financial industry is a plus 


We are looking for a reliable and hardworking individual to join our team. If you have a strong work ethic and excellent organizational skills, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Position Summary:
Jewels By Kris is located in Juneau, Alaska, with 1.6 million tourists visiting this season our sales professionals are welcoming, friendly, understanding, caring, dynamic, driven, and creative individuals who believe what they are doing every day makes a difference in achieving the same, ideal customer experience. Sales professionals achieve personal sales targets by turning every one of our customers life’s meaningful moments into a celebration worth remembering by offering a fine jewelry experience that is approachable, special and lasting. Our sales professionals engage customers in such a manner as to create a desire for and make our products as relevant, exciting and accessible to as many people as possible every day. We provide training on sales techniques, product knowledge, and skills to help you, our sales professionals, be successful and create a refreshing and uplifting shopping experience for our customers.Demonstrate the company’s core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion and safety of self and others.

Essential Job Functions:
  • Model Customer 1st behavior; deliver and encourage other associates to deliver excellent customer service
  • Achieve personal targets that drive sales 
  • Work with teammates towards store goals, creating a positive working atmosphere, and supporting each other to combine individual strengths to enhance team performance
  • Foster life-long emotional connections with customers by clienteling
  • Provide product knowledge, features and benefits to all customers when presenting merchandise
  • Advise customers on quality, cuts, and/or value of jewelry and gems and assist in selecting mountings and/or settings for gems
  • Attend required weekly meetings
  • Operate point of sale (POS) and take payment or obtain credit authorization
  • Inspect and clean customers' jewelry
  • Follow receiving and processing procedures
  • Display merchandise and promotional materials in accordance with corporate merchandising plans
  • Perform business opening and closing procedures.
  • Perform basic housekeeping, such as vacuuming carpet, cleaning display surfaces, cleaning merchandise, and washing windows
  • Maintain safety and security of location by following all Loss Prevention and Security policy and procedures
  • Participate in the inventory process
  • Complete case counts
  • Maintain flexibility to work.
Minimum Position Qualifications/Education: 
  • High school diploma or general education degree (GED)
  • Commitment to excellence, desire to grow and ability to provide refreshing shopping experience
  • Goal oriented and sales driven and passion to succeed
  • Minimum 18 years of age
  • Ability to pass drug test
  • Maintain confidentiality
  • Accuracy/attention to detail
Desired Previous Job Experience:
  • Sales, retail and/or jewelry experience

Job Contract:

April 15 - October 25
 
Benefits:

Round Trip Airfare on season completion
Accommodations during Contract

Line Cooks work to prepare food, help kitchen workers in the preparation of food items and set up allocated stations for menu, as instructed by Chef and compliant with standards. This position also arranges, prepares and break downs their station while maintaining the uppermost hygienic standards.

 
Duties and Responsibilities 

  • Arrive to work every day with a positive attitude, a willingness to learn, & prepared for the shift.
  • Maintain a strong sense of ownership of entire culinary offerings provided by Gin & Luck (G&L).
  • Execute Culinary offerings with a high level of precision and care.
  • Provide inspiration and creative influence to the Culinary Team in keeping with G&L Core Values.
  • Assist Culinary management in all special projects, kitchen operations and menu development.
  • Maintain patron satisfaction by executing, evaluating, and auditing food, beverage, and service offerings.
  • Maintain Company policies and standard operating procedures (SOP).
  • Maintain effective communication with culinary management team, FOH management team, and all staff.   
  • Maintain sanitation standards and procedures that comply with health and legal regulations with the advice of the Company.
  • Assist in oversight of kitchen staff programming (service and hospitality standards) to ensure all duties are met and exceeded.
  • Assist in maintenance of facility and provide opportunities for improvement.   
  • Work proactively with Event staff to execute all events to G&L standards.
  • Communicate with Culinary Management nightly in “Post Op” about any opportunities to improve function and product of Kitchen.
  • Assist in training of new team members.
  • Provide leadership to kitchen team in Executive Chef and Sous Chef’s absence.
  • Maintain a reasonable schedule with flexible availability. 
  • Maintain complete knowledge of products and specifications. This includes ingredients, descriptions, sourcing, brands, allergens, etc.
  • Use heightened awareness on any allergy table, and work to code according to our allergy standards.
  • Check in with any staff working in your respective space upon arrival. See if you can help before beginning your assigned duties. 
  • Comply with sanitation standards and procedures according to health and legal regulations. 
  • Maintain a reasonable schedule with flexible availability, including early mornings or late nights, holidays, and time for all staff meetings and tastings.  
  • Focus on always continuing your education and into all facets of our operations, be it the Bar, Kitchen, Service, Coffee, and Tea programs. 
  • The employee is responsible for getting a shift covered if they cannot report to a scheduled shift (apart from sick reasons). If they cannot report to a shift and have exhausted all options for coverage, they must contact their supervisor to problem solve no less than 8 hours prior to their scheduled in time.
  • Act in a professional manner and represent G&L graciously whether you are in house, traveling, or at another local establishment.
 
Demonstrate the Core Values of Gin & Luck:

  • Connection - We build relationships through intuition and empathy.
  • Professionalism - We are ambassadors of Gin & Luck, inside and outside our businesses.
  • A.B.K. - We execute with focus and work to completion.
  • Excellence - We will forever be chasing excellence; it is a pursuit without end.
  • Contagious Joy - When we're having fun, it emanates out and influences our work and the people around us.
 
Reporting Structure

  • Line Cooks report to the Chef de Cuisine and Sous Chefs.
  • Line Cooks work in tandem with the Sous Chefs, other Line Cooks and the rest of the back of house staff.
 
Compensation and Benefits

  • $xx/hr plus a point percentage of the full house tip pool, based on hours worked per shift.
  • Pre-tax transit benefits. (in applicable locations)
  • One fair wage
    • High hourly for tipped employees
    • Tipped out BOH (where applicable)
  • Gin & Luck Medical Benefits
    • Health, Dental, Vision
    • Free REVIVE Plan
    • Free Life Insurance
    • Optional 401k
    • PT employment benefits
  • Cultural Alignment among staff
    • Fun
    • Growth Oriented
    • Personal Ownership
    • Career driven
    • Team Minded
    • Inspired 
    • Proud
    • People First Company
  • Educational Opportunities
 
Physical Demands

  • The physical demands for this position are seeing, hearing, speaking, reaching, frequently lifting up to 25 pounds, occasionally lifting up to 50 pounds, sitting, standing, for 4 to 8 hours, bending, and moving intermittently during working hours. These physical requirements may be accomplished with or without reasonable accommodations.
The duties of this position may change from time to time. Gin & Luck reserves the right to add or delete duties and responsibilities at their discretion. This job description is intended to describe the general level of work being performed. It is not intended to be all-inclusive.

At Charlotte Aquatics, we make children safer, healthier, and smarter… all while having fun! Since 1996, we have had the privilege of providing over 90,000 swim lessons! In order to do this, we look for the best team members and make sure we help each of our employees learn and grow both personally and professionally!

Who we are – our 5 Core Values:

1. Passionate – We care, we make a difference in the world, we are saving lives.

2. Positive – We send positivity into the world with everything we do.

3. Invested – We are invested in our students and families and are committed to providing the best lessons possible.

4. Growth-Oriented – We are committed to improving ourselves and those around us.

5. Team Player – We support and help each other while lifting each other up and having fun!!

Our number of students is increasing and we are looking for new team members to join in the fun! To learn more about this role and see how you can build and develop your career, please see below:

Role: The Customer Activity Coordinator is responsible for developing, planning, and implementing 1) the Charlotte Aquatics social media plan across all channels by creating content and capturing amazing moments through photos/videos and 2) all strategic experiences/activities/events for the organization including decorating for monthly theme weeks, executing customer/staff appreciation events, and marketing events through social media and internal signs/visuals. The Customer Activity Coordinator ensures that the needs of our customers and team members are being satisfied, that they feel cared for, and part of a family! 

This is a highly creative position with room for new ideas. The position requires someone who is detail oriented, highly organized, and who can plan ahead strategically. We provide all necessary training, but you must come prepared with a love for working with/around children and a positive personality. Good written and oral communication skills are essential. Upholding a team-mentality where all employees support each other and are excited to be part of the family is FUNdamental!

Why Charlotte Aquatics is an AWESOME place to work: 

· We have fun!

· We foster a welcoming and inclusive environment and are accepting of all individuals.

· We offer paid training as well as rewards for continued development and learning.

· We support our team members so they are happy and thrive in their positions.

· We encourage creativity and positivity.

· We are one, big, happy team!

Come join us!

Build a brighter future for all children. 
Teaching is more than a job. It’s an opportunity to foster curiosity, creativity and compassion in children—all while helping them develop a lifelong love of learning.
As a Toddler Teacher at {{ account.name }}, you’ll create a fun, safe environment for little ones who are constantly on the move. Through a daily schedule of purposeful play, you’ll help lay the foundation for the school setting as children navigate a classroom environment, build their motor skills and grow their vocabulary.

You are also entitled to the company benefits package:
  • Vision
  • Health Insurance
  • Dental
  • 401K
  • Vacation (Year 1 to end of 3rd year, 5 days each year, Beginning Year 4 to end of 5th year, 10 days a year and Beginning Year 6 onwards, 15 days each year) 
Education Requirements:
  • 12 core semester units in early childhood education/development semester units
  • 6 months experience in a licensed childcare center or comparable group childcare program.
Make a difference every day. 
  • Spend your days building genuine relationships with each child.
  • Work with your co-teacher to implement the lesson plans from the research-informed Balanced Learning® curriculum.
  • Maintain a well-kept classroom that encourages children to create, explore and make decisions with confidence.
  • Discover what works best for each child as you teach them about the world around them.
 
Get everything you need to give children everything they need.
At {{ account.name }}, you bring the passion, and we’ll give you all the tools and training to be successful.
Our Balanced Learning® approach was developed with early learning experts. It provides clear daily plans so you can focus your time in the classroom on forming connections with the children—and spend your time outside of school focused on yourself.
Classrooms come fully stocked with everything you need, and our supportive Leadership Team works every day to create a safe, healthy environment and a culture where all children and team members can thrive.
And if that’s not enough, just wait until you help a child learn something new and see their face light up with excitement.
 
Let’s talk about building a brighter future together.

Come join our team!

Assisting Hands® Home Care is a national leader for In-Home Care services, we are looking for compassionate and dependable people to join our team.  Do you want flexibility, employee appreciation events, and a company that works side by side with their caregivers. Do not wait another minute, come be a part of a dynamic team. 

Description: As a caregiver you report to the Client Services Coordinator to provide one-on-one care for our clients to ensure they stay happy and meet the challenges of aging with dignity and compassion at home.

Duties may include:

·         Companionship
·         Personal care/hygiene
·         Light Housekeeping
·         Meal Prep
·         Occasional Transportation
·         Reporting Changes to client’s condition
*Other activities that are determined for specific client*

Minimum Requirements:

- Must be 18 years of age or older
-  Reliable Transportation (insurance)
-  CPR/1st Aid Certification/TB Test or ability to obtain one (reimbursement after 90 days)
-  Excellent Communication Skills
-  Comprehensive background check
-  Fingerprint Clearance or ability to obtain one

 One (1) year experience in the home or long-term care setting is preferred, , if you are new to home care we provide training.


Hours:  Dependent on assignment; Shifts available 24 hours a day, 7 days per week and based on availability.  Assisting Hands does not guarantee hours.

Benefits:

·         Competitive pay.
·         Paid orientation and ongoing training.
·         Time-and-a-half pay for overtime and federal holidays.
·         Flexible scheduling.
·         Employee Recognition Programs.
·         Opportunities for growth.
·         401K
·         Medical/Dental/Vision
·         PTO

Are you tired of running from patient to patient over extending yourself?  Do you want to make a difference in a local Senior Citizen's life?  Is your goal to offer quality care and enhance someone's living situation?   

   We want the best CNA's to join our growing team and help keep our individual clients at home, comfortable and independent as long as possible.  You will work one on one with our clients to provide them quality care and help them maintain a safe living environment. This position can be flexible around your current or upcoming school schedule, full-time or part-time. 
   
Pay:

$19 - $22 per hour (DOE)

Hours:

Dependent on assignments (24 hrs. a day/7 day a week and based on availability)

Requirements:

  • Arizona CNA license required
  • New graduates welcome to apply!
Duties my include:

  • Companionship
  • Personal Care
  • Light Housekeeping
  • Meal Prep
  • Occasional Transportation
Benefits:

  • Competitive Pay
  • Shift differential/OT (depending on assignment)
  • Paid orientation, ongoing training
  • Time and a half pay for OT and Federal Holiday's
  • Flexible scheduling
  • Employee Recognition Programs
  • Opportunities for growth
  • 401K
  • Medical/Dental/Vision
  • PTO

Assisting Hands Home Care is expanding to help local facilities take care of their residents and provide them with exceptional care  while keeping them safe, independent and happy.  We are looking for someone who is compassionate and has an amazing personality to work with these seniors who need help with their daily living.  If you have facility experience, are a self-starter, like to stay busy and can multi-task, then we want you to apply for this new and expanding position.


CERTIFIED CAREGIVER QUALIFICATIONS

  • State of Arizona Caregiver Certification.
  • CNAs or uncertified caregivers, will need additional training to work in this position and at the Certified Caregiver wage rate.
  • Must possess a current CPR/First Aid certificate and update as needed.
  • Must be able to pass a criminal background check upon hire and as required by state regulations.

CERTIFIED CAREGIVER RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Assisting residents with activities of daily living, to include:  bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, eating, transferring, and mobility.
  • Provide prompt, professional service while engaging residents in conversation, socialization and assisting in their daily needs.
  • Keep the living space and areas safe and clean for residents.
  • Observe and uphold resident rights at all times.
  • Responds to all resident needs and/or requests for care promptly, and provides or obtains assistance with care as necessary.
  • Observe, document and report changes in physical, emotional, mental, or behavioral condition, unusual symptoms, accidents, injuries, or unusual occurrences of residents.
  • Other duties as assigned.
Benefits:

  • Competitive Pay ($17+/hour, DOE)
  • Shift differential/OT (depending on assignment)
  • Paid orientation, ongoing training
  • Time and a half pay for OT and Federal Holiday's
  • Flexible scheduling
  • Employee Recognition Programs
  • Opportunities for growth
  • 401K
  • Medical/Dental/Vision
  • PTO

Do you want to have FUN at WORK?

Do you love kids?

Do you want great pay and flexible but consistent part-time hours?

Do you want to make a difference in the community?

The Swim Instructor position at British Swim School is an opportunity to make a real difference in the lives of others and have a great time while doing it!  We are the premium water safety and learn-to-swim program in the United States. We are looking for outstanding individuals to join our amazing team of swim instructors who teach skills in a fun and gentle environment and help save people’s lives.

Absolutely NO experience necessary!  Great attitude, reliability, and the ability to enjoy yourself and kids in the water is required!!

Why should you apply

  • Flexible Schedule – we can be your “side hustle”
  • Highly competitive compensation- starting at $18!
  •  Paid training
  • A FUN atmosphere and opportunity to leave a legacy in children’s lives
What we need from you

  • Love for the water and working with kids
  • Consistent and reliable work ethic
  • Lots of energy and a positive attitude

column4: Edelman Spine & Orthopaedic physical therapy seeks a full time physical therapist to join their team of seasoned clinicians.  We are an outpatient, orthopaedic clinic in Dover, Delaware that boasts 8 large, private treatment rooms with high low tables.  A manual therapist's dream!  We foster one-on-one treatment sessions for patient centered care and offer plenty of support personnel to enhance your day.  This is a rare opportunity to be surrounded by a handful of physical therapists with years of experience.  We strive to improve our skills every day and share ideas in a fun, collegial environment.  We offer a competitive salary that is based on years of experience and advanced degrees.  We encourage new graduates and seasoned clinicians to apply.  Benefits include: 401K with employer match, profit sharing, life, and short and long term care insurance, APTA membership and continuing education funding.

column4:
Live your best life possible by helping others live theirs. Our Caregivers are the heart and soul of what we do. At ComForCare, we like to celebrate successes and have fun while building meaningful relationships. Join our team and be a part of a certified Great Place To Work®! 

 

Let our caregivers tell you how we put our caregivers first:

"I enjoy my job because I can interact with my client. My client has memory issues but can communicate. There are times the talking makes sense. The family relies on me for interactions with other professionals who assess my client. They feel that I am an important part to my client’s daily activities and can give pertinent information to any ongoing care that may be needed.” 

Read more here.

 

What you’ll be doing:

  • Assist with daily activities to help clients stay independent and in their own homes.
  • Provide assistance with personal care.
  • Assist with mobility, transfers and range of motion exercises.
  • Handle meal planning, preparation and feeding.
  • Properly manage household needs.
  • Provide companionship and respite services for the family.
 

What we’re looking for:

  • A passion to serve and help others live their best lives possible.
  • High school diploma or G.E.D. certificate.
  • Access to reliable transportation.
  • Previous experience as an at home caregiver or in senior communities is a bonus.

Employer Name:
POOL SCOUTS OF SOUTHERN MD AND ANNAPOLIS
10665 Stanhaven Place Suite 300A
White Plains, MD 20695

Number of Positions:
Two (2) Pool Cleaners needed for temporary, full-time employment

Technician(s) Duties:
Pool Scouts of Southern MD and Annapolis is recruiting for Seasonal Pool Cleaner(s).

  • Must have reliable transportation to/from White Plains, MD with valid and clean driver license.

  • No experience required. If you are trustworthy and reliable, we will train you to service our customers' swimming pools. Pool Scouts is a residential pool service company whose mantra is Perfect Pools, Scouts Honor. Pool Cleaners travel to customer homes to clean pools, ensure proper water chemistry, verify pool equipment is 100% functional. We are professionalizing the industry and provide high-quality, recurring cleaning and maintenance services to our customers!

  • Maintain the proper chemical balance for the pool; maintains the pH and chlorine values for good water quality; maintain the pool and all water features using proper chemicals and cleaners; maintain the pool pumps and filters; maintain the pool area including cleaning of the deck and other maintenance tasks; respond to swimming pool related work orders in a timely, friendly and efficient manner to assess and repair non-functioning machinery or equipment; repairs and maintains electrical and mechanical equipment; transports and stores hazardous chemicals; carrying out scheduled water cleaning, using chemicals like chlorine; regularly testing swimming pool water quality and pH balance; tests the chemical levels in residential pools and other water systems and adjusts as needed; cleans residential swimming pool; operates and inspects tools and equipment and makes minor adjustments and repairs; operates vehicles to transport various types of materials and equipment; cleaning and servicing swimming pool filtration units; using swimming pool vacuum cleaners to clean the pool floor; checking and repairing corrosion, cracks and leaks in the pool walls or floors; using a telescopic pole with net to clean and remove any leafs or derbies; making sure equipment like pool covers, diving boards and slides are in good working order.

  • No education or prior work experience is required. Must be able to lift, push, pull, or carry objects up to 50lbs. Employer will offer 40 hours of work per week, Monday – Friday 7:30AM until 5:00PM, depending on weather conditions. Work on Saturdays may be required. Workers are needed to begin work on 4/01/2023 through 11/15/2023.
Job Requirement(s):
  • Hard-working with a can-do attitude
  • Reliable and demonstrate initiative
  • Customer Service mindset: confident, professional, friendly
  • Enjoy being outdoors and doing physical work
  • Valid driver's license (company vehicle provided)
  • Willingness to work flexible hours, including some Saturdays
  • Previous pool experience and/or mechanically inclined helpful but not required. We provide onthe-
  • job training.

Worksite Location(s): Work will be performed in multiple worksites throughout the Waldorf, Bowie, St. Mary's County, Charles County, Southern Prince George's County, Calvert County, Crofton, Arnold and Annapolis within the state of Maryland. Travel is required everyday

Wage Offer(s) and Availability of Overtime Pay: Workers will be paid no less than $16.50 per hour. Overtime hours may vary, depending on weather or other conditions, and will be paid at $24.75 per hour for any hours over 40 in a workweek.

Miscellaneous: The employer will use a single workweek as its standard for computing wages due; the pay period is every two-weeks (bi-weekly) paid on Monday by check. The employer will make all payroll deductions required by law. The employer will reimburse an H-2B worker in the first work week for all visa, visa processing, border crossing, and other related fees, including those mandated by the government, incurred by the H-2B worker.

Availability of On-the-Job Training: The employer will provide on-the-job training in the proper use and maintenance of tools and equipment.

Transportation: From the place from which the worker has come to work, whether in the U.S. or abroad, to the place of employment, if the worker completes 50% of the work contract period, the employer will provide advance payment for transportation and subsistence (including meals and to the extent necessary, lodging) from the place of recruitment to the place of employment. Upon completion of the work contract or where the worker is dismissed earlier, employer will provide or pay for worker's reasonable costs of return transportation and subsistence back home or to the place the worker originally departed to work, except where the worker will not return due to subsequent employment with another employer. The amount of transportation payment or reimbursement will be equal to the most economical and reasonable common carrier for the distance involved. Daily subsistence will be provided at a rate of $14.00 per day during travel to a
maximum of $59.00 per day with receipts. Tools, Equipment, Supplies, & Vehicle: The employer will provide workers at no charge all the tools, supplies, equipment, and vehicle required to perform the job duties.

**SIGN ON BONUS!!!  Certain rules apply**

ServiceMaster is seeking a full time day porter in a medical facility in Kettering, Ohio.  Duties may include dusting, sweeping, vacuuming, mopping, trash removal, cleaning break room(s), lobby and bathrooms.  a pre employment drug screen, background check and the ability to lift up to 25 pounds is required.

This position is Monday - Friday from 7:00am - 3:30pm.  (Half hour lunch break)

If you are interested, please submit your resume and then you may follow up with a text or phone call to, Amy Brown, HR Manager at 513-535-3681 (during normal business hours).

**SIGN ON BONUS** (Certain rules apply and will be discussed at interview)

Come Join Our Team!!!  ServiceMaster is seeking a part cleaner for a facility located in Hebron, KY.  Duties may include trash removal, dusting, sweeping, mopping, vacuuming, cleaning break room, bathrooms and lobby.  This position is currently 3-4 hours per evening (hours likely to increase on a daily basis).  5 days a week, Monday - Friday.
Start time can be between 5:00 - 5:30pm.

If you are interested in more detail, please submit your resume and then you may follow up with a phone call or text to, Amy Brown, HR Manager at 513-535-3681

Benefits/Perks
  • Flexible Scheduling 
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Careers Advancement 
 
Job Summary
We are seeking a Companion Caregiver to join our team! In this role, you will make a difference in the lives of people with disabilities by enhancing their quality of life. Responsibilities include assisting with hygiene needs, light housekeeping and errands, dispensing medication, and other tasks that improve the client’s living environment and standards. The ideal candidate is patient, compassionate, and reliable. 
 
Responsibilities 
  • Providing companionship and conversation
  • Assist with personal hygiene needs and dressing
  • Assist with mobility, walking, and physical therapy exercises
  • Prepare meals and snacks
  • Light housekeeping activities
  • Dispense medication
  • Assist with errands and shopping
 
Qualifications
  • Previous experience as a Caregiver, Home Health Aide, or similar role is preferred but not required
  • First aid and CPR certified
  • Knowledge of basic housekeeping tasks and cooking skills
  • Ability to adhere to all health and safety guidelines
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal spills
  • Compassionate, respectful, ethical

The ideal candidate for our Entry Level Management position will be a trusted representative for our clients, which requires having a deep knowledge and understanding of all aspects marketing, particularly with regard to customer interaction, client services, Customer Service and other outbound marketing tactics.
 
 
In this role, you will need to be comfortable with and capable of communicating the vision and benefits of various aspects of our clients on a number of marketing platforms. Team members gain hands-on experience with different platforms for each client. We will be communicating their advantages and disadvantages to audiences across all levels of our clients’ target markets.
 
 
Management Responsibilities
 

  • Development of marketing campaigns and strategies
  • Customer service and client acquisition
  • Maintaining current product knowledge and event promotions of our client portfolio
  • Execute sales and marketing strategies face to face with customers
  • Create and maintain brand loyalty through excellent customer engagement
  • Participate in on-going training to assist with business growth
  • Implementation of product launches
  • Rigorous leadership training
  • In-store promotional advertising
Management Qualifications
 

  • Exceptional Organization and Communication Skills
  • Strong Work Ethic
  • Student Mentality
  • Desire To GROW Into a Management Position
Benefits
 
 
  • Flexible Schedule! Full and part-time positions available
  • Career Growth! Management training with advancement based on merit, not seniority! Perfect for starting a new career or changing your career path!
  • Community Outreach! We offer opportunities to volunteer with charitable organizations

We are interested in hiring for Event Coordinator positions available for people with an interest in learning:

  • marketing & public relations skills
  • event coordinating and running the events
  • communication and client relations skills
  • brand representation & account management skills
  • recruitment, team building, and leadership skills
  • and other general business practices
We host regular on-site and digital training workshops to ensure you have a full understanding of how to promote a brand, engage with customers, explain features & benefits, etc. We also provide ongoing coaching and operate as a team because individual successes add up to the company’s overall success!

Marketing and Communications degrees are encouraged as they’ll be helpful to your development, but not necessarily required since we offer comprehensive training. We don’t have specific requirements in terms of work experience, however, it is recommended that you have some experience in working with customers in a role like:

  • retail sales, kiosk work, or cashiering
  • customer service or consumer relations
  • field marketing, fundraising or surveys
  • club, bar, drink, sports, or event promotions
  • food service, bartending, drink service, etc
We also welcome people from a background with a focus on teamwork, leadership and working together to achieve a common goal or celebrate a common belief.

Benefits/Perks
  • Complimentary Chiropractic Care
  • Employee Discount
  • Paid Time Off
  • Paid Annual Staff Development Weekend
 
Company Overview
100% Chiropractic is a family of full-service wellness clinics that offer cutting-edge chiropractic care, massage therapy, and a full line of supreme quality nutritional supplements. Our incredible doctors, assistants, and therapists care about you (our patient) and your individual health goals; and work directly with you to make sure they turn those goals into a reality. Chiropractic care can help in many areas of our patients' lives. At 100% Chiropractic, we don’t just treat pain—–we work to educate, inspire, empower, and provide lasting care for our patients to live their lives at their fullest potential. We offer the chiropractic care families are wanting, and the legendary 100% customer service they deserve. We encourage everyone to truly live life at 100%!
 
Job Summary
Chiropractic Assistants will assist the Chiropractor in running the office and assisting with patient care.  CA’s will answer the phones and schedule appointments at the front desk but are also directly involved with patient care. CAs will educate patients about chiropractic care to help them achieve their health goals.
 
Job Description
Looking for an AMAZING Chiropractic Assistant to join our office! We are looking for a dynamic, friendly, self-motivated individual to fill an exciting position in our chiropractic office. This position will have an active role in inpatient care. You must have a passion for your own health as well as for helping others. Individuals must also be outgoing and friendly, detail-oriented, and able to multitask efficiently. We are looking for a leader who will be able to embrace our vision and guide our practice toward continued growth.
We are a growing Chiropractic company with a mission to improve healthcare across the country.
We believe that we are providing the foundation to help establish wellness and well-being in our community. We are looking for a team member who will be able to embrace our vision and guide the practice toward continued growth.
We love our patients and staff like family and strive to provide the best quality of care available. Our company is an extended family of like-minded individuals striving to improve the lives of our communities.
You will be joining a team that includes over 85+ offices with locations from California to Florida.
You do not want to miss out on this opportunity.
We look forward to meeting you!
 
Responsibilities 
  • Answer the phone at the clinic 
  • Greet patients when they enter the clinic
  • Schedule patient appointments
  • Explain fees to patients and accept payment
  • Perform data entry in the clinic’s computer systems
  • Describe products available for purchase at the clinic and process payment for the same
  • Keep patient files up to date and enter appropriate charges and process payment 
  • Assist Chiropractors during chiropractic treatments
 
Requirements
  • Customer service experience
  • Passionate and positive about helping others achieve long term progress and results
  • Work history that demonstrates an ability to multitask
  • Superior communication skills (verbal & written) with the ability to connect with people while motivating them to achieve their goals

We are looking for a skilled and compassionate massage therapist to join our team. As a massage therapist, you will provide a variety of massage techniques to help our clients relax and alleviate pain and tension. You will work closely with our clients to understand their specific needs and tailor your techniques to their preferences.


Responsibilities:

  • Provide various types of massage treatments including Swedish, deep tissue, hot stone, prenatal, and sports massage, among others
  • Assess clients' conditions and medical histories to determine appropriate massage techniques
  • Communicate with clients to understand their needs and preferences, including pressure level and areas of focus
  • Maintain accurate client records and notes to track progress and improve future treatments
  • Keep a clean and organized work area, including sanitizing massage equipment and linens
  • Participate in training and continuing education to stay up-to-date on new techniques and industry trends

Requirements:

  • Valid state license to practice massage therapy
  • Knowledge of various massage techniques and their benefits
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to build relationships with clients and coworkers
  • Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends
  • Physical stamina to stand for extended periods and perform massage treatments
  • Customer service-oriented with a strong commitment to providing excellent service to clients
  • Must be able to pass a background check and drug screening




If you are a skilled massage therapist with a passion for helping clients feel their best, please submit your resume for consideration.

Plumbing Careers at Benjamin Franklin Plumbing®
Do you value professionalism and punctuality? Do you want to work with the best professionals in the plumbing industry? Then you could be a candidate for Benjamin Franklin Plumbing! If you are an individual who values a rewarding career and would like your customers to be genuinely satisfied, you may be a match for our team. 
 
JOB SUMMARY
A lead plumber serves the clients of the company by expertly servicing, repairing, and replacing plumbing systems.
JOB DUTIES
  • Utilizes Straight Forward Pricing (including all company approved forms) correctly on each call
  • Wears floor savers while in the client’s home and maintains a neat work area while performing a repair or scheduled service
  • Tests each aspect of the job before leaving a home to make sure everything is working properly. Ensures the job was indeed completed correctly and eliminates unnecessary callbacks after the job is finished
  • Explains each service performed to the client each time a maintenance or repair is completed. Ensures clients are 100% satisfied with all work
  • Conveys a safety-conscious attitude, both on the job and while driving
  • Maintains cleanliness inside and outside of vehicles at all times
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
  • Lead/Master Plumbers are considered senior level and typically operate their own truck
  • Lead Plumbers must have applicable certifications and licensing required by their state of residence

Overview:

  • Every day we make all efforts to serve the best food we possibly can. Be it our entrees, burgers, or wings we want every dish that leaves the kitchen to look and taste great. We are looking to find people that have the same passion for great food that we do. Are you that person? Do you love food like we do?
  • Everyone in the BOH is a key component to our operation. We do what it takes to help each other out whether that is stocking the line, jumping in if someone is in the weeds, we all have each others' backs and help each other out in order to keep the customers fed. 
  • We are a quickly growing company which means that there are always opportunities to advance within North High Brewing. This opportunity will be what you make of it. Come join North High Brewing and grow with us!
Qualifications:
  • At least 3 years of culinary experience.
  • A strong work ethic and desire to grow and learn.
  • At least level 1 PIC food safety certification.
Benefits/Perks

  • Medical, dental and vision insurance after first 90 days
  • Accelerated career growth opportunities, grow with a growing company!
  • 2 free draft beers for each shift worked.
  • Free meal with every 7 hours worked (every employee)
Lead Line Cook

Reports to: Kitchen Manager/Assistant Kitchen Manager

Job Purpose:

Under the direction of the Kitchen Manager/Assistant Kitchen Manager, the Lead Line Cook is primarily responsible for supervising and leading the line cooks and prep cooks in their daily duties and cooking activities. Lead Line Cooks ensure prepared foods meet NBH standards, are prepared with NHB recipes/procedures and are made following local, state, and federal health codes. Lead Line Cooks ensure a safe, sanitary and fun working environment.

Essential Functions:

  • Supervises all kitchen staff to ensure NHB standards are followed at all times.
  • Ensures proper stock of the line and all backup items.
  • Handles employee or guest complaints/grievances according to correct procedures.
  • Supervises kitchen preparation for service and leads the team during service.
  • Ensures all portion sizes, quality standards, rules, policies and procedures are maintained by all kitchen employees.
  • Assists the KM/AKM in ensuring all daily duties are done by kitchen employees.
  • Ensures that the kitchen remains clean and sanitary at all times.
  • Runs labor reports and actively works to keep the labor percentage below 20%.
  • Runs product mixes and knows how many backups of each item we need.
  • Ensures all stored food is properly labeled and coolers are in order.
Other Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Knows how to work the whole line and assists in training all staff.
  • Prepping, preparing, cooking and expediting food, including a la carte and banquet meals.
  • Ability to stand on your feet for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to lift 50 pounds.
  • Demonstrate a commitment to upholding professional standards in the work environment.
  • Ability to deal with co-workers in a professional manner.
